member.summary: Gets the ability of a specific lock screen app to perform background activity and update its badge.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCanceledEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that handles the cancellation of a background task.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCompletedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that handles completion events for a background task.

member.summary: Represents a method that handles progress update events for a background task.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundAccessStatus
member.summary: Specifies an app's ability to perform background activity and display a tile on the lock screen.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundAccessStatus.Unspecified
member.summary: The user has not selected "allow" or "don't allow" in the dialog box, or dismissed it without making a choice.The app cannot perform background activity in this state. However, it can request permission from the user to do so through the RequestAccessAsync method.After this value has been returned, subsequent calls to the RequestAccessAsync method do not present the dialog box to the user.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundAccessStatus.AllowedWithAlwaysOnRealTimeConnectivity
member.summary: The user chose "allow" in the dialog box. The app is added to the lock screen, can set up background tasks, and, if it has the capability, can use the real-time connectivity (RTC) broker. This means that the app can function while the device is in the connected standby state.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundAccessStatus.AllowedMayUseActiveRealTimeConnectivity
member.summary: The user chose "allow" in the dialog box. The app is added to the lock screen and can set up background tasks, but it cannot use the real-time connectivity (RTC) broker. This means that the app might not function while the device is in connected standby.Note that apps that do not specify RTC in their manifest will always demonstrate this behavior.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundAccessStatus.Denied
member.summary: The user chose "don't allow" in the dialog box. The app is not added to the lock screen.After this value has been returned, subsequent calls to the RequestAccessAsync method do not present the dialog box to the user. They have stated their preference and it should be honored.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCancellationReason
member.summary: Specifies the reasons for cancelling a background task.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCancellationReason.Abort
member.summary: The background task was canceled by the application.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCancellationReason.Terminating
member.summary: The background task was canceled because the application is about to be terminated due to system policy. The application should save any state that will be needed when the application restarts.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCancellationReason.LoggingOff
member.summary: The background task was canceled because the user has logged off the system.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.BackgroundTaskCancellationReason.ServicingUpdate
member.summary: The background task was canceled because the application was updated.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType
member.summary: Specifies a system condition that must be in effect for a background task to run. If a background task with a system condition is triggered, the task will not run until the condition is met.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.Invalid
member.summary: Not a valid condition type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.UserPresent
member.summary: Specifies that the background task can only run when the user is present. If a background task with the UserPresent condition is triggered, and the user is away, the task will not run until the user is present.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.UserNotPresent
member.summary: Specifies that background task can only run when the user is not present. If a background task with the UserNotPresent condition is triggered, and the user is present, the task will not run until the user becomes inactive.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.InternetAvailable
member.summary: Specifies that the background task can only run when the Internet is available. If a background task with the InternetAvailable condition is triggered, and the Internet is not available, the task will not run until the Internet is available again.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.InternetNotAvailable
member.summary: Specifies that the background task can only run when the Internet is not available. If a background task with the InternetNotAvailable condition is triggered, and the Internet is available, the task will not run until the Internet is unavailable.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.SessionConnected
member.summary: Specifies that the background task can only run when the user's session is connected. If a background task with the SessionConnected condition is triggered, and the user session is not logged in, the task will run when the user logs in.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemConditionType.SessionDisconnected
member.summary: Specifies that the background task can only run when the user's session is disconnected. If a background task with the SessionDisconnected condition is triggered, and the user is logged in, the task will run when the user logs out.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the system events that can be used to trigger a background task.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.Invalid
member.summary: Not a valid trigger type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.SmsReceived
member.summary: The background task is triggered when a new SMS message is received by an installed mobile broadband device.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.UserPresent
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the user becomes present.An app must be placed on the lock screen before it can successfully register background tasks using this trigger type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.UserAway
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the user becomes absent.An app must be placed on the lock screen before it can successfully register background tasks using this trigger type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.NetworkStateChange
member.summary: The background task is triggered when a network change occurs, such as a change in cost or connectivity.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.ControlChannelReset
member.summary: The background task is triggered when a control channel is reset.An app must be placed on the lock screen before it can successfully register background tasks using this trigger type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.InternetAvailable
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the Internet becomes available.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.SessionConnected
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the session is connected.An app must be placed on the lock screen before it can successfully register background tasks using this trigger type.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.ServicingComplete
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the system has finished updating an app.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.LockScreenApplicationAdded
member.summary: The background task is triggered when a tile is added to the lock screen.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.LockScreenApplicationRemoved
member.summary: The background task is triggered when a tile is removed from the lock screen.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.TimeZoneChange
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the time zone changes on the device (for example, when the system adjusts the clock for daylight saving time).

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.SystemTriggerType.OnlineIdConnectedStateChange
member.summary: The background task is triggered when the Microsoft account connected to the account changes.

member.summary: Represents shortcuts that help users share content with the apps they use most.

member.summary: An array of strings that specify the data formats supported by the QuickLink app. The system shows the QuickLink only when the data that a user wants to share matches a format in this array.

member.returns: Specifies the title of the QuickLink.

member.name: N:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management
member.summary: Enables the indexing of source resource files or containers, generating named resource candidates using particular file and folder naming conventions.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceCandidate
member.summary: Represents a single possible value for a given resource, and the qualifiers associated with that resource.

member.summary: Returns the value of a qualifier, given its name.
member.returns: The value of the qualifier.

member.summary: Gets the list of metadata name value pairs.
member.returns: A list of string pairs, each containing the name of an IndexedResourceQualifier and its value.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceCandidate.Qualifiers
member.summary: Gets the list of IndexedResourceQualifiers.
member.returns: A list of IndexedResourceQualifiers.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceCandidate.Type
member.summary: Gets the type property that determines whether the resource is a file or a string.
member.returns: A value from the IndexedResourceType enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceCandidate.Uri
member.summary: Gets the named resource Uri.
member.returns: The named resource Uri.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceCandidate.ValueAsString
member.summary: Gets the value of the candidate as a String.
member.returns: If the candidate is a file, the value is a file path (such as images\logo.scale-100.png) relative to the project root passed to the ResourceIndexer constructor. If the candidate is a string, the value is the actual string (such as Hello World).

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceQualifier
member.summary: Represents an object that declares under what context a resource is appropriate.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceQualifier.QualifierName
member.summary: Gets the name of the qualifier.
member.returns: The name of the qualifier, such as language, contrast, or scale.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceQualifier.QualifierValue
member.summary: Gets the value of the qualifier.
member.returns: The value of the qualifier. The case of the qualifier value should be preserved from the first instance of the qualifier discovered during indexing.Examples of the qualifier value are:100, 140, or 180 for scale.fr-FR for language.high for contrast.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.ResourceIndexer
member.summary: Indexes source resource files or containers, and generates named resource candidates using particular file and folder naming conventions.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.ResourceIndexer.#ctor(Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new ResourceIndexer.
member.param: The project root folder (file:// URI).

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.ResourceIndexer.IndexFileContentsAsync(Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Indexes a ResW, ResJSON, PRI, or PRI XML dump file path for file and folder naming conventions, and applies the qualifiers to the resources found within the contents of the file.
member.returns: A list of IndexedResourceCandidate objects found within file. This is an empty list if nothing is found.
member.param: The file to be indexed (file:// URI). The path must be an absolute path with the drive letter specified. The Uri can also provide an empty authority which is assumed to be the local file system. Long file paths are not supported.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.ResourceIndexer.IndexFilePath(Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Indexes a file path for file and folder naming conventions.
member.returns: An IndexedResourceCandidate object that represents the indexed file resource.
member.param: The file to be indexed (file:// URI). The path must be an absolute path with the drive letter specified. The Uri can also provide an empty authority which is assumed to be the local file system. Long file paths are not supported.

member.summary: Specifies whether an IndexedResourceCandidate is a file or a string.

member.summary: The IndexedResourceCandidate is a string.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Resources.Management.IndexedResourceType.Path
member.summary: The IndexedResourceCandidate is a file.

member.name: N:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search
member.summary: Provides support for the search pane in apps that participate in the Search contract. The search pane opens when users activate the Search charm and provides a consistent, touch-friendly search box and optional search suggestions.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings
member.summary: Stores settings that determine whether the app provides suggestions based on local files, and that define the criteria used to locate and filter these suggestions.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings.AqsFilter
member.summary: An Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string that limits the types and kinds of files that are used to provide suggestions.
member.returns: The string that is used to refine which local, indexed files are used to provide suggestions. By default, this string is empty. Learn more about in .

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates whether suggestions based on local files are displayed in the search pane.
member.returns: True if suggestions from local files are displayed; otherwise, false. The default value of the object is false.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the localContentSuggestionSettings class.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings.Locations
member.summary: A list of the storageFolder objects that contain files that are used to provide suggestions.
member.returns: The list of storageFolder locations that contain files that are used to provide suggestions. By default, this list is empty and suggestions are provided from the local files in all of the libraries for which the app declared capabilities.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings.PropertiesToMatch
member.summary: A list of the file properties that are used to provide suggestions from local files.
member.returns: The list of the file properties that are used to provide suggestions from local files. By default, this list is empty and suggestions are provided using all available file properties.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane
member.summary: Represents and manages the search pane that opens when a user activates the Search charm.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Retrieves an instance of the search pane that can be used to search within the app.
member.returns: An instance of the search pane, which provides a consistent, touch-friendly search box and optional search suggestions for searching within the current application.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.Language
member.summary: The Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) language tag (BCP 47 standard) that identifies the language currently associated with the user's text input device.
member.returns: The BCP 47 standard language tag.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.PlaceholderText
member.summary: The placeholder text in the search box when the search box doesn't have the input focus and the user hasn't entered any characters.
member.returns: The placeholder text to display in the search box.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.QueryChanged
member.summary: Fires when the user changes the text in the search box.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.QuerySubmitted
member.summary: Fires when the user submits the text in the search box and the app needs to display search results.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.QueryText
member.summary: The current text in the search box of the search pane.
member.returns: The current query text. If the search pane was not used, this is an empty string.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.ResultSuggestionChosen

member.returns: The search history context string.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.SearchHistoryEnabled

member.returns: True if the user's search history is automatically tracked and used to provide suggestions; otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.SearchPane.SetLocalContentSuggestionSettings(Windows.ApplicationModel.Search.LocalContentSuggestionSettings)

member.name: N:Windows.ApplicationModel.Store
member.summary: Provides types and members for interacting with the Windows Store. You can use the members of this class to check on the license state of the app and its in-app features and to enable in-app purchases. You can also use this class to simulate these functions before you submit the app to the Windows Store.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Store.CurrentApp
member.summary: Defines methods and properties you can use to get license and listing info about the current app and perform in-app purchases.

member.returns: The license metadata for the current app.

member.returns: The of the app's listing page in the .

member.returns: An XML-formatted string that contains all receipts for this app and any in-app purchases.

member.returns: An XML-formatted string that contains the receipt for the specified productId.

member.summary: Loads the app's listing information asynchronously. Implements the IAsyncInfo interface.
member.returns: The apps' listing information. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: Creates the async operation that enables the user to buy a full license for the current app.
member.returns: If the includeReceipt parameter is set to true, this string contains XML that represents all receipts for the app and any in-app purchases. If includeReceipt is set to false, this string is empty.
member.param: Determines if the method should return the receipts for this app.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Store.CurrentApp.RequestProductPurchaseAsync(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the async operation that will display the UI that is used to make an in-app purchase from the Windows Store.
member.returns: If the includeReceipt parameter is set to true, this string contains XML that represents all receipts for specified productId. If includeReceipt is set to false, this string is empty.
member.param: Specifies the id of the product or feature to purchase.
Determines if the method should return the receipts for the specified productId.

member.name: N:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom
member.summary: Provides support for the XML Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: T:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity
member.summary: Represents a parsed or unparsed entity in the XML document.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.AppendChild(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Appends a new child node as the last child of the node.
member.returns: The new child node successfully appended to the list. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The new child node to be appended to the end of the list of children of this node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the list of attributes of this node.
member.returns: The attributes for this node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.ChildNodes
member.summary: Gets a list of children in the current node.
member.returns: The list of child nodes.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones a new node.
member.returns: The newly created clone node.
member.param: A flag that indicates whether to recursively clone all nodes that are descendants of this node. If true, this method creates a clone of the complete tree below this node. If false, this method clones this node and its attributes only.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.FirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first child node.
member.returns: The first child node. This property returns NULL if there are no children.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.GetXml
member.summary: Returns the XML representation of the node and all its descendants.
member.returns: The XML representation of the node and all its descendants.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Determines whether a node has children.
member.returns: True if this node has children; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.InnerText
member.summary: Gets the text from inside the XML.
member.returns: The text from inside the XML. Returns an empty string if there is no text.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the child node list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild.If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.
member.returns: The last child node. This property is NULL if there are no children.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the local name, which is the local part of a qualified name. This is called the local part in Namespaces in XML.
member.returns: The local name.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NamespaceUri
member.summary: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the namespace.
member.returns: The Uri for the namespace. This refers to the uuu portion of the namespace declaration xmlns:nnn=uuu.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets the next sibling of the node in the parent's child list.
member.returns: The right sibling of this node or NULL if there is no right sibling.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NodeName
member.summary: Returns the qualified name for attribute, document type, element, entity, or notation nodes. Returns a fixed string for all other node types.
member.returns: The qualified node name, which varies depending on the node type.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the XML Document Object Model (DOM) node type, which determines valid values and whether the node can have child nodes.
member.returns: The node type.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NodeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the node. This value is always NULL.
member.returns: This value is always NULL.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.Normalize
member.summary: Normalizes all descendant elements by combining two or more adjacent text nodes into one unified text node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.NotationName
member.summary: Gets the notation name.
member.returns: The notation name.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.OwnerDocument
member.summary: Returns the root of the document that contains the node.
member.returns: The parent document that represents the root of the document.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets the parent node of the node instance.
member.returns: The parent node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.Prefix
member.summary: Returns the namespace prefix.
member.returns: The namespace prefix specified on the element, attribute, or entity reference. For example, for the element <xxx:yyy>, this property returns xxx. It returns an empty string, "", if no prefix is specified.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling of the node in the parent's child list.
member.returns: The left sibling of this node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.PublicId
member.summary: Gets the public identifier associated with the entity.
member.returns: The public identifier associated with the entity.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.RemoveChild(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Removes the specified child node from the list of children and returns it.
member.returns: The removed child node. If null, the childNode object is not removed.
member.param: The child node to be removed from the list of children of this node.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.ReplaceChild(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Replaces the specified old child node with the supplied new child node.
member.returns: The old child that is replaced. If null, no object is created.

The old child that is to be replaced by the new child.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.SelectNodes(System.String)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.returns: The collection of nodes selected by applying the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes are selected, this method returns an empty collection.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expression.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.DtdEntity.SelectNodesNS(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.returns: The first node that matches the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes match the expression, this method returns a null value.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expression.

Contains a string that specifies the namespaces to use in XPath expressions when it is necessary to define new namespaces externally. Namespaces are defined in the XML style, as a space-separated list of namespace declaration attributes. You can use this property to set the default namespace as well.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlAttribute.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the child node list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild.If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlAttribute.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.
member.returns: The last child node. This property is NULL if there are no children.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlAttribute.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the local name, which is the local part of a qualified name. This is called the local part in Namespaces in XML.
member.returns: The local name.

member.summary: Returns the attribute name.
member.returns: The attribute name.

member.returns: The Uri for the namespace. This refers to the uuu portion of the namespace declaration xmlns:nnn=uuu.

member.summary: This property is not applicable to this class and will always return null.
member.returns: NULL

member.returns: The qualified node name, which varies depending on the node type.

member.returns: This property always returns value attributeNode.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlAttribute.SelectNodes(System.String)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.returns: The collection of nodes selected by applying the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes are selected, this method returns an empty collection.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlAttribute.SelectNodesNS(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.returns: The collection of nodes selected by applying the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes are selected, returns an empty collection.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expresssion.

Contains a string that specifies namespaces for use in XPath expressions when it is necessary to define new namespaces externally. Namespaces are defined in the XML style, as a space-separated list of namespace declaration attributes. You can use this property to set the default namespace as well.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlDocument.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the child node list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild. If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlDocument.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.
member.returns: The last child node. This property is NULL if there are no children.

member.summary: Determines whether a node has children.
member.returns: True if this node has children; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlElement.InnerText
member.summary: Gets the text from inside the XML.
member.returns: The text from inside the XML. Returns an empty string if there is no text.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlElement.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild. If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: T:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings
member.summary: Contains settings that are used during loading and parsing of XML documents. The default settings are chosen for the highest security. This class can be instantiated and is accepted by LoadXml, LoadFromUriAsync, and LoadFromFileAsync.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.ElementContentWhiteSpace
member.summary: Specifies whether default handling preserves white space.
member.returns: True if default processing preserves white space; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.MaxElementDepth
member.summary: Gets and sets the limits of the element depth of an XML document to be loaded into a DOM object.
member.returns: The depth value. The default value is 256.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.ProhibitDtd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to prohibit or allow the inclusion of a DTD in the XML DOM document.
member.returns: True to prohibit the inclusion of a DTD in the XML DOM document; false to allow the inclusion. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.ResolveExternals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether external definitions, resolvable namespaces, external subsets of document type definitions (DTDs), and external entity references are to be resolved at the time the document is parsed.
member.returns: True if external definitions, resolvable namespaces, external subsets of DTDs, and external entity references are resolved at the time the document is parsed; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.ValidateOnParse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the XML parser should validate this document against the document type definition (DTD) on loading.
member.returns: If true, the internal or external DTD will be used to validate the document. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlLoadSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new XmlLoadSettings object.

member.summary: Gets the list of attributes of this node.

member.summary: Gets a list of children in the current node.

member.summary: Clones a new node.
member.returns: The newly created clone node.
member.param: A flag that indicates whether to recursively clone all nodes that are descendants of this node. If true, this method creates a clone of the complete tree below this node. If false, this method clones this node and its attributes only.

member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
member.returns: The content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.

member.summary: Gets the first child node.
member.returns: The first child node. This property returns NULL if there are no children.

member.summary: Returns the XML representation of the node and all its descendants.
member.returns: The XML representation of the node and all its descendants.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlProcessingInstruction.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Determines whether a node has children.
member.returns: True if this node has children; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlProcessingInstruction.InnerText
member.summary: Gets the text from inside the XML.
member.returns: The text from inside the XML. Returns an empty string if there is no text.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlProcessingInstruction.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild. If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlProcessingInstruction.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.
member.returns: The last child node. This property is NULL if there are no children.

member.returns: The local name.

member.returns: The right sibling of this node.

member.name: T:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode
member.summary: Contains information for the entire Document Object Model. This interface represents a single node in the document tree. While all objects that implement this interface expose methods for dealing with children, not all objects that implement this interface may have children.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.AppendChild(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Appends a new child node as the last child of the node.
member.returns: The new child node successfully appended to the list. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The new child node to be appended to the end of the list of children of this node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the list of attributes of this node.
member.returns: The attributes for this node.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.ChildNodes
member.summary: Gets a list of children in the current node.
member.returns: The list of child nodes.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones a new node.
member.returns: The newly created clone node.
member.param: A flag that indicates whether to recursively clone all nodes that are descendants of this node. If true, this method creates a clone of the complete tree below this node. If false, this method clones this node and its attributes only.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.FirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first child node.
member.returns: The first child node. This property returns NULL if there are no children.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Determines whether a node has children.
member.returns: True if this node has children; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.InsertBefore(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode,Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the list.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild. If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.IXmlNode.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.
member.returns: The last child node. This property is NULL if there are no children.

member.returns: The local name.

Contains a string that specifies namespaces for use in XPath expressions when it is necessary to define new namespaces externally. Namespaces are defined in the XML style, as a space-separated list of namespace declaration attributes. You can use this property to set the default namespace as well.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher
member.summary: Enumerates devices dynamically, so that the app receives notifications if devices are added, removed, or changed after the initial enumeration is complete.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Added
member.summary: Event that is raised when a device is added to the collection enumerated by the DeviceWatcher.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.EnumerationCompleted
member.summary: Event that is raised when the enumeration of devices completes.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Removed
member.summary: Event that is raised when a device is removed from the collection of enumerated devices.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Start
member.summary: Starts a search for devices, and subscribes to device enumeration events.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Status
member.summary: The status of the DeviceWatcher.
member.returns: The status of the DeviceWatcher.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stop raising the events that add, update and remove enumeration results.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Stopped
member.summary: Event that is raised when the enumeration operation has been stopped.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcher.Updated
member.summary: Event that is raised when a device is updated in the collection of enumerated devices.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus
member.summary: Describes the state of a DeviceWatcher object.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.Created
member.summary: This is the initial state of a Watcher object. During this state clients can register event handlers.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.Started
member.summary: The watcher transitions to the Started state once Start is called. The watcher is enumerating the initial collection. Note that during this enumeration phase it is possible to receive Updated and Removed notifications but only to items that have already been Added.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.EnumerationCompleted
member.summary: The watcher has completed enumerating the initial collection. Items can still be added, updated or removed from the collection.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.Stopping
member.summary: The client has called Stop and the watcher is still in the process of stopping. Events may still be raised.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.Stopped
member.summary: The client has called Stop and the watcher has completed all outstanding events. No further events will be raised.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Enumeration.DeviceWatcherStatus.Aborted
member.summary: The watcher has aborted operation. No subsequent events will be raised.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionAccuracy.Default
member.summary: Optimize for power, performance, and other cost considerations.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionAccuracy.High
member.summary: Deliver the most accurate report possible. This includes using services that might charge money, or consuming higher levels of battery power or connection bandwidth. An accuracy level of High may degrade system performance and should be used only when necessary.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus
member.summary: Indicates the ability of the Geolocator object to provide location data.
member.capability: Required to access the user's geographic location.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.Ready
member.summary: Location data is available.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.Initializing
member.summary: The location provider is initializing. This is the status if a GPS is the source of location data and the GPS receiver does not yet have the required number of satellites in view to obtain an accurate position.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.NoData
member.summary: No location data is available from any location provider. LocationStatus will have this value if the application calls GetGeopositionAsync or registers an event handler for the PositionChanged event, before data is available from a location sensor. Once data is available LocationStatus transitions to the Ready state.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.Disabled
member.summary: The location provider is disabled. This status indicates that the user has not granted the application permission to access location.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.NotInitialized
member.summary: An operation to retrieve location has not yet been initialized. LocationStatus will have this value if the application has not yet called GetGeopositionAsync or registered an event handler for the PositionChanged event.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Geolocation.PositionStatus.NotAvailable
member.summary: The Windows Sensor and Location Platform is not available on this version of .

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage
member.summary: Represents an SMS message in raw PDU format. The data format differs depending on whether the message format (indicated by the value of the Format property) is GSM or CDMA.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.Format
member.summary: Retrieves the detected protocol description unit (PDU) format of this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An enumerated value describing the SMS data format.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.GetData
member.summary: Returns the raw buffer of the message in binary protocol description unit (PDU) format as a byte array.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A byte array representing message data. If there is no message data, the returned array is empty.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.Id
member.summary: Indicates the ID of the asynchronous message operation.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An integer uniquely representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.MessageClass
member.summary: Returns the message class, as determined by the operator's message network. The two most common classes are None (normal message) or Class0 (special operator message, such as a roaming warning that must be shown immediately to the user). A typical client for end-user messages ignores Class0 messages.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value from the SmsMessageClass enumeration.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.SetData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Specifies the raw binary payload of the SMS message. It should be formatted according to the protocol description unit (PDU) standard.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.param: A byte array representing message data. If there is no message data, the returned array is empty.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the SmsBinaryMessage class.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice
member.summary: Supports the operation of a mobile broadband SMS device.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.AccountPhoneNumber
member.summary: Returns the phone number associated with the SMS device. The phone number can be used to associate incoming messages with the account and possibly an external storage mechanism such as an account inbox.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the account phone number.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.CalculateLength(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage)
member.summary: Estimates the transmitted message length of the specified text message. The estimate can be useful to clients who want to give an indication of how many messages will be sent on the network to carry the text of the full message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SmsEncodedLength structure that is populated with the length information.
member.param: A reference to the SMS text message to measure.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.CellularClass
member.summary: Returns the cellular class of the SMS device. The class can be used to determine which encodings are appropriate or which device limitations are in effect.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An enumerated value indicating the device's cellular class.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.DeviceStatus
member.summary: Returns the SMS device's status, which indicates whether the device is ready, or not. It also indcates what type of problem exists if the device is not ready.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An enumerated value that indicates the readiness of an SMS device to engage in cellular network traffic operations.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.FromIdAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of SmsDevice for the device that received the SMS message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: The SMS device operation object.
member.param: A string representation of the DeviceInformation ID of the SMS device that received the SMS message.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.GetDefaultAsync
member.summary: Creates an instance of an SmsDevice object associated with the default SMS device. Because the device might be busy, the operation executes asynchronously. The asynchronous operation object returns immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an IAsyncOperation(SmsDevice) object that supports asynchronous SmsDevice object retrieval.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.GetDeviceSelector
member.summary: Retrieves the class selection string that can be used to enumerate SMS devices.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string that identifies an SMS device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.MessageStore
member.summary: Accesses the on-device message store. The store holds messages until a client can retrieve them. On some devices, for example, the store may correspond to the SIM storage for SMS messages.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SmsDeviceMessageStore object.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.SendMessageAsync(Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsMessage)
member.summary: Asynchronously sends a message using the SMS device. The method is asynchronous because the send operation might not occur instantaneously. The message operation object is returned immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: The message operation object.
member.param: A reference to an ISmsMessage object. The message can be in text or binary format.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.SmsMessageReceived
member.summary: Sets an event handler to be called when the device receives a new text message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDevice.SmsDeviceStatusChanged
member.summary: Sets an event handler to be called when the status of the SMS device changes.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore
member.summary: Provides access to the messages stored on an SMS Device and information about the message store.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore.DeleteMessageAsync(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes the message with the specified ID. Because the device might be busy, the operation executes asynchronously. The asynchronous operation object returns immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A new message operation object that is used to start and track the asynchronous operation.
member.param: Integer ID of the message to delete, which was previously read from an SmsTextMessage object obtained from the device message store.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore.DeleteMessagesAsync(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter)
member.summary: Deletes the messages to which the filter applies. The filter can be used to delete all messages, or only messages that are read, unread, sent, or in a draft state. Because the operation might not be instantaneous, it executes asynchronously. The asynchronous operation object returns immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A new message operation object that is used to start and track the asynchronous operation.
member.param: A search filter that specifies which messages to delete.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore.GetMessageAsync(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the message with the specified ID. The device might be busy, so the method executes asynchronously. The asynchronous operation object returns immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: Returns a new message operation object that is used to start and track the asynchronous operation.
member.param: ID of the message to retrieve.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore.GetMessagesAsync(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of messages that match the conditions specified in a filter. The messages can be filtered as read, unread, sent, or in the draft state.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: Returns a new message operation object that is used to start and track the asynchronous operation.
member.param: ID of the message to retrieve.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceMessageStore.MaxMessages
member.summary: Indicates the maximum number of messages that can be stored in the device store. The client can use this value to determine how to maintain enough space in the device store to receive new messages from the network.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An integer value representing the maximum number of messages for the device store.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for ISmsBinaryMessage event handlers.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageReceivedEventArgs.BinaryMessage
member.summary: Retrieves an object that holds the binary representation of the message. This is of interest only to clients who want to pass binary messages on directly or do their own interpretation of the binary message contents.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SmsBinaryMessage object.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageReceivedEventArgs.TextMessage
member.summary: Retrieves an object that holds the text representation of the message. If the message is not successfully decoded, an error is returned.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A new SmsTextMessage object.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsReceivedEventDetails
member.summary: Presents the details of SMS message events to the background work item that handles messages while your app is suspended.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsReceivedEventDetails.DeviceId
member.summary: Returns the DeviceInformation ID of the network interface that received the SMS message. This ID can be passed to SmsDevice.FromIdAsync to activate the device and retrieve additional message details.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string containing the DeviceInformation ID of the SMS network interface (device). This value is typically used to retrieve details such as the sender and the body of the message. For example, you might use the ID to display a popup telling the user that a new message from a particular person has arrived. The combination of DeviceId and MessageIndex is sufficient to retrieve the new message from the SMS device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsReceivedEventDetails.MessageIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the new message that raised the event. You can pass this to SmsDevice.GetMessageAsync to retrieve the new message itself.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An integer index of the new message.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage
member.summary: Manages a decoded SMS text message, providing direct access to the plain text body of the message, as well as key header properties, such as time stamp.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.Body
member.summary: Specifies the plain text body of the message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representing the body of the text message. If there were decoding problems, some characters in the original message can be represented by a wildcard character, typically a question mark ('?').

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.Encoding
member.summary: Specifies the encoding type that has been set to use when sending this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value from the SmsEncoding enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.From
member.summary: Specifies the phone number of the sender of the message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the phone number of the sender of this message. It should be in the format preferred by the device and the network it is registered on.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.FromBinaryData(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decodes a binary message and places the results in a new instance of a text message. This method represents the binary message as a reference to a buffer of bytes and a selection of how the buffer is encoded. Therefore, it can be used when the message did not originate directly from the device or as an instance of an SmsBinaryMessage class.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A new SmsTextMessage object if the decoding was successful.
member.param: An SmsDataFormat enumerated value that identifies the format of a particular protocol description unit (PDU) buffer.
An array of bytes containing the binary data to decode.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.FromBinaryMessage(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsBinaryMessage)
member.summary: Reads a binary message and decodes it. The results are placed in a new instance of a text message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A new SmsTextMessage object.
member.param: An instance of a binary message to decode.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.Id
member.summary: Indicates the ID of the SMS text message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An integer ID for the message.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.MessageClass
member.summary: Specifies the message class of a message. This message class typically originates on the network, not the mobile device.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value from the SmsMessageClass enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.PartCount
member.summary: Indicates the total number of parts in the original message if the message is part of a multi-part message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer. If the message is standalone, the value is 1.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.PartNumber
member.summary: Indicates the part number of a multi-part message if this message is part of a multi-part message. It can be used to reconstruct the original message by joining the parts together, in conjunction with the PartReferenceId and PartCount properties.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer. It is one-based. It will not exceed PartCount + 1.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.PartReferenceId
member.summary: Indicates a reference value that can be used if the message is part of a multi-part message. If this message belongs to a multi-part message, the PartNumber value can be used to reconstruct the full original message, and each part of that message will have the same value for PartReferenceId.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer determined by the sending network; it cannot be manipulated through this interface. If the network has its own policy on the lifetime of a multi-part message, this reference number might not be valid indefinitely.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the SmsTextMessage class.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: Indicates the timestamp of the message. It is determined locally for a constructed message instance or from the service center timestamp of a received message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value of the DateTime type.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.To
member.summary: Indicates the recipient phone number of this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the phone number, formatted in the phone number format favored by the device and the network that the device is registered on.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage.ToBinaryMessages(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat)
member.summary: Reads a message in the specified format and places the results in a new instance of a binary message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: The new binary message that holds the result of this method call.
member.param: A value from the SmsDataFormat enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength
member.summary: This structure represents information about the length of an SmsTextMessage object when it is encoded as a PDU.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength.SegmentCount
member.summary: The number of segments needed to encode the message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength.CharacterCountLastSegment
member.summary: The number of characters in the last segment of the encoded message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength.CharactersPerSegment
member.summary: The estimated number of characters that can fit in one segment of the message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength.ByteCountLastSegment
member.summary: The number of bytes in the last segment of the encoded message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncodedLength.BytesPerSegment
member.summary: The number of bytes in each segment of the message.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.CellularClass
member.summary: This enumerated type defines the type of cellular device.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.CellularClass.None
member.summary: The device type corresponds to no cellular class.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.CellularClass.Gsm
member.summary: The device type is GSM cellular class.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.CellularClass.Cdma
member.summary: The device type is CDMA cellular class.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat
member.summary: This enumerated type identifies the format of a given protocol description unit (PDU) buffer.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat.Unknown
member.summary: The data format is unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat.CdmaSubmit
member.summary: The data format is CDMA WMT format of type submit.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat.GsmSubmit
member.summary: The data format is GSM of type submit.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat.CdmaDeliver
member.summary: The data format is CDMA WMT format of type deliver.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat.GsmDeliver
member.summary: The data format is GSM of type deliver.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus
member.summary: Contains values that indicate the readiness of an SMS device to engage in cellular network traffic operations.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.Off
member.summary: The device is powered off.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.Ready
member.summary: The device is powered on and ready to be used.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.SimNotInserted
member.summary: The SIM card is not inserted into the device.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.BadSim
member.summary: The SIM is invalid; PIN unblock key retrials have exceeded the limit.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.DeviceFailure
member.summary: General device failure.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.SubscriptionNotActivated
member.summary: The service subscription is not activated.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.DeviceLocked
member.summary: The device is locked by a PIN or password that prevents the device from initializing and registering on the network.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatus.DeviceBlocked
member.summary: The device is blocked by a PIN or password that prevents the device from initializing and registering on the nework.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding
member.summary: This enumerated type is used to determine the encoding algorithm to send or calculate the length of an SmsTextMessage object.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: The data encoding is unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding.Optimal
member.summary: 7-bit encoding if all characters can be represented, otherwise 2-byte Universal Character Set (UCS-2) encoding.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding.SevenBitAscii
member.summary: Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding.Unicode
member.summary: Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsEncoding.GsmSevenBit
member.summary: Standard 7-bit per octet ASCII encoding.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass
member.summary: This enumerated type specifies the message class of a message. The message class typically originates on the network, not the mobile device.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass.None
member.summary: No class was specified.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass.Class0
member.summary: Message should be immediately displayed.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass.Class1
member.summary: Mobile equipment (ME) specific message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass.Class2
member.summary: SIM specific message.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageClass.Class3
member.summary: Terminal equipment (TE) specific message.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter
member.summary: This enumerated type specifies which messages in the device message store an operation is performed on.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter.All
member.summary: All messages in the device message store.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter.Unread
member.summary: All unread received messages.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter.Read
member.summary: All read received messages.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter.Sent
member.summary: All sent and saved messages.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageFilter.Draft
member.summary: All unsent and saved messages.

member.summary: This enumerated type defines whether the SMS message is encoded in binary or text format.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageType.Binary
member.summary: The SMS message is in binary format.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageType.Text

member.summary: Retrieves the detected protocol description unit (PDU) format of this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.summary: Returns the raw buffer of the message in binary protocol description unit (PDU) format as a byte array.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A byte array representing message data. If there is no message data, the returned array is empty.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsBinaryMessage.SetData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Specifies the raw binary payload of the SMS message. It should be formatted according to the protocol description unit (PDU) standard.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice
