member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.AccountPhoneNumber
member.summary: Returns the phone number associated with the SMS device. The phone number can be used to associate incoming messages with the account and possibly an external storage mechanism such as an account inbox.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the account phone number.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.CalculateLength(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsTextMessage)
member.summary: Estimates the transmitted message length of the specified text message. The estimate can be useful to clients who want to give an indication of how many messages will be sent on the network to carry the text of the full message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SmsEncodedLength structure that is populated with the length information.
member.param: A reference to the SMS text message to measure.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.CellularClass
member.summary: Returns the cellular class of the SMS device. The class can be used to determine which encodings are appropriate or which device limitations are in effect.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An enumerated value indicating the device's cellular class.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.DeviceStatus
member.summary: Returns the SMS device's status, which indicates whether the device is ready, or not. It also indcates what type of problem exists if the device is not ready.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An enumerated value that indicates the readiness of an SMS device to engage in cellular network traffic operations.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.MessageStore
member.summary: Accesses the on-device message store. The store holds messages until a client can retrieve them. On some devices, for example, the store may correspond to the SIM storage for SMS messages.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SmsMessageStore object.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.SendMessageAsync(Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsMessage)
member.summary: Asynchronously sends a message using the SMS device. The method is asynchronous because the send operation might not occur instantaneously. The asynchronous operation object is returned immediately.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A reference to an SendSmsMessageOperation object that supports asynchronous message sending.
member.param: A reference to an SmsMessage object. The message can be in text or binary format.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.SmsDeviceStatusChanged
member.summary: Sets an event handler to be called when the status of the SMS device changes.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: E:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsDevice.SmsMessageReceived
member.summary: Sets an event handler to be called when the device receives a new text message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsMessage
member.summary: This interface is implemented by all types of SMS messages that are supported.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsMessage.Id
member.summary: Retrieves an ID for the message, which can later be specified in calling message store methods in order to get or delete the message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An integer ID for the message.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsMessage.MessageClass
member.summary: Returns the message class, as determined by the operator's message network. The two most common classes are None (normal message) or Class0 (special operator message, such as a roaming warning that must be shown immediately to the user). A typical client for end-user messages ignores Class0 messages.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value from the SmsMessageClass enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage
member.summary: This interface manipulates a decoded SMS text message. It provides direct access to the plain text body of the message, as well as key header properties, such as time stamp.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.Body
member.summary: Specifies the plain text body of the message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representing the body of the text message. If there were decoding problems, some characters in the original message can be represented by a wildcard character, typically a question mark: '?'.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.Encoding
member.summary: Specifies the encoding type that has been set to use when sending this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value from the SmsEncoding enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.From
member.summary: Specifies the phone number of the sender of the message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the phone number of the sender of this message. It should be in the format preferred by the device and the network it is registered on.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.PartCount
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of parts in the original message if the message is part of a multi-part message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer. If the message is standalone, the value is 1.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.PartNumber
member.summary: Retrieves the part number of a multi-part message if this message is part of a multi-part message. It can be used to reconstruct the original message by joining the parts together, in conjunction with the PartReferenceId and PartCount properties.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer. It is one-based. It will not exceed PartCount + 1.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.PartReferenceId
member.summary: Indicates a reference value that can be used if the message is part of a multi-part message. If this message belongs to a multi-part message, the PartNumber value can be used to reconstruct the full original message, and each part of that message will have the same value for PartReferenceId.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: An unsigned integer determined by the sending network; it cannot be manipulated through this interface. If the network has its own policy on the lifetime of a multi-part message, this reference number might not be valid indefinitely.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: Retrieves the timestamp of the message. It is determined locally for a constructed message instance or from the service center timestamp of a received message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A value of the DateTime type.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.To
member.summary: Specifies the recipient phone number of this message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: A string representation of the phone number, formatted in the phone number format favored by the device and the network that the device is registered on.

member.name: M:Windows.Devices.Sms.ISmsTextMessage.ToBinaryMessages(Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDataFormat)
member.summary: Reads a message in the specified format and places the results in a new instance of a binary message.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.
member.returns: The new binary message that holds the result of this method call.
member.param: A value from the SmsDataFormat enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsDeviceStatusChangedEventHandler
member.summary: This handler is called when the status on the SMS device changes. Callers should implement this when they want to be notified when a significant state change occurs on the device. For example, the caller might want to know when the device is ready to send and receive messages.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Sms.SmsMessageReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: This event handler is called when a new binary message is received. Callers should implement this when they want to handle new binary messages from a given SMS device.
member.capability: Required to access the SMS service.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Calendar.Compare(Windows.Globalization.Calendar)
member.summary: Compares this calendar to another Calendar object and indicates whether the date and time of one is earlier, equal to, or later than that of the other.
member.returns: One of the following values:Return valueDescriptionLess than zeroThe date and time of this calendar is earlier than that of other.ZeroThe date and times are equal.Greater than zeroThe date and time of this calendar is later than that of other.
member.param: The Calendar object to compare to the current calendar.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Calendar.CompareDateTime(Windows.Foundation.DateTime)
member.summary: Compares this calendar to a DateTime object and indicates whether the date and time of one is earlier, equal to, or later than that of the other.
member.returns: One of the following values:Return valueDescriptionLess than zeroThe date and time of this calendar is earlier than that of other.ZeroThe date and times are equal.Greater than zeroThe date and time of this calendar is later than that of other.
member.param: The DateTime object to compare to the current calendar.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion
member.summary: Describes a region. This is usually a country, but may be a macroregion.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a GeographicRegion object that defaults to the user's home region.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a GeographicRegion object.
member.param: One of the ISO 3166-1 two-letter or three-letter codes that identify the country, or one of the three-digit UN-M49 codes that identify the geographical region.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.IsSupported(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a geographic region identifier is supported.
member.returns: True if the ID is known; otherwise, false. If this method returns true, an app can safely construct a region by using this region identifier. If it returns false, attempting to construct a region for the given code will throw an exception.
member.param: One of the ISO 3166-1 two-letter or three-letter codes that identify the country, or one of the three-digit UN-M49 codes that identify the geographical region.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.CurrenciesInUse
member.summary: Gets the set of currencies in use in this region.
member.returns: The set of ISO 4217 3-letter codes for the currencies that are used in the region.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.Code
member.summary: Gets the string that contains the best available identifier that represents the region.
member.returns: Returns a string that contains:The two-letter identifier code, if one exists (and is not "ZZ");otherwise, the three-letter identifier code, if one exists (and is not "ZZZ");otherwise, the three-digit numeric identifier code, if one exists (and is not "999");otherwise, "ZZ".

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.CodeThreeDigit
member.summary: Gets the three-digit identifier for this region, as a string.
member.returns: Returns as a string the ISO-3166-1 numeric three-digit code for the region, or the UN-M49 code. If the region is unknown, returns "999".

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.CodeThreeLetter
member.summary: Gets the three-letter identifier for this region.
member.returns: Returns the three-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code for this region, if one exists; otherwise, returns "ZZZ".

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.CodeTwoLetter
member.summary: Gets the two-letter identifier for this region.
member.returns: Returns the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for this region, if one exists; otherwise, returns "ZZ".

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets a localized string that is suitable for display to the user for identifying the region.
member.returns: The localized name of the region.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.GeographicRegion.NativeName
member.summary: Gets the name of the region in the primary language spoken in this region.
member.returns: The name of the region in the primary language spoken in this region.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.Language
member.summary: A class that provides information related to BCP-47 language tags such as the language name and the script.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Language.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Language object.
member.param: A BCP-47 language tag.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Language.IsWellFormed(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a BCP-47 language tag is well-formed.
member.returns: True if the language tag is well-formed as defined by BCP-47, except when the language tag can never be valid according to BCP-47. Otherwise it returns false. If this method returns true, an application can safely construct a language by using this tag. If it returns false, attempting to construct a language for the given tag will throw an exception.
member.param: A BCP-47 language tag.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Language.CurrentInputMethodLanguageTag
member.summary: Gets the BCP-47 language tag for the currently enabled keyboard layout or Input Method Editor (IME).
member.returns: The BCP-47 language tag.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Language.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets a localized string that is suitable for display to the user for identifying the language.
member.returns: The localized name of the language.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Language.LanguageTag
member.summary: Gets the normalized BCP-47 language tag for this language.
member.returns: The normalized BCP-47 language tag.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Language.NativeName
member.summary: Gets the name of the language in the language itself.
member.returns: The name of the language in the language itself.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Language.Script
member.summary: Gets the four-letter ISO 15924 script code of the language.
member.returns: A string with the script code of the language. If the script code cannot be identified or inferred from the language tag, "Zyyy" is returned.

member.name: N:Windows.Globalization.Collation
member.summary: Provides read-only lists of character groupings.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGrouping
member.summary: A container for character group information. Characters are grouped in an index that enables an application to determine where the grouping boundaries are.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGrouping.First
member.summary: Gets the first item that appears in the grouping under this index.
member.returns: The string that defines the start of the group that has the associated label. The start of the next group implicitly determines its end.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGrouping.Label
member.summary: Gets the label that is associated with this index.
member.returns: The string to use as the label for all strings of this group. This string may be empty, in which case the label is considered to be "other".

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings
member.summary: Contains the set of character groups and the functionality to get the label for any given string.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.#ctor
member.summary: Create a CharacterGroupings object for the default collation.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.First
member.summary: Returns an iterator to enumerate the items in the set of character groups.
member.returns: The iterator. The current position of the iterator is index 0, or the end of the set of character groups if the set is empty.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.GetAt(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the CharacterGrouping at the specified index in the set of character groups.
member.returns: The CharacterGrouping at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the CharacterGrouping in the set to return.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.GetMany(System.UInt32,Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGrouping[])
member.summary: Returns the CharacterGrouping objects that start at the specified index in the set of character groups.
member.returns: The number of objects returned.
member.param: The zero-based index of the start of the CharacterGrouping objects in the set to return.
The CharacterGrouping objects in the set that start at startIndex.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.IndexOf(Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGrouping,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Returns the index of a specified CharacterGrouping object in the set of character groups.
member.returns: True if the object is found, otherwise false.
member.param: The CharacterGrouping object to find in the set.
The zero-based index of the CharacterGrouping object, if found. The method returns zero if the object is not found.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.Lookup(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the label under which the provided text falls.
member.returns: The first character grouping label that applies to the given text.
member.param: The string for which to get the label.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.Collation.CharacterGroupings.Size
member.summary: Gets the number of CharacterGrouping objects in the set of character groups.
member.returns: The number of objects in the set.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DateTimeFormatter.Template
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this format template.
member.returns: A string that represents this format template. If the DateTimeFormatter object was constructed with a format template or format enumerations, the string can be used to construct the same DateTimeFormatter. If a pattern was used to construct the DateTimeFormatter, this property returns the empty string.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the day in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the day.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the day in the most natural way. This will depend on the context, such as the language or calendar (for example, for the Hebrew calendar and Hebrew language, use the Hebrew numbering system).

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayOfWeekFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the day of the week in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayOfWeekFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the day of the week.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayOfWeekFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the day of the week in the most natural way. It may be abbreviated or full depending on the context, such as the language or calendar that is being used.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayOfWeekFormat.Abbreviated
member.summary: Display an abbreviated version of the day of the week (for example, "Thur" for Thursday).

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.DayOfWeekFormat.Full
member.summary: Display the day of the week in its entirety (for example, "Thursday").

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.HourFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the hour in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.HourFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the hour.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.HourFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the hour in the most natural way. This will depend on the context, such as the language or clock that is being used.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MinuteFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the minute in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MinuteFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the minute.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MinuteFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the minute in the most natural way. This will depend on the context, such as the language or clock that is being used.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the month in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the month.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the month in the most natural way. It may be abbreviated, full, or numeric depending on the context, such as the language or calendar that is being used.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat.Abbreviated
member.summary: Display an abbreviated version of the month (for example, "Sep" for September).

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat.Full
member.summary: Display the month in its entirety (for example, "September").

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.MonthFormat.Numeric
member.summary: Display the month as a number (for example, "9" for September).

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.SecondFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the second in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.SecondFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the second.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.SecondFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the second in the most natural way. This will depend on the context, such as the language or clock that is being used.

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.YearFormat
member.summary: Specifies the intended format for the year in a DateTimeFormatter object.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.YearFormat.None
member.summary: Do not display the year.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.YearFormat.Default
member.summary: Display the year in the most natural way. It may be abbreviated or full depending on the context, such as the language or calendar that is being used.

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.YearFormat.Abbreviated
member.summary: Display an abbreviated version of the year (for example, "11" for Gregorian 2011).

member.name: F:Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting.YearFormat.Full
member.summary: Display the year in its entirety (for example, "2011" for Gregorian 2011).

member.name: N:Windows.Graphics.Display
member.summary: Provides a class, a delegate, and enumerations for determining aspects of a physical display.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations
member.summary: Describes the orientation of a rectangular monitor.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations.None
member.summary: No display orientation is specified.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations.Landscape
member.summary: Specifies that the monitor is oriented in landscape mode where the width of the display viewing area is greater than the height.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations.Portrait
member.summary: Specifies that the monitor rotated 90 degrees in the clockwise direction to orient the display in portrait mode where the height of the display viewing area is greater than the width.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations.LandscapeFlipped
member.summary: Specifies that the monitor rotated another 90 degrees in the clockwise direction (to equal 180 degrees) to orient the display in landscape mode where the width of the display viewing area is greater than the height. This landscape mode is flipped 180 degrees from the Landscape mode.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayOrientations.PortraitFlipped
member.summary: Specifies that the monitor rotated another 90 degrees in the clockwise direction (to equal 270 degrees) to orient the display in portrait mode where the height of the display viewing area is greater than the width. This portrait mode is flipped 180 degrees from the Portrait mode.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties
member.summary: Provides various properties that are related to the physical display.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.AutoRotationPreferences
member.summary: Gets and sets the preferred orientation of the app.
member.returns: The orientation of a rectangular monitor.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.ColorProfileChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the physical display's color profile changes.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.CurrentOrientation
member.summary: Gets the current orientation of a rectangular monitor.
member.returns: The current orientation of a rectangular monitor.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.GetColorProfileAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously gets the default International Color Consortium (ICC) color profile that is associated with the physical display.
member.returns: Object that manages the asynchronous retrieval of the color profile.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.LogicalDpi
member.summary: Gets the pixels per logical inch of the current environment.
member.returns: The pixels per logical inch of the current environment.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.LogicalDpiChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the LogicalDpi property changes because the pixels per inch (PPI) of the display changes.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.NativeOrientation
member.summary: Gets the native orientation of the display monitor, which is typically the orientation where the buttons on the device match the orientation of the monitor.
member.returns: The native orientation of the display monitor.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.OrientationChanged
member.summary: Occurs when either the CurrentOrientation or NativeOrientation property changes because of a mode change or a monitor change.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.ResolutionScale
member.summary: Gets the scale factor of the immersive environment.
member.returns: The scale factor of the immersive environment.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.StereoEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the device supports stereoscopic 3D.
member.returns: TRUE if the device is capable of stereoscopic 3D and stereoscopic 3D is currently enabled; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayProperties.StereoEnabledChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the StereoEnabled property changes because support for stereoscopic 3D changes.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Display.DisplayPropertiesEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that handles display property events.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Display.ResolutionScale
member.summary: Describes the scale factor of the immersive environment.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.ResolutionScale.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies the scale of a display is invalid.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.ResolutionScale.Scale100Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of a display as 100 percent. This percentage indicates that the display pixel density is less than 174 pixels per inch (DPI/PPI), or the screen resolution is less than 1920x1080, or both.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.ResolutionScale.Scale140Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of a display as 140 percent. This percentage indicates that the display has a pixel density greater than or equal to 174 PPI and a screen resolution greater than or equal to 1920x1080.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Display.ResolutionScale.Scale180Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of a display as 180 percent. This percentage indicates that the display has a pixel density greater than or equal to 240 PPI and a screen resolution greater than or equal to 2560x1440.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapAlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode of pixel data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapAlphaMode.Premultiplied
member.summary: The alpha value has been premultiplied. Each color is first scaled by the alpha value. The alpha value itself is the same in both straight and premultiplied alpha. Typically, no color channel value is greater than the alpha channel value. If a color channel value in a premultiplied format is greater than the alpha channel, the standard source-over blending math results in an additive blend.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapAlphaMode.Straight
member.summary: The alpha value has not been premultiplied. The alpha channel indicates the transparency of the color.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapAlphaMode.Ignore
member.summary: The alpha value is ignored.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapFlip
member.summary: Specifies the flip operation to be performed on pixel data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapFlip.None
member.summary: No flip operation will be performed.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapFlip.Horizontal
member.summary: Flip the bitmap around the y axis.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapFlip.Vertical
member.summary: Flip the bitmap around the x axis.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapInterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the interpolation mode used for scaling pixel data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapInterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: A nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm. Also known as nearest pixel or point interpolation. The output pixel is assigned the value of the pixel that the point falls within. No other pixels are considered.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapInterpolationMode.Linear
member.summary: A bilinear interpolation algorithm. The output pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest four pixels in a 2x2 grid.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapInterpolationMode.Cubic
member.summary: A bicubic interpolation algorithm. Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest sixteen pixels in a 4x4 grid.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapInterpolationMode.Fant
member.summary: A Fant resampling algorithm. Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the all the pixels that map to the new pixel in a box shaped kernel.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapPixelFormat
member.summary: Specifies the pixel format of pixel data. Each enumeration value defines a channel ordering, bit depth, and type.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapPixelFormat.Unknown
member.summary: The pixel format is unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapPixelFormat.Rgba16
member.summary: The pixel format is R16B16G16A16 unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapPixelFormat.Rgba8
member.summary: The pixel format is R8G8B8A8 unsigned integer.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapPixelFormat.Bgra8
member.summary: The pixel format is B8G8R8A8 unsigned integer.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapRotation
member.summary: Specifies the rotation operation to be performed on pixel data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapRotation.None
member.summary: No rotation operation is performed.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapRotation.Clockwise90Degrees
member.summary: Perform a clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapRotation.Clockwise180Degrees
member.summary: Perform a clockwise rotation of 180 degrees.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.BitmapRotation.Clockwise270Degrees
member.summary: Perform a clockwise rotation of 270 degrees.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ColorManagementMode
member.summary: Specifies the color management behavior when obtaining pixel data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ColorManagementMode.DoNotColorManage
member.summary: No color management is performed

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ColorManagementMode.ColorManageToSRgb
member.summary: Color management is performed from the color space embedded with the source bitmap to the sRGB color space.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ExifOrientationMode
member.summary: Specifies the EXIF orientation flag behavior when obtaining pixel or bitmap data.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ExifOrientationMode.IgnoreExifOrientation
member.summary: The EXIF orientation flag is ignored. No rotation or flip operations are performed.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.ExifOrientationMode.RespectExifOrientation
member.summary: If the image frame contains a valid EXIF orientation flag, the specified rotation and/or flip operations are performed on the pixel data.

member.summary: Specifies which chroma subsampling mode will be used for image compression.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.JpegSubsamplingMode.Default
member.summary: The default mode will be used.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.JpegSubsamplingMode.Y4Cb2Cr0
member.summary: 4:2:0 (2x2) chroma subsampling will be used.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.JpegSubsamplingMode.Y4Cb2Cr2
member.summary: 4:2:2 (2x1) chroma subsampling will be used.

member.name: F:Windows.Graphics.Imaging.JpegSubsamplingMode.Y4Cb4Cr4
member.summary: 4:4:4 (1x1) chroma subsampling will be used.

member.name: N:Windows.Graphics.Printing
member.summary: Contains the classes, interfaces, structures and other components that are used by the print driver and by the Windows print system to create and manipulate documents.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintManager
member.summary: Informs Windows that an application wishes to participate in printing. The PrintManager class is also used for programmatically initiating printing.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintManager.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Retrieves the PrintManager object associated with the current window.
member.returns: The PrintManager object.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintManager.ShowPrintUIAsync
member.summary: Programattically initiates the user interface for printing content.
member.returns: A Boolean value to indicate a TRUE for success or a FALSE for a failure.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintManager.PrintTaskRequested
member.summary: Raised when a request to print has occurred. This event may be triggered by user action or via programmatic invocation of printing via the ShowPrintUIAsync method.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask
member.summary: Represents a printing operation including the content to be printed, as well as providing access to information describing how the content is to be printed.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Completed
member.summary: Raised when the print task is completed.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Options
member.summary: Retrieves the PrintTaskOptions for the print task that defines how the content is to be formatted for printing.
member.returns: The list of print task options.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Previewing
member.summary: Raised when the print system initializes print preview mode.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Progressing
member.summary: Raised to provide progress information about how much of the printed content has been submitted to the print subsystem for printing.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Properties
member.summary: Retrieves a set of properties associated with the PrintTask.
member.returns: The data package property set.

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Source
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the app-provided object that represents the content to be printed. This object must support the IPrintDocumentSource interface.
member.returns: The print task object.

member.name: E:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTask.Submitting
member.summary: Raised when a print task begins submitting content to the print subsystem to be printed.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTaskSourceRequestedDeferral
member.summary: Used to defer the request for a print task source.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTaskSourceRequestedDeferral.Complete
member.summary: Indicates when the deferral for a print task source request is over.

member.name: T:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTaskSourceRequestedArgs

member.name: P:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTaskSourceRequestedArgs.Deadline
member.summary: Gets the DateTime object that indicates the deadline for a print task source request.
member.returns: The deadline for a print task source request.

member.name: M:Windows.Graphics.Printing.PrintTaskSourceRequestedArgs.GetDeferral
member.summary: Gets a PrintTaskSourceRequestedDeferral object that provides access to a Complete method. This method indicates then the deferral is over.
member.returns: Provides access to a Complete method.

To get details of the audio format, use AudioEncodingProperties. ContainerMedia container. ImageStill image data. To get details of the image format, use ImageEncodingProperties. VideoVideo stream. To get details of the video format, use VideoEncodingProperties.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress
member.summary: Contains status information about the download operation.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress.BytesReceived
member.summary: Current total number of bytes received. This value does not include bytes received as response headers. If the download operation has restarted, this value may be smaller than in the previous progress report.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress.TotalBytesToReceive
member.summary: The total number of data bytes to download. If the number is unknown, this value is 0 by default.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress.Status
member.summary: Indicates the current operation status.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress.HasResponseChanged
member.summary: TRUE if the download request response has changed; otherwise, FALSE.Whenever new response information is available due to a new request being invoked, this field is set to true. The application can then choose to read the new response information and update its state, if needed.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundDownloadProgress.HasRestarted
member.summary: TRUE if a data transfer operation has restarted; otherwise FALSE. When a download is interrupted and a new request is sent to the server to resume the download, HasRestarted is set to true if the server does not support resume and the download had to start over.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress
member.summary: Contains status information about the upload operation.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.BytesReceived
member.summary: The current number of bytes received. This value does not include bytes received as part of response headers. If the upload operation has restarted, this value may be smaller than in the previous progress report.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.BytesSent
member.summary: The current number of bytes sent. If the upload operation has restarted, this value may be smaller than in the previous progress report.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.TotalBytesToReceive
member.summary: The total number of data bytes to upload. If the number is unknown, this value is 0.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.TotalBytesToSend
member.summary: The total number of bytes to upload.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.Status
member.summary: Specifies the current status of the transfer.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.HasResponseChanged
member.summary: TRUE if the upload request response has changed; otherwise, FALSE.Whenever new response information is available due to a new request being invoked, this field is set to true. The application can then choose to read the new response information and update its state, if needed.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundUploadProgress.HasRestarted
member.summary: TRUE if a upload transfer operation has restarted; otherwise FALSE. Uploads cannot be resumed. Whenever a new request is sent to the server to restart the upload, this property is set to true in the first progress notification for the new request.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferCostPolicy
member.summary: Defines values used to specify whether transfers can occur on costed networks.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferCostPolicy.Default
member.summary: Allow transfers on costed networks.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferCostPolicy.UnrestrictedOnly
member.summary: Do not allow transfers on costed networks.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferCostPolicy.Always
member.summary: Always download regardless of network cost. (e.g. even while a user is roaming)This behavior is based only on network cost policy, and doesn't affect other app scenarios, like system suspension.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus
member.summary: Defines transfer operation status values.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.Idle
member.summary: The application is idle.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.Running
member.summary: The transfer is currently in progress.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.PausedByApplication
member.summary: The application has paused the transfer operation.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.PausedCostedNetwork
member.summary: The transfer operation is paused due to cost policy (e.g. transitioned to a costed network).

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.PausedNoNetwork
member.summary: The transfer operation is paused due to a lack of network connectivity.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.Completed
member.summary: The transfer operation has completed.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The transfer operation has been cancelled.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.BackgroundTransfer.BackgroundTransferStatus.Error
member.summary: An error was encountered during the transfer operation.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkConnectivityLevel
member.summary: Defines the level of connectivity currently available.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkConnectivityLevel.None
member.summary: No connectivity.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkConnectivityLevel.LocalAccess
member.summary: Local network access only.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkConnectivityLevel.ConstrainedInternetAccess
member.summary: Limited internet access. This value indicates captive portal connectivity, where local access to a web portal is provided, but access to the Internet requires that specific credentials are provided via the portal. This level of connectivity is generally encountered when using connections hosted in public locations (e.g. coffee shops and book stores).

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkConnectivityLevel.InternetAccess
member.summary: Local and Internet access.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkCostType
member.summary: Defines the network cost types.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkCostType.Unknown
member.summary: Cost information is not available.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkCostType.Unrestricted
member.summary: The connection is unlimited and has unrestricted usage charges and capacity constraints.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkCostType.Fixed
member.summary: The use of this connection is unrestricted up to a specific limit.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkCostType.Variable
member.summary: The connection is costed on a per-byte basis.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType
member.summary: Defines values that indicate the type of authentication used by the network.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.None
member.summary: No authentication enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.Unknown
member.summary: Authentication method unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.Open80211
member.summary: Open authentication over 802.11 wireless. Devices are authenticated and can connect to an access point, but communication with the network requires a matching Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) key.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.SharedKey80211
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11 Shared Key authentication algorithm that requires the use of a pre-shared Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) key for the 802.11 authentication.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.Wpa
member.summary: Specifies a Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authorization is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.WpaPsk
member.summary: Specifies a Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) algorithm that uses pre-shared keys (PSK). IEEE 802.1X port authorization is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a pre-shared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.WpaNone
member.summary: Wi-Fi Protected Access.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.Rsna
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11i Robust Security Network Association (RSNA) algorithm. IEEE 802.1X port authorization is performed by the supplicant, authenticator, and authentication server. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through the authentication process.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.RsnaPsk
member.summary: Specifies an IEEE 802.11i RSNA algorithm that uses PSK. IEEE 802.1X port authorization is performed by the supplicant and authenticator. Cipher keys are dynamically derived through a pre-shared key that is used on both the supplicant and authenticator.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkAuthenticationType.Ihv
member.summary: Specifies an authentication type defined by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType
member.summary: Defines values that indicate the type of encryption used for authentication.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.None
member.summary: No encryption enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Unknown
member.summary: Encryption method unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Wep
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a cipher key of any length.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Wep40
member.summary: Specifies a Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based algorithm that is specified in the IEEE 802.11-1999 standard. This enumerator specifies the WEP cipher algorithm with a 40-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Wep104
member.summary: Specifies a WEP cipher algorithm with a 104-bit cipher key.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Tkip
member.summary: Specifies a Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP) algorithm, which is the RC4-based cipher suite that is based on the algorithms that are defined in the WPA specification and IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard. This cipher also uses the Michael Message Integrity Code (MIC) algorithm for forgery protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Ccmp
member.summary: Specifies an AES-CCMP algorithm, as specified in the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard and RFC 3610. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is the encryption algorithm defined in FIPS PUB 197.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.WpaUseGroup
member.summary:
Specifies a Wifi Protected Access (WPA) Use Group Key cipher suite.
For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.25.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.RsnUseGroup
member.summary: Specifies a Robust Security Network (RSN) Use Group Key cipher suite. For more information about the Use Group Key cipher suite, refer to Clause 7.3.2.25.1 of the IEEE 802.11i-2004 standard.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Connectivity.NetworkEncryptionType.Ihv
member.summary: Specifies an encryption type defined by an independent hardware vendor (IHV).

member.name: N:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators
member.summary: Contains classes that support Mobile Broadband Account management.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext
member.summary: Provides the authentication context that contains details of the current authentication attempt and provides methods to perform the authentication.

member.name: M:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.AbortAuthentication(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Aborts the current authentication attempt and disconnects the WLAN interface from the hotspot.
member.param: If true, Windows disables the auto-connect property for the corresponding WLAN profile and avoids future auto-connects to this hotspot. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.AuthenticationUrl
member.summary: Gets the HTTPS URL specified in the Wireless Internet Service Provider roaming (WISPr) redirect message.
member.returns: A URI that contains the HTTPS authentication URL.

member.name: M:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.IssueCredentials(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Provides credentials to Windows for hotspot authentication
member.param: The UserName parameter of the Wireless Internet Service Provider roaming (WISPr) authentication protocol. IssueCredentials performs URL encoding before submitting the value to the server. If this string is empty, the corresponding authentication parameter is skipped.

The Password parameter of the WISPr authentication protocol. IssueCredentials performs URL encoding before submitting the value to the server. If this string is empty, the corresponding authentication parameter is skipped.

Additional parameters to be appended to the authentication string. IssueCredentials appends this parameter after an & character to the HTTP POST string as is without any encoding. This can be used to add multiple parameters. The default for this parameter is an empty string.

If true, an application permanently disables the auto-connect property on a connection. If authentication fails, the connection will be disconnected and not retried in the current user session. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.NetworkAdapter
member.summary: Gets the network interface that is connected to the WLAN access point of the hotspot.
member.returns: An object that uniquely identifies the network.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.RedirectMessageUrl
member.summary: Gets the URL of the web page where the Wireless Internet Service Provider roaming (WISPr) redirect message was found.
member.returns: A URI that contains the HTTPS or HTTP redirect URL.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.RedirectMessageXml
member.summary: Gets the XML blob of the Wireless Internet Service Provider roaming (WISPr) redirect message of the hotspot.
member.returns: The WISPr XML blob from the hotspot redirect message.

member.name: M:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.SkipAuthentication
member.summary: Skips Wireless Internet Service Provider roaming (WISPr) Windows authentication.

member.name: M:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.TriggerAttentionRequired(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called by a background task handler to launch the foreground application when there is an authentication attempt to complete.
member.param: The foreground application ID within its application package. The application must belong to the same package as the background task handler.
Optional command line parameters that are passed to the application at launch.

member.name: M:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.TryGetAuthenticationContext(System.String,Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext@)
member.summary: Gets the context of an authentication attempt.
member.returns: If true, the authentication context was retrieved. The authentication context can only be retrieved if the calling application matches the application ID specified in the hotspot profile of the underlying WLAN connection and if the authentication hasn’t be completed by the corresponding context already or timed out.
member.param: The event token retrieved from the network operator hotspot authentication event. The token is a GUID in string format.
The network operator hotspot authentication context.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationContext.WirelessNetworkId
member.summary: Gets the SSID of the WLAN access point of the hotspot.
member.returns: A byte array that contains the SSID.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationEventDetails
member.summary: Provides the content of the event that is raised for background task handlers for the hotspot authentication event.

member.name: P:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.HotspotAuthenticationEventDetails.EventToken
member.summary: Gets a GUID that uniquely identifies the authentication attempt for which this event was raised.
member.returns: A GUID that uniquely identifies the connection attempt.

member.summary: The watcher has been started and has yet to enumerate the existing accounts.

member.summary: The watcher is running and has finished enumerating the existing accounts.

member.summary: The watcher has been stopped. No events will be delivered while the watcher is in this state.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.MobileBroadbandAccountWatcherStatus.Aborted
member.summary: The watcher has aborted its watching operation due to an unexpected error condition. No events will be delivered while the watcher is in this state.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode
member.summary: Describes the USSD response codes for messages sent to the network.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.NoActionRequired
member.summary: The USSD message that was received is either a USSD notification from the network or a response to an earlier request. No further information is necessary. The USSD session is closed.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.ActionRequired
member.summary: The USSD message that was received is either a USSD request from the network or a response to a message sent to the network. Additional information is needed. The USSD session is open.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.Terminated
member.summary: The USSD session has been terminated by the network or a local client.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.OtherLocalClient
member.summary: The previous USSD request failed because another local client has an active USSD session.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.OperationNotSupported
member.summary: The previous USSD request failed because the request was invalid or cannot be handled by the driver, device, or network.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators.UssdResultCode.NetworkTimeout
member.summary: The USSD session has been closed because there was no response from the network.

member.summary: The computed inbound bandwidth estimate in bits per second.

member.summary: A measure of the instability of the outbound bandwidth estimate in bits per second.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.BandwidthStatistics.OutboundBandwidthPeaked
member.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the computed outbound bandwidth estimate for the network path has peaked.This member is set to true when the app is using enough of the connection bandwidth that the system can get a good estimate of the bandwidth delay product and can determine that the congestion window is a substantial fraction of the bandwidth delay product. This member can change from true to false if the app sends less data.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.BandwidthStatistics.InboundBandwidthPeaked
member.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the computed inbound bandwidth estimate for the network has peaked.This member is set to true when the app is using enough of the connection bandwidth that the system can get a good estimate of the bandwidth delay product and can determine that the congestion window is a substantial fraction of the bandwidth delay product. This member can change from true to false if the app sends less data.

member.summary: The maximum sampled round trip time, in microseconds, for a StreamSocket object.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.RoundTripTimeStatistics.Min
member.summary: The minimum sampled round trip time, in microseconds, for a StreamSocket object.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.RoundTripTimeStatistics.Sum
member.summary: A smoothed value round trip time, in microseconds, computed from all sampled round trip times for a StreamSocket object. The smoothing is a weighted additive function that uses the Variance member.

member.summary: The ControlChannelTrigger was reset as a result of fast user switching.

member.summary: The ControlChannelTrigger was reset as a result of a low power exit (Connected Standby exit).

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerResourceType.RequestSoftwareSlot
member.summary: Request a software slot from the system.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerResourceType.RequestHardwareSlot
member.summary: Request a hardware slot from the system.

member.name: T:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus
member.summary: Specifies if the system was able to complete configuration of a ControlChannelTrigger object for use by class elements in the Windows.Networking.Sockets and related namespaces.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.HardwareSlotRequested
member.summary: The policy check succeeded and a hardware slot has been requested from the system.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.SoftwareSlotAllocated
member.summary: The policy check succeeded and a software slot was allocated by the system.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.HardwareSlotAllocated
member.summary: A hardware slot was allocated by the system.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.PolicyError
member.summary: A policy error occurred when the system tried to complete configuration of a ControlChannelTrigger. This error can occur when an app has requested more connections for hardware or software slots than are permitted by system policy.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.SystemError
member.summary: A system error occurred when the system tried to complete configuration of a ControlChannelTrigger for a hardware slot.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.TransportDisconnected
member.summary: The network transport associated with the ControlChannelTrigger was disconnected. The underlying TCP connection was already disconnected by a TCP reset received from the remote destination or a graceful disconnect by either the app or the remote destination. The most common occurrence is a TCP reset or a graceful disconnect sent by the remote destination.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.ControlChannelTriggerStatus.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The service provided by the ControlChannelTrigger is unavailable. This can happen if the network connection broker service is not yet ready but the app is trying to establish a ControlChannelTrigger channel. This status code is provided under the following conditions:When there is fast user switching and the new user is trying to establish the ControlChannelTrigger channel.When the system is entering a low power mode (Connected standby mode) and the app is trying to create a software slot. Software slots are available only when the system is active and not in low power mode. The mitigation in both these cases is to listen for System Event broker events and register the ControlChannelTrigger channel at that point.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateExpired
member.summary: A required certificate is not within its validity period when verifying against the current system clock or the timestamp in the signed file. This error is also returned if the validity periods of the certification chain do not nest correctly.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateUntrustedRoot
member.summary: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider. This error is also returned if a certificate chain could not be built to a trusted root authority.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateCommonNameIsIncorrect
member.summary: The certificate is not valid for the requested usage. This error is also returned if the certificate has an invalid name. The name is not included in the permitted list or is explicitly excluded.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateWrongUsage
member.summary: The certificate is not valid for the requested usage.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateRevoked
member.summary: A certificate was explicitly revoked by its issuer. This error is also returned if the certificate was explicitly marked as untrusted by the user.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateNoRevocationCheck
member.summary: The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateRevocationServerOffline
member.summary: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.

member.name: F:Windows.Networking.Sockets.SocketErrorStatus.CertificateIsInvalid
member.summary: The supplied certificate is invalid. This can be returned for a number of reasons:A certificate that can only be used as an end-entity is being used as a CA or vice versa. A path length constraint in the certification chain has been violated.A certificate contains an unknown extension that is marked critical.A certificate is being used for a purpose other than the ones specified by its CA.A parent of a given certificate in fact did not issue that child certificate.A certificate is missing or has an empty value for an important field, such as a subject or issuer name.The signature of the certificate cannot be verified.The certificate has an invalid policy. A certificate's basic constraint extension has not been observed.

member.summary: A socket that prefers to use the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for encryption. This value prefers that full encryption be used, but allows a NULL cipher (no encryption) based on the server configuration.

member.name: N:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId
member.summary: Enables both Windows Store apps and desktop apps to use Live to authenticate users by using their Microsoft account. After authentication, apps can get back a JSON token with an ID that can be used for that user with your application.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.CredentialPromptType
member.summary: Provides the ability to control when to show or hide the credential prompt user interface. This includes the user interface for the app to collect user consent to access data stored in Live. The user must see the user interface in order for the app to obtain any user data, if not app will see an error when they try to obtain user data.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.CredentialPromptType.PromptIfNeeded
member.summary: Show the UI only if an error occurred.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.CredentialPromptType.RetypeCredentials
member.summary: Always show the UI. If a default username exists, the username is automatically inserted into the appropriate field.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.CredentialPromptType.DoNotPrompt
member.summary: Never show the UI, even if an error occurs.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.OnlineIdAuthenticator
member.summary: Provides an app with the ability to start the authentication request to get JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) tokens to use with your service or request tickets that can be used to get data that the user has consented to for your app using the Live ConnectAPI.

member.returns: An object representing the authentication operation.
member.param: A request object that provides the ability for an app to specify the service and policy used to authenticate a user to obtain identity properties and tickets.

The type of credentials.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the OnlineIdServiceTicketRequest class.
member.param: The service for the request.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.OnlineIdServiceTicketRequest.Policy
member.summary: The policy used to authenticate users. Supported values are JWT, which returns data using the JSON format. For apps that are requesting user consent to access stored in Live, app developer must pass a policy of DELEGATION.
member.returns: A string that represents the policy.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Authentication.OnlineId.OnlineIdServiceTicketRequest.Service
member.summary: Identifies the service your app uses. The service name must match the DNS name you supplied when registering your app on manage.dev.live.com. Tickets are issued only for this service. For apps that are requesting user consent to access stored in Live, you must pass the offers to which your app needs access. The available list of offers can be found at our Scopes and Permissions page. The ticket can then be used with the Live Connect REST apis to access data that a user has consented to give to the app. Check out our REST APIs topic to learn more. Alternatively, the app can use the Live Connect SDK which will make these calls itself.
member.returns: A string that represents the service.

member.name: N:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web
member.summary: Enables apps to integrate with online web services without exposing a user's credentials. The web authentication broker provides a set of APIs and infrastructure for apps to use Internet authentication and authorization protocols like OAuth and OpenID.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationBroker
member.summary: Starts the asynchronous authentication operation.
member.capability: Required to access the Internet.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationBroker.AuthenticateAsync(Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions,Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Starts the asynchronous authentication operation with three inputs.
member.returns: The way to query the status and get the results of the authentication operation. If you are getting an invalid parameter error, the most common cause is that you are not using HTTPS for the requestUri parameter.
member.param: The options for the authentication operation.
The starting URI of the web service. This URI must be a secure address of https://.

The callback URI that indicates the completion of the web authentication. The broker matches this URI against every URI that it is about to navigate to using a left-hand match. The broker never navigates to this URI, instead the broker returns the control back to the application when the user clicks a link or a web server redirection is made.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationBroker.AuthenticateAsync(Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions,Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Starts the asynchronous authentication operation with two inputs.
member.returns: The way to query the status and get the results of the authentication operation. If you are getting an invalid parameter error, the most common cause is that you are not using HTTPS for the requestUri parameter.
member.param: The options for the authentication operation.
The starting URI of the web service. This URI must be a secure address of https://.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationBroker.GetCurrentApplicationCallbackUri
member.summary: Gets the current application callback URI.
member.returns: The URI of the current application.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Contains the options available to the asynchronous operation.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions.None
member.summary: No options are requested.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions.SilentMode
member.summary: Tells the web authentication broker to not render any UI. For use with Single Sign On (SSO). If the server tries to display a webpage, the authentication operation fails. You should try again without this option.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions.UseTitle
member.summary: Tells the web authentication broker to return the window title string of the webpage in the ResponseData property.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions.UseHttpPost
member.summary: Tells the web authentication broker to return the body of the HTTP POST in the ResponseData property. For use with single sign-on (SSO) only.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Authentication.Web.WebAuthenticationOptions.UseCorporateNetwork
member.summary: Tells the web authentication broker to render the webpage in an app container that supports privateNetworkClientServer, enterpriseAuthentication, and sharedUserCertificate capabilities. Note the application that uses this flag must have these capabilities as well.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.AuthenticationProtocol.Ntlm
member.summary: The authentication protocol is NTLM. Credentials are transformed before being returned to the caller.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.AuthenticationProtocol.Kerberos
member.summary: The authentication protocol is Kerberos. Credentials are transformed before being returned to the caller.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.AuthenticationProtocol.Negotiate
member.summary: The authentication protocol is negotiate, including negotiate extensions. Credentials are transformed before being returned to the caller.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.AuthenticationProtocol.CredSsp
member.summary: The authentication protocol is for remote access using the Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) protocol.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.AuthenticationProtocol.Custom
member.summary: The authentication protocol is anything other than the previous ones. Credentials are returned to the caller as plaintext.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPicker
member.summary: Creates an asynchronous object that displays a dialog box of credentials to the user and collects the user's response.

member.summary: Displays a dialog box to the user and collects credentials from the user.
member.returns: The credential and options from the user.
member.param: The options on displaying and collecting the credential box.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPicker.PickAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor used to initiate asynchronous prompting operations using two inputs.
member.returns: The credential and options from the user.
