The message to display in the dialog box.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPicker.PickAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor used to initiate asynchronous prompting operations using three inputs.
member.returns: The credential and options from the user.
member.param: The target name to display.
The message to display in the dialog box.
The caption to display in the dialog box.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions
member.summary: Controls the appearance and behavior of a credential prompt.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.AlwaysDisplayDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets the option of whether the dialog box is displayed.
member.returns: Gets or sets the option of always displaying the dialog box. The default value is False.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.AuthenticationProtocol
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication protocol.
member.returns: Name of the authentication protocol to use for credential authentication. The default value is Negotiate.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.CallerSavesCredential
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the caller wants to save the credentials.
member.returns: Gets or sets whether the caller wants to save the credentials. The default value is False.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets the caption text that is displayed to the user.
member.returns: Text that appears in the message header of the dialog box. The default value is the caller's app name.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new, empty instance of the CredentialPickerOptions object.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.CredentialSaveOption
member.summary: Gets or sets the option on saving credentials.
member.returns: The option specifies the initial state of the dialog's Save Credential check box. The default value is clear (unchecked). This property is ignored if the caller specifies Hidden in the CredentialSaveOption enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.CustomAuthenticationProtocol
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the authentication protocol is custom rather than a standard authentication protocol.
member.returns: The authentication protocol is custom rather than a standard authentication protocol. The default value is none.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the error code.
member.returns: If nonzero, represents a Win32 ERROR_* status value that identifies the error information to be formatted and displayed in the dialog box. The default value is ERROR_SUCCESS if no error occurred.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of text that displays to the user.
member.returns: Text that appears in the message body of the dialog box. The default value is Enter credentials or localized equivalent.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.PreviousCredential
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to fill dialog box fields with previous credentials.
member.returns: Determines whether dialog box fields are filled with previous credentials. The default value is not to prepopulate the fields.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerOptions.TargetName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the target computer.
member.returns: Name of the target computer. The default value is the caller's computer.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults
member.summary: Describes the results of the dialog box operation.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.Credential
member.summary: Gets the opaque credential.
member.returns: A byte buffer that contains the opaque credential. If the credential is not available, a valid, but empty IBuffer object is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.CredentialDomainName
member.summary: Gets the domain name portion of the unpacked credential.
member.returns: The domain name of the credential. If the domain name is not available, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.CredentialPassword
member.summary: Gets the password portion of the unpacked credential.
member.returns: The password of the credential. If the password is not available, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.CredentialSaved
member.summary: Gets the status of the credential save operation.
member.returns: Indicates whether the credential was successfully saved by the credential manager. This value is always False if the caller specified the CallerSavesCredential property.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.CredentialSaveOption
member.summary: Gets the state of the Save Credentials check box.
member.returns: Indicates the state of the dialog box Save check box. If no check box was displayed, the value is None.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.CredentialUserName
member.summary: Gets the user name of the unpacked credential.
member.returns: The user name of the credential used. If the user name is not available, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialPickerResults.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the value of the error code.
member.returns: The value of the error code. If the operation status indicates a failure, this property contains the extended error information. If the operation status is anything except failure, the value is zero.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialSaveOption
member.summary: Identifies the state of the dialog box option on whether to save credentials.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialSaveOption.Unselected
member.summary: The Save credentials? dialog box is not selected, indicating that the user doesn't want their credentials saved.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialSaveOption.Selected
member.summary: The Save credentials? dialog box is selected, indicating that the user wants their credentials saved.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Credentials.UI.CredentialSaveOption.Hidden
member.summary: The Save credentials? dialog box is not displayed at all.

member.name: N:Windows.Security.Cryptography
member.summary: Contains a class that can be used for encoding and decoding data, generating random numbers, and converting between byte arrays and buffers.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.Cryptography.BinaryStringEncoding
member.summary: Contains encoding formats that can be used in the ConvertStringToBinary and ConvertBinaryToString methods.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Cryptography.BinaryStringEncoding.Utf8
member.summary: Eight bit Unicode Transformation Format. The process encodes each Unicode code point into one to four 8-bit bytes. Code points represented by lower numerical values are encoded using fewer bytes. In particular, the first 128 characters correspond exactly to the ASCII character set and are encoded by using a single octet.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Cryptography.BinaryStringEncoding.Utf16LE
member.summary: Sixteen bit Unicode Transformation Format in little-endian byte order. The encoding process creates a variable length result of one or two 8-bit bytes per Unicode code point.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.Cryptography.BinaryStringEncoding.Utf16BE
member.summary: Sixteen bit Unicode Transformation Format in big-endian byte order.

member.name: N:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates
member.summary: Contains types that you can use to create certificate requests and install certificate responses.

member.summary: Represents a certificate enrollment manager.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates.CertificateEnrollmentManager.CreateRequestAsync(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates.CertificateRequestProperties)
member.summary: Asynchronously creates a PKCS #10 certificate request based on properties specified in a CertificateRequestProperties object.
member.returns: This method returns a string that contains the base64 encoded PKCS #10 certificate request.
member.param: A CertificateRequestProperties object that contains the property values used to create the certificate request.

member.summary: Asynchronously imports a certificate from a Personal Information Exchange (PFX) message.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.
member.param: Base64-encoded PFX message.
The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. The password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet.
A value of the ExportOption enumeration that specifies whether the key can be exported.
A value of the KeyProtectionLevel enumeration that specifies the strength of the key protection. The default is NoConsent.
An InstallOptions enumeration value that specifies the certificate installation option.
The display name of the enrolled certificate. This value overwrites the FriendlyName property inside the PFX message.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates.CertificateEnrollmentManager.InstallCertificateAsync(System.String,Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates.InstallOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously Installs a certificate chain into the app container on the local computer.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.
member.param: The encoded certificate. The certificate is encoded by using Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) as defined by the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1) standard.
An InstallOptions enumeration value that specifies the certificate installation option.

member.summary: Decrypts content that was previously encrypted by using a symmetric or asymmetric algorithm.
member.returns: Decrypted data.
member.param: Cryptographic key to use for decryption. This can be an asymmetric or a symmetric key. For more information, see AsymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider and SymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider.
Buffer that contains the encrypted data.
Buffer that contains the initialization vector. If an initialization vector (IV) was used to encrypt the data, you must use the same IV to decrypt the data. For more information, see Encrypt.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicEngine.DecryptAndAuthenticate(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicKey,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Decrypts and authenticates data.
member.returns: Buffer that contains the decrypted data.
member.param: Symmetric key to use.
Data to be decrypted and authenticated.
Nonce to be used. This must be the same nonce used by the EncryptAndAuthenticate method.
Authentication tag.
Authenticated data. This can be null.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicEngine.DeriveKeyMaterial(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicKey,Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.KeyDerivationParameters,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Derives a key from another key by using a key derivation function.
member.returns: Buffer that contains the derived key.
member.param: The symmetric or secret key used for derivation.
Derivation parameters. The parameters vary depending on the type of KDF algorithm used.
Requested size, in bits, of the derived key.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicEngine.Encrypt(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicKey,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Encrypts data by using a symmetric or asymmetric algorithm.
member.returns: Encrypted data.
member.param: Cryptographic key to use for encryption. This can be an asymmetric or a symmetric key. For more information, see AsymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider and SymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider.
Data to encrypt.

Buffer that contains the initialization vector. This can be null for a symmetric algorithm and should always be null for an asymmetric algorithm. If an initialization vector (IV) was used to encrypt the data, you must use the same IV to decrypt the data. You can use the GenerateRandom method to create an IV that contains random data. Other IVs, such as nonce-generated vectors, require custom implementation. For more information, see Symmetric Key Encryption.Cipher block chaining (CBC) block cipher mode algorithms require an initialization vector. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicEngine.EncryptAndAuthenticate(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicKey,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Performs authenticated encryption.
member.returns: Represents the encrypted and authenticated data.
member.param: Symmetric key to use for encryption.
Data to be encrypted and authenticated.

Nonce to be used. A nonce is a variable that has minimal chance of repeating. For example, you can use a random value that is newly generated for each use, a time stamp, a sequence number, or some combination of these. The Microsoft GCM implementation requires a 12-byte nonce. The CCM implementation requires a 7- to 13- byte nonce.
Authenticated data. This can be null.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicEngine.Sign(Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core.CryptographicKey,Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Signs digital content.
member.returns: Signed data.
member.param: Key used for signing.
Data to be signed.

member.summary: Verifies a message signature.
member.returns: true if the message is verified.
member.param: Key used for verification. This must be the same key previously used to sign the message.
Message to be verified.
Signature previously computed over the message to be verified.

member.name: N:Windows.Security.ExchangeActiveSyncProvisioning
member.summary: Enables an app for mail to evaluate and apply the Exchange Active Synchronization (EAS) policies.

member.returns: The friendly name of the local computer as the NetBIOS computer name. The value must be less than 1024 characters.

member.summary: Returns the identifier of the local computer.
member.returns: The identifier of the local computer. The value range is 16 bytes.

member.returns: The operating system of the local computer. The value must be less than 1024 characters.

member.returns: The system manufacturer of the local computer. The value must be less than 1024 characters.

member.returns: The system product name of the local computer. The value must be less than 1024 characters.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.ExchangeActiveSyncProvisioning.EasClientDeviceInformation.SystemSku

member.returns: The system SKU of the local computer.

member.summary: Modern mail apps evaluate and apply the EAS security policies.

member.summary: Evaluates the EAS policies.
member.returns: Returns the results of the compliance check, in synchronous mode.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.DownloadsFolder
member.summary: Creates files and folders inside the Downloads folder.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.DownloadsFolder.CreateFileAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new file inside the Downloads folder.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns the new file as a StorageFile object.
member.param: The desired name of the file to create.If a file with the specified name already exists, a similar but unique name will be used. For example, if desiredName is MyFileName.jpg and a file by that name already exists in the Downloads folder, the new file will be created with a name like MyFileName (1).jpg instead.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.DownloadsFolder.CreateFileAsync(System.String,Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption)
member.summary: Creates a new file in the Downloads folder, and specifies what to do if a file with the same name already exists in the Downloads folder.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns the new file as a StorageFile object.
member.param: The desired name of the file to create.If there is an existing file in the current folder that already has the specified desiredName, the specified CreationCollisionOption determines how responds to the conflict.

The enum value that determines how responds if the desiredName is the same as the name of an existing file in the current folder.Because the app can only access files in the Downloads folder that it created, you can't specify OpenIfExists or ReplaceExisting for this parameter.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.DownloadsFolder.CreateFolderAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subfolder in the Downloads folder.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns the new subfolder as a StorageFolder.
member.param: The desired name of the subfolder to create.If a subfolder with the specified name already exists, a similar but unique name will be used. For example, if desiredName is MyFolder and a subfolder by that name already exists in the Downloads folder, the new subfolder will be created with a name like MyFolder (1) instead.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.DownloadsFolder.CreateFolderAsync(System.String,Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption)
member.summary: Creates a new subfolder in the Downloads folder, and specifies what to do if a subfolder with the same name already exists in the Downloads folder.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns the new subfolder as a StorageFolder.
member.param: The desired name of the subfolder to create.If there is an existing subfolder in the Downloads folder that already has the specified desiredName, the specified CreationCollisionOption determines how responds to the conflict.

The enum value that determines how responds if the desiredName is the same as the name of an existing subfolder in the Downloads folder.Because the app can only access folders in the Downloads folder that it created, you can't specify OpenIfExists or ReplaceExisting for this parameter.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.CreateStreamedFileAsync(System.String,Windows.Storage.StreamedFileDataRequestedHandler,Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStreamReference)
member.summary: Creates a StorageFile to represent the specified stream of data. This method lets the app produce the data on-demand by specifying a function to be invoked when the StorageFile that represents the stream is first accessed.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns a StorageFile object that represents the new stream of data.
member.param: The user-friendly name of the StorageFile to create, including a file type extension.

The function that should be invoked when the StorageFile that is returned is first accessed. This function should produce the data stream represented by the returned StorageFile and lets the app produce data on-demand instead of writing the contents of the file at creation time.
The thumbnail image for the StorageFile to create.For a high-quality thumbnail, one edge of this thumbnail should be at least 1024 pixels.

member.param: The user-friendly name of the StorageFile to create, including a file type extension.
The of the resource used to create the StorageFile.
The thumbnail image for the StorageFile to create.For a high-quality thumbnail, one edge of this thumbnail should be at least 1024 pixels.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.GetThumbnailAsync(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves an adjusted thumbnail image for the file, determined by the purpose of the thumbnail and the requested size.
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a StorageItemThumbnail that represents the thumbnail image or null if there is no thumbnail image associated with the file.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

The requested size, in pixels, of the longest edge of the thumbnail. uses the requestedSize as a guide and tries to scale the thumbnail image without reducing the quality of the image.If can't find a thumbnail image that it can scale to meet the requested size, a larger thumbnail might be returned. If no larger thumbnail is available, a thumbnail image that is smaller than the requested size might be returned.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.GetThumbnailAsync(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves an adjusted thumbnail image for the file, determined by the purpose of the thumbnail, the requested size, and the specified options.
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a StorageItemThumbnail that represents the thumbnail image or null if there is no thumbnail image associated with the file.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

The requested size, in pixels, of the longest edge of the thumbnail. uses the requestedSize as a guide and tries to scale the thumbnail image without reducing the quality of the image.If can't find a thumbnail image that it can scale to meet the requested size, a larger thumbnail might be returned. If no larger thumbnail is available, a thumbnail image that is smaller than the requested size might be returned.

The enum value that describes the desired behavior to use to retrieve the thumbnail image. The specified behavior might affect the size and/or quality of the image and how quickly the thumbnail image is retrieved.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.IsOfType(Windows.Storage.StorageItemTypes)
member.summary: Determines whether the current StorageFile matches the specified StorageItemTypes value.
member.returns: True if the StorageFile matches the specified value; otherwise false.
member.param: The value to match against.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.MoveAndReplaceAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Moves the current file to the location of the specified file and replaces the specified file in that location.
member.returns: No object or value is returned by this method.
member.param: The file to replace.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.MoveAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder)
member.summary: Moves the current file to the specified folder.
member.returns: No object or value is returned by this method.
member.param: The destination folder where the file is moved.This destination folder must be a physical location. Otherwise, if the destination folder exists only in memory, like a file group, this method fails and throws an exception.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.MoveAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Moves the current file to the specified folder and renames the file according to the desired name.
member.returns: No object or value is returned by this method.
member.param: The destination folder where the file is moved.This destination folder must be a physical location. Otherwise, if the destination folder exists only in memory, like a file group, this method fails and throws an exception.
The desired name of the file after it is moved.If there is an existing file in the destination folder that already has the specified desiredNewName, generates a unique name for the file.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.MoveAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String,Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption)
member.summary: Moves the current file to the specified folder and renames the file according to the desired name. This method also specifies what to do if a file with the same name already exists in the specified folder.
member.returns: No object or value is returned by this method.
member.param: The destination folder where the file is moved.This destination folder must be a physical location. Otherwise, if the destination folder exists only in memory, like a file group, this method fails and throws an exception.

The desired name of the file after it is moved.If there is an existing file in the destination folder that already has the specified desiredNewName, the specified NameCollisionOption determines how responds to the conflict.
An enum value that determines how responds if the desiredNewName is the same as the name of an existing file in the destination folder.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.ReplaceWithStreamedFileAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile,Windows.Storage.StreamedFileDataRequestedHandler,Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStreamReference)
member.summary: Replaces the contents of the file referred to by the specified IStorageFile object with a new data stream. This method lets the app produce the data on-demand by specifying a function to be invoked when the StorageFile that represents the stream is first accessed.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns a StorageFile object that represents the new data stream. Subsequently, this StorageFile object should be used to access file content instead of the file (type IStorageFile) that was specified to be replace.
member.param: The file (type IStorageFile) that the new data stream should be written to.

The function that should be invoked when the StorageFile that is returned is first accessed. This function should produce the data stream represented by the returned StorageFile and lets the app produce data on-demand instead of writing the contents of the file at creation time.
The thumbnail image for the StorageFile to create.For a high-quality thumbnail, one edge of this thumbnail should be at least 1024 pixels.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.StorageFile.ReplaceWithStreamedFileFromUriAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile,Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStreamReference)
member.summary: Replaces the contents of the file referred to by the specified IStorageFile object with a new data stream of the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). This method lets the app download the data on-demand when the StorageFile that represents the stream is first accessed.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns a StorageFile object that represents the streamed file. Subsequently, this StorageFile object should be used to access file content instead of the file (type IStorageFile) that was specified to be replace.
member.param: The file that the created StorageFile will provide a stream of.
The of the resource used to create the StorageFile.
The thumbnail image for the StorageFile to create.For a high-quality thumbnail, one edge of this thumbnail should be at least 1024 pixels.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if a file with the desired name already exists in the current folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Create the new file or folder with the desired name, or automatically appends a number if a file or folder already exists with that name.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Create the new file or folder with the desired name, and replaces any file or folder that already exists with that name.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Create the new file or folder with the desired name, or returns an error if a file or folder already exists with that name.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption.OpenIfExists
member.summary: Create the new file or folder with the desired name, or returns an existing item if a file or folder already exists with that name.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.FileAccessMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to access a file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAccessMode.Read
member.summary: The file stream is accessed in read-only mode. If the file is changed, subsequent read operations will fail. Multiple, independent read-only streams may be used to read a file. We recommend you keep read-only file streams open only while your app is actively reading from the file. You can close a stream by calling Close.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAccessMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: The file stream is accessed in read/write mode. The file supports a single write stream and writing is non-transacted and in-place.You should use this mode only when you are ready to write immediately in order to avoid interrupting other operations.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes
member.summary: Describes the attributes of system file or folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The item is normal.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The item is read only.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The item is a directory.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes.Archive
member.summary: The item is archived.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileAttributes.Temporary
member.summary: The item is a temporary file.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do if a file or folder renamed, moved, or copied and there is an existing file or folder with the same name in the desired location.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption.GenerateUniqueName
member.summary: Automatically generate a unique name by appending a number to the name of the file or folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: Replace the existing file or folder. Your app must have permission to access the location that contains the existing file or folder. Access to a location can be granted in several ways, for example, by a capability declared in your application's manifest, or by the user through the . You can use Windows.Storage.AccessCache to manage the list of locations that are accessible to your app via the .

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption.FailIfExists
member.summary: Return an error if another file or folder exists with the same name and abort the operation.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.StorageDeleteOption
member.summary: Specifies whether an item that is deleted is sent to the Recycle Bin or permanently deleted.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.Default
member.summary: If the item is in an application storage location (a location that can be accessed through the ApplicationData class), it will be permanently deleted and won't appear in the Recycle Bin. Otherwise, the item is deleted according to the default behavior for the location (which may move the item to the Recycle Bin).

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StorageDeleteOption.PermanentDelete
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item without moving it to the recycle bin.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.StorageItemTypes
member.summary: Describes the kind of item that is represented by an instance of a class that implements IStorageItem (like a StorageFile or StorageFolder object).

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StorageItemTypes.None
member.summary: A generic storage item that represents either a file or a folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StorageItemTypes.File
member.summary: A file that is represented as a StorageFile instance.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StorageItemTypes.Folder
member.summary: A folder that is represented as a StorageFolder instance.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.StreamedFileFailureMode
member.summary: Indicates the reason that data could not be streamed.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StreamedFileFailureMode.Failed
member.summary: The data can't be streamed.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StreamedFileFailureMode.CurrentlyUnavailable
member.summary: The data currently can't be accessed.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.StreamedFileFailureMode.Incomplete
member.summary: The data weren't complete.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.IStorageFile.CopyAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the file in the specified folder, using the desired name.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns a StorageFile that represents the copy.
member.param: The destination folder where the copy is created.
The desired name of the copy.If there is an existing file in the destination folder that already has the specified desiredNewName, generates a unique name for the copy.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.IStorageFile.CopyAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String,Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the file in the specified folder, using the desired name. This method also specifies what to do if an existing file in the specified folder has the same name.
member.returns: When this method completes, it returns a StorageFile that represents the copy.
member.param: The destination folder where the copy is created.

The desired name of the copy.If there is an existing file in the destination folder that already has the specified desiredNewName, the specified NameCollisionOption determines how responds to the conflict.
An enum value that determines how responds if the desiredNewName is the same as the name of an existing file in the destination folder.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.IStorageItemProperties.GetThumbnailAsync(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode)
member.summary: Retrieves an adjusted thumbnail image for the item, determined by the purpose of the thumbnail.
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a StorageItemThumbnail that represents the thumbnail image or null if there is no thumbnail image associated with the item.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.IStorageItemProperties.GetThumbnailAsync(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves an adjusted thumbnail image for the item, determined by the purpose of the thumbnail and the requested size.
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a StorageItemThumbnail that represents the thumbnail image or null if there is no thumbnail image associated with the item.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

The requested size, in pixels, of the longest edge of the thumbnail. uses the requestedSize as a guide and tries to scale the thumbnail image without reducing the quality of the image.If can't find a thumbnail image that it can scale to meet the requested size, a larger thumbnail might be returned. If no larger thumbnail is available, a thumbnail image that is smaller than the requested size might be returned.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.IStorageItemProperties.GetThumbnailAsync(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves an adjusted thumbnail image for the item, determined by the purpose of the thumbnail, the requested size, and the specified options.
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a StorageItemThumbnail that represents the thumbnail image or null if there is no thumbnail image associated with the item.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

The requested size, in pixels, of the longest edge of the thumbnail. uses the requestedSize as a guide and tries to scale the thumbnail image without reducing the quality of the image.If can't find a thumbnail image that it can scale to meet the requested size, a larger thumbnail might be returned. If no larger thumbnail is available, a thumbnail image that is smaller than the requested size might be returned.

The enum value that describes the desired behavior to use to retrieve the thumbnail image. The specified behavior might affect the size and/or quality of the image and how quickly the thumbnail image is retrieved.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions
member.summary: Describes the behavior to use when the app accesses an item in a list.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions.None
member.summary: Default.When the app accesses the item, the app retrieves the most current version of the item from any available location and, if necessary, the user can enter additional information.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions.DisallowUserInput
member.summary: When the app accesses the item, the user is prevented from entering information.For example, if the app accesses a file that is stored using this option and the file normally triggers a request for the user to enter credentials, the request is suppressed.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions.FastLocationsOnly
member.summary: When the app accesses the item, it is retrieved from a fast location like the local file system.For example, if the app accesses a file that is stored using this option and a version of the file is only available remotely, the file will not be accessed.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions.UseReadOnlyCachedCopy
member.summary: When the app accesses the item, the app retrieves a cached, read-only version of the file. This version of the file might not be the most recent.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.AccessCache.AccessCacheOptions.SuppressAccessTimeUpdate
member.summary: When the app accesses the item in the StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList, preserves the item's current position in the and does not update the access time of the item.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.BulkAccess.FileInformationFactory
member.summary: Used to load information about files and folders from the results of a query and to bind these file system items to JavaScript ListView or XAML ListView and GridView controls. After information is loaded, an app can then access that information quickly using synchronous operations.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.BulkAccess.FileInformationFactory.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageQueryResultBase,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode)
member.summary: Creates a new FileInformationFactory object that retrieves information about the StorageFile and StorageFolder objects in the specified query result.
member.param: The result of a query of files and folders on the system.To learn about query result objects, see StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, and StorageItemQueryResult.
A value that indicates the type of thumbnail view to retrieve for the StorageFile and StorageFolder.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.BulkAccess.FileInformationFactory.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageQueryResultBase,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new FileInformationFactory object that retrieves information about the StorageFile and StorageFolder objects in the specified query result and that specifies the requested size for thumbnails that are retrieved for the objects.
member.param: The result of a query of files and folders on the system.To learn about query result objects, see StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, and StorageItemQueryResult.
A value that indicates the type of thumbnail view to retrieve for the StorageFile and StorageFolder.
The requested minimum size, in pixels, of the StorageFile and StorageFolder thumbnails.If thumbnails are not required for IStorageItemInformation objects, set the requestedSize to 0.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.BulkAccess.FileInformationFactory.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageQueryResultBase,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new FileInformationFactory object that retrieves information about the StorageFile and StorageFolder objects in the specified query result, and that specifies the requested size and options for thumbnails that are retrieved for the objects.
member.param: The result of a query of files and folders on the system.To learn about query result objects, see StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, and StorageItemQueryResult.
A value that indicates the type of thumbnail view to retrieve for the StorageFile and StorageFolder.
The requested minimum size, in pixels, of the StorageFile and StorageFolder thumbnails.If thumbnails are not required for IStorageItemInformation objects, set the requestedSize to 0.

The thumbnail retrieval options.If you're using FileInformationFactory with the JavaScript ListView or XAML ListView and GridView controls, don't specify ThumbnailOptions.ReturnOnlyIfCached because this mode may prevent the control from being correctly populated with thumbnails.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.BulkAccess.FileInformationFactory.#ctor(Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageQueryResultBase,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new FileInformationFactory object that retrieves information about the StorageFile and StorageFolder objects in the specified query result, specifies the requested size and options for thumbnails that are retrieved for the objects, and indicates whether to delay loading information.
member.param: The result of a query of files and folders on the system.To learn about query result objects, see StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, and StorageItemQueryResult.
A value that indicates the type of thumbnail view to retrieve for the StorageFile and StorageFolder.
The requested minimum size, in pixels, of the StorageFile and StorageFolder thumbnails.If thumbnails are not required for IStorageItemInformation objects, set the requestedSize to 0.

The thumbnail retrieval options.If you're using FileInformationFactory with the JavaScript ListView or XAML ListView and GridView controls, don't specify ThumbnailOptions.ReturnOnlyIfCached because this mode may prevent the control from being correctly populated with thumbnails.

True to delay loading information; otherwise false. By default, this option is false and delay loading is not used.If delayLoad is true, it authorizes the FileInformationFactory to return IStorageItemInformation objects before thumbnails are available. Subsequently, the system fires a ThumbnailUpdated event when thumbnails become available. Using delay loading is recommended because it makes apps seem more responsive.If delayLoad is false (as it is by default), the system will require more time to retrieve IStorageItemInformation objects, but after the objects are retrieved all cached thumbnails will be accessible synchronously. Thumbnails that are not cached must still be accessed asynchronously in response to the ThumbnailUpdated event.

member.name: N:Windows.Storage.Compression
member.summary: Provides a unified interface to the compression features included in Windows that frees developers from responsibility for managing block sizes, compression parameters, and other details that the native compression API requires.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm
member.summary: Identifies a compression algorithm to use when creating an instance of a compressor.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.InvalidAlgorithm
member.summary: This value represents an invalid compression algorithm. It is useful primarily for error checking.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.NullAlgorithm
member.summary: This value represents an algorithm that passes data through with no compression. It is useful primarily for testing.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.Mszip
member.summary: The compressor will use the MSZIP compression algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.Xpress
member.summary: The compressor will use the XPRESS compression algorithm.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.XpressHuff
member.summary: The compressor will use the XPRESS compression algorithm with Huffman encoding.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Compression.CompressAlgorithm.Lzms
member.summary: The compressor will use the LZMS compression algorithm.

member.summary: Detaches the underlying stream from the Compressor object so that the object can be closed using the Compressor.Close method without also closing the underlying stream.
member.returns: The stream of information.

member.summary: Flushes the compression stream asynchronously.

member.summary: Creates an instance of a compressor.

member.summary: Creates an instance of a compressor.

The compression algorithm used by the compressor to write underlyingStream.

Size in bytes of the intermediate buffer used by the compression algorithm. A value of 0 specifies that the compression algorithm will use its default block size. Valid non-zero values for this parameter are 32Kb to 64Mb.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.PicturesView
member.summary: To display previews of picture files. Default, preferred size: Medium, preferably at least 190 x 130 pixelsAspect ratio: Uniform, wide aspect ratio of about .7

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.VideosView
member.summary: To display previews of video files. Default, preferred size: Medium, preferably at least 190 x 130 pixelsAspect ratio: Uniform, wide aspect ratio of about .7

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.MusicView
member.summary: To display previews of music files.Default, preferred size: Small, preferably at least 40 x 40 pixels Aspect ratio: Uniform, square aspect ratio

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.DocumentsView
member.summary: To display previews of document files.Default, preferred size: Small, preferably at least 40 x 40 pixels Aspect ratio: Uniform, square aspect ratio

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.ListView
member.summary: To display previews of files (or other items) in a list.Default, preferred size: Small, preferably at least 40 x 40 pixels Aspect ratio: Uniform, square aspect ratio

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode.SingleItem
member.summary: To display a preview of any single item (like a file, folder, or file group).Default, preferred size: Large, at least 256 pixels on the longest sideAspect ratio: Variable, uses the original aspect ratio of the file

member.name: N:Windows.Storage.Provider
member.summary: Provides support, through a file picker, for apps that provide updates to local files from a remote storage location. Apps can provide file updates by participating in the Cached File Updater contract.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileUpdater
member.summary: Provides a way for the providing app to set the update information of a remote file.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileUpdater.SetUpdateInformation(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile,System.String,Windows.Storage.Provider.ReadActivationMode,Windows.Storage.Provider.WriteActivationMode,Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions)
member.summary: Sets how and when updates are triggered when the calling app accesses the local file and associates the local file with the providing app's remote file.
member.param: The local file.
An identifier for the providing app's master file. The providing app can use this to identify the correct remote file that is associated with the local file if the calling app triggers an update.
A value that indicates whether the calling app can read the local file without updating it.
A value that indicates whether the calling app can write to the local file and whether writing to the local file will trigger an update.
A value that describes circumstances in which the local file can be accessed by the calling app without triggering an update.

member.returns: The title to display in the top bar of the letterbox.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the providing app performs the update on the local version of the file or on the remote version of the file.
member.returns: An enum value that indicates whether the providing app performs the update on the local version of the file or on the remote version of the file.

member.summary: Updates the local file using a file specified by the providing app.

member.summary: Provides a way for the providing app to complete an update asynchronously.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateRequestDeferral.Complete
member.summary: Signals that the providing app finished responding to a FileUpdateRequested event.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about a FileUpdateRequested event.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateRequestedEventArgs.Request
member.summary: Gets the details of the requested file update for the providing app to use.
member.returns: The details of the requested file update.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions
member.summary: Describes circumstances wherein the local file can be accessed by the calling app without triggering an update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions.None
member.summary: The local file can be accessed by the calling app without triggering an update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions.RequireUpdateOnAccess
member.summary: The local file triggers an update if the calling app accesses the file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions.UseCachedFileWhenOffline
member.summary: The local file triggers an update if the calling app accesses the file. If the calling app doesn't have a network connection, it can access the local file without updating until a connection is established.However, the calling app can choose to access the local file without triggering an update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileOptions.DenyAccessWhenOffline
member.summary: The local file triggers an update if the calling app accesses the file. The calling app can't access the local file until a connection is established and the local file can be updated.However, the calling app can choose to access the local file without triggering an update.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileTarget
member.summary: Indicates whether the app updates the local or remote version of the file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileTarget.Local
member.summary: Update the local version of the file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.CachedFileTarget.Remote
member.summary: Update the remote version of the file.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus
member.summary: Describes the status of the update to the calling app.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.Incomplete
member.summary: Informs the calling app that the file was not updated because the providing app couldn't connect to its storage location. The calling app can access the local file until a connection can be established.For example, if the user's network connection fails, this status informs the calling app that it can use the local file until the connection is restored.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.Complete
member.summary: Informs the calling app that the file was updated and it can access local file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.UserInputNeeded
member.summary: Informs the calling app that the file was not updated because the providing app needs user input (like credentials) before it can update the file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.CurrentlyUnavailable
member.summary: Informs the calling app that the file was not updated because the providing app's storage location wasn't available. The calling app won't be able to access the local file until the providing app is able to complete the update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.Failed
member.summary: Informs the calling app that the file can't be updated now or in the future.For example, if the file was deleted, the providing app can't update it and would set this status.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.FileUpdateStatus.CompleteAndRenamed
member.summary: Indicates that the update completed successfully and the file has been renamed.For example, the file might be updated and renamed because of a conflict with changes in the remote version of the file.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.ReadActivationMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the calling app can read the local file without updating it.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.ReadActivationMode.NotNeeded
member.summary: The calling app can read the local file without updating it.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.ReadActivationMode.BeforeAccess
member.summary: The calling app can read the local file after the providing app is activated to update it.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.UIStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the file picker UI.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.UIStatus.Unavailable
member.summary: The is not showing UI and UI can't be requested.If the app that provides updates requests UI by completing its response to a FileUpdateRequested event and setting the FileUpdateRequest.Status to FileUpdateStatus.UserInputNeeded, the app will be closed immediately and the failure may be reported to the app that triggered the updates.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.UIStatus.Hidden
member.summary: The is not showing UI, but UI can be requested.If the app that provides updates requests UI by completing its response to a FileUpdateRequested event and setting the FileUpdateRequest.Status to FileUpdateStatus.UserInputNeeded, a UIRequested event will fire to indicate that UI will display immediately, and a new FileUpdateRequested event will fire (for the same file) so that the app can get the user's input and complete the request successfully.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.UIStatus.Visible
member.summary: The is currently showing UI because UI was requested by the app.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.UIStatus.Complete
member.summary: The is currently showing UI and all This indicates that UI is presently being shown, and that the app has finished responding to all FileUpdateRequested events.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Provider.WriteActivationMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the calling app can write to the local file and whether writing to the local file will trigger an update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.WriteActivationMode.ReadOnly
member.summary: The calling app can't write to the local file.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.WriteActivationMode.NotNeeded
member.summary: The calling app can write to the local file without triggering an update.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Provider.WriteActivationMode.AfterWrite
member.summary: The calling app can write to the local file. After the calling app writes to the local file, the providing app is activated to update its version of the file.

member.name: N:Windows.Storage.Search
member.summary: Provides classes for enumerating content in storage and performing Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) searches on the content.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Search.QueryOptions
member.summary: Specifies the parameters of a search query for enumerating the contents of storage folders.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Search.QueryOptions.ApplicationSearchFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets an application-defined Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string for filtering files by keywords or properties.
member.returns: A simple keyword, or a string that conforms to . For more information, see Using Advanced Query Syntax Programmatically.

member.name: P:Windows.Storage.Search.QueryOptions.DateStackOption
member.summary: Gets the option for grouping of content in folders retrieved by using a search query option that is based on the date, such as CommonFolderQuery.GroupByYear or CommonFolderQuery.GroupByMonth. For example, this property value is DateStackOption.Year for a QueryOptions class created with CommonFolderQuery.GroupByYear.
member.returns: The option for grouping date-based folder content.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Search.QueryOptions.SetThumbnailPrefetch(Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailMode,System.UInt32,Windows.Storage.FileProperties.ThumbnailOptions)
member.summary: Specifies a thumbnail to retrieve for each file or folder based on the purpose, requested size, and options.
member.param: The enum value that describes the purpose of the thumbnail and determines how the thumbnail image is adjusted.For guidance about choosing the best thumbnail mode, see Guidelines and checklist for thumbnails.

The requested size, in pixels, of the longest edge of the thumbnail. uses the requestedSize as a guide and tries to scale the thumbnail image without reducing the quality of the image.If can't find a thumbnail image that it can scale to meet the requested size, a larger thumbnail might be returned. If no larger thumbnail is available, a thumbnail image that is smaller than the requested size might be returned.

The enum value that describes the desired behavior to use to retrieve the thumbnail image. The specified behavior might affect the size and/or quality of the image and how quickly the thumbnail image is retrieved.

member.summary: The name of the property to use for sorting. The property must be valid for the machine.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.SortEntry.AscendingOrder

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery
member.summary: Specifies the type of the file query (shallow or deep), and how to sort the results of the query.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.DefaultQuery
member.summary: A shallow view of files in a folder, similar to the view that provides. You can use this option with any storage location.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.OrderByName
member.summary: A deep, flat list sorted by System.ItemNameDisplay. You can use this option for any storage location.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.OrderByTitle
member.summary: A deep, flat list sorted by System.Title. You can use this option only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.OrderByMusicProperties
member.summary: A deep, flat list sorted by music properties. You can use this option only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.OrderBySearchRank
member.summary: A deep, flat list sorted by System.Search.Rank followed by System.DateModified. You can use this option for any storage location.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery.OrderByDate
member.summary: A deep, flat list sorted by System.ItemDate. System.ItemDate is a dynamic property that changes based on the content type; for example, it maps to System.Photo.DateTaken for photos.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery
member.summary: Describes the criteria used to group files in the results of the query and determines whether files from subfolders are included in the results.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.DefaultQuery
member.summary: A shallow view of the folders in the queried folder, similar to the view that provides. This option is valid with any storage location.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByYear
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by year based on the System.ItemDate property of each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByMonth
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by month based on the System.ItemDate property. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByArtist
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Music.AlbumTitle property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByAlbum
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by year based on the System.ItemDate property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByAlbumArtist
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Music.AlbumArtist property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByComposer
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Music.Composer property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByGenre
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Music.Genre property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByPublishedYear
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by year based on the System.Media.Year property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByRating
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by rating (1 star, 2 stars, and so on) based on the System.Rating property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByTag
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Keywords property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByAuthor
member.summary: Generates virtual folders based on the System.Author property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery.GroupByType
member.summary: Generates virtual folders by type ( documents, text files, and so on) based on the System.ItemTypeText property for each file. You can further enumerate the contents of the virtual folders. This option is valid only for folders in a library or the HomeGroup folder.

member.name: T:Windows.Storage.Search.DateStackOption

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.DateStackOption.None
member.summary: The query options are not based on the date.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.DateStackOption.Year
member.summary: The content is grouped by year.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.DateStackOption.Month
member.summary: The content is grouped by month.

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.FolderDepth.Deep

member.name: F:Windows.Storage.Search.IndexedState.FullyIndexed

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageFolderQueryOperations.GetItemsAsync(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a list items like files, folders, or file groups, in a specified range (shallow enumeration).
member.returns: When this method completes successfully, it returns a list (type IVectorView) of items. Each item is the IStorageItem type and represents a file, folder, or file group.In this list, files are represented by StorageFile objects, and folders or file groups are represented by StorageFolder objects.
member.param: The zero-based index of the first item in the range. This parameter defaults to 0.
The maximum number of items to retrieve. Use -1 to retrieve all items.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageFolderQueryOperations.IsCommonFileQuerySupported(Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFileQuery)
member.summary: Retrieves a value that indicates whether this folder supports the specified file query.
member.returns: True if the folder supports the specified file query; otherwise false.
member.param: The file query to test.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageFolderQueryOperations.IsCommonFolderQuerySupported(Windows.Storage.Search.CommonFolderQuery)
member.summary: Retrieves a value that indicates whether this folder supports the specified folder query.
member.returns: True if the folder supports the specified folder query; otherwise false.
member.param: The folder query to test.

member.summary: Fires when an item is added to the folder that was queried.

member.param: The property value to match when searching the query results.

member.summary: Gets the folder originally used to create a StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, or StorageItemQueryResult object.

member.summary: Retrieves the query options used to create a StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, or StorageItemQueryResult object.

member.name: M:Windows.Storage.Search.IStorageQueryResultBase.GetItemCountAsync
member.summary: Retrieves the number of items that match the query that created a StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, or StorageItemQueryResult object.

member.summary: Fires when the query options are changed for a StorageFileQueryResult, StorageFolderQueryResult, or StorageItemQueryResult object.
