member.name: N:Windows.System.Threading
member.summary: Enables an application to use the thread pool to run work items.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPool
member.summary: Represents the thread pool.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPool.RunAsync(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler)
member.summary: Creates a work item.
member.returns: An IAsyncAction interface that provides access to the work item.
member.param: The method to call when a thread becomes available to run the work item.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPool.RunAsync(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority)
member.summary: Creates a work item and specifies its priority relative to other work items in the thread pool.
member.returns: An IAsyncAction interface that provides access to the work item.
member.param: The method to call when a thread becomes available to run the work item.
The priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool. The value of this parameter can be Low, Normal, or High.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPool.RunAsync(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemOptions)
member.summary: Creates a work item, specifies its priority relative to other work items in the thread pool, and specifies how long-running work items should be run.
member.returns: An IAsyncAction interface that provides access to the work item.
member.param: The method to call when a thread becomes available to run the work item.
The priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool.

If this parameter is TimeSliced, the work item runs simultaneously with other time-sliced work items with each work item receiving a share of processor time. If this parameter is None, the work item runs when a worker thread becomes available.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer
member.summary: Represents a timer created with CreateTimer or CreatePeriodicTimer.

member.name: P:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.Delay
member.summary: Gets the timeout value of a single-use timer created with CreateTimer.
member.returns: The timeout value, in milliseconds. When the timeout value elapses, the timer expires and its TimerElapsedHandler delegate is called.

member.name: P:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.Period
member.summary: Gets the timeout value of a periodic timer created with CreatePeriodicTimer.
member.returns: The timeout value, in milliseconds. When the timeout value elapses, the timer expires, its TimerElapsedHandler delegate is called, and the timer reactivates. This behavior continues until the timer is canceled. If this property is set to zero (or any non-zero value less than 1 MS) the periodic timer behaves as a single-shot timer.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels a timer.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.CreatePeriodicTimer(Windows.System.Threading.TimerElapsedHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a periodic timer.
member.returns: An instance of a periodic timer.
member.param: The method to call when the timer expires.

The number of milliseconds until the timer expires. The timer reactivates each time the period elapses, until the timer is canceled.A TimeSpan value of zero (or any non-zero value less than 1 MS) will cause the periodic timer to behave as a single-shot timer.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.CreatePeriodicTimer(Windows.System.Threading.TimerElapsedHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan,Windows.System.Threading.TimerDestroyedHandler)
member.summary: Creates a periodic timer and specifies a method to call after the periodic timer is complete. The periodic timer is complete when the timer has expired without being reactivated, and the final call to handler has finished.
member.returns: An instance of a periodic timer.
member.param: The method to call when the timer expires.

The number of milliseconds until the timer expires. The timer reactivates each time the period elapses, until the timer is canceled.A TimeSpan value of zero (or any non-zero value less than 1 MS) will cause the periodic timer to behave as a single-shot timer.
The method to call after the periodic timer is complete.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.CreateTimer(Windows.System.Threading.TimerElapsedHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a single-use timer.
member.returns: An instance of a single-use timer.
member.param: The method to call when the timer expires.
The number of milliseconds until the timer expires.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.ThreadPoolTimer.CreateTimer(Windows.System.Threading.TimerElapsedHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan,Windows.System.Threading.TimerDestroyedHandler)
member.summary: Creates a single-use timer and specifies a method to call after the timer is complete. The timer is complete when the timer has expired and the final call to handler has finished.
member.returns: An instance of a single-use timer.
member.param: The method to call when the timer expires.
The number of milliseconds until the timer expires.
The method to call after the timer is complete.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a work item relative to other work items in the thread pool.

member.name: F:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority.Low
member.summary: The work item should run at low priority.

member.name: F:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority.Normal
member.summary: The work item should run at normal priority. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority.High
member.summary: The work item should run at high priority.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemOptions
member.summary: Specifies how work items should be run.

member.name: F:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemOptions.None
member.summary: The work item should be run when the thread pool has an available worker thread.

member.name: F:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemOptions.TimeSliced
member.summary: The work items should be run simultaneously with other work items sharing a processor.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.TimerElapsedHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that is called when a timer created with CreateTimer or CreatePeriodicTimer expires.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.TimerDestroyedHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that is called when a timer created with CreateTimer or CreatePeriodicTimer is complete.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that is called when a work item runs.

member.name: N:Windows.System.Threading.Core
member.summary: Creates work items that run in response to named events and semaphores. Also preallocates resources for work items that must be guaranteed the ability to run, even in circumstances of heavy (or full) resource allocation.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier
member.summary: Runs a method when an event or semaphore is signaled. A timeout value can also be specified, causing the delegate to run after the time span has elapsed if the named event does not occur (or if the semaphore does not reach a signaled state).

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.Enable
member.summary: Submits the SignalNotifier to the thread pool.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.Terminate
member.summary: Terminates the SignalNotifier if it has not already started running.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.AttachToEvent(System.String,Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalHandler)
member.summary: Attaches a SignalHandler delegate to an event. The delegated method will run the next time the event occurs.
member.returns: The resulting SignalNotifier object.
member.param: Indicates the event that causes the method to run.
Indicates the method that will run in response to the event.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.AttachToEvent(System.String,Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Attaches a SignalHandler delegate to an event. The delegated method will run if the event occurs or the time span elapses, whichever comes first.
member.returns: The resulting SignalNotifier object.
member.param: Indicates the event that causes the method to run.
Indicates the method that will run in response to the event, or when the time span elapses, whichever comes first.
Indicates the amount of time to continue waiting for the event before running the handler method.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.AttachToSemaphore(System.String,Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalHandler)
member.summary: Attaches a SignalHandler delegate to a named semaphore. The delegated method will run when the named semaphore is signaled.
member.returns: The resulting SignalNotifier object.
member.param: Names the semaphore that signals the method to run.
Indicates the delegate that will run in response to the named semaphore entering the signaled state.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalNotifier.AttachToSemaphore(System.String,Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalHandler,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Attaches a SignalHandler delegate to a named semaphore and specifies a timeout value. The delegated method will run when the named semaphore is signaled, or if the time span elapses before the semaphore reaches a signaled state.
member.returns: The resulting SignalNotifier object.
member.param: Names the semaphore that signals the method to run.
Indicates the delegate that will run in response to the named semaphore entering the signaled state.
Indicates the amount of time to continue waiting for the named semaphore before running the delegate.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.Core.PreallocatedWorkItem
member.summary: A preallocated work item is constructed in advance of its submission to the thread pool, ensuring that the work item is constructed so that it can be submitted to the thread pool when necessary. For example, a PreallocatedWorkItem can be created in case it is needed for a resource deallocation routine, since the resource deallocation routine may be called in circumstances when not enough resources would be available to create the work item.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.PreallocatedWorkItem.RunAsync
member.summary: Submits the preallocated work item to the thread pool, without requiring any additional resources to be allocated.
member.returns: Provides access to the running IAsyncAction that was previously constructed and given the necessary resource allocation.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.PreallocatedWorkItem.#ctor(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new work item with a WorkItemHandler delegate, allocating resources for the work item in advance.
member.param: Indicates the method that the preallocated work item will run.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.PreallocatedWorkItem.#ctor(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority)
member.summary: Initializes a new work item with a WorkItemHandler delegate, allocating resources for the work item in advance, and specifies the priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool.
member.param: Indicates the method that the preallocated work item will run.
The priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool. The value of this parameter can be Low, Normal, or High.

member.name: M:Windows.System.Threading.Core.PreallocatedWorkItem.#ctor(Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemHandler,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemPriority,Windows.System.Threading.WorkItemOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new work item with a WorkItemHandler delegate, allocating resources for the work item in advance, and specifies the priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool. Also specifies how the thread pool will allocate processor time for the work item.
member.param: Indicates the method that the preallocated work item will run.
The priority of the work item relative to other work items in the thread pool. The value of this parameter can be Low, Normal, or High.

If this parameter is set to TimeSliced, the work item runs simultaneously with other time-sliced work items, with each work item receiving a share of processor time. If this parameter is set to None, the work item runs when a worker thread becomes available.

member.name: T:Windows.System.Threading.Core.SignalHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that is called when a signal notifier's attached event or semaphore is signaled, or when the optional timeout value has elapsed (whichever comes first).

member.name: N:Windows.UI
member.summary: Provides an app with access to core system functionality and run-time information about its UI.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Color
member.summary: Describes a color in terms of alpha, red, green, and blue channels.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Color.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB alpha channel value of the color.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Color.R
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB red channel value of the color.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Color.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB green channel value of the color.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Color.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB blue channel value of the color.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Color.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB alpha channel value of the color.
member.returns: The sRGB alpha channel value of the color, as a value between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Color.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB blue channel value of the color.
member.returns: The sRGB blue channel value, as a value between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.op_Equality(Windows.UI.Color,Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Compares two Color structures for equality.
member.returns: True if all values of color1 and color2 are equal; otherwise, false.
member.param: The first Color structure to compare.
The second Color structure to compare.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to a Color.
member.returns: True if o is equal to this Color; otherwise, false.
member.param: Object to check for equality.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.Equals(Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Compares two Color structures for equality.
member.returns: True if both Color structures contain the same values; otherwise, false.
member.param: The Color structure to compare to this Color.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.FromArgb(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a new Color structure by using the specified sRGB alpha channel and color channel values.
member.returns: A Color structure with the specified values.
member.param: The alpha channel, A, of the new color. The value must be between 0 and 255.
The red channel, R, of the new color. The value must be between 0 and 255.
The green channel, G, of the new color. The value must be between 0 and 255.
The blue channel, B, of the new color. The value must be between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Color.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB green channel value of the color.
member.returns: The sRGB green channel value, as a value between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.GetHashCode()
member.summary: Gets a hash code for this object.
member.returns: The hash code identifier.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.op_Inequality(Windows.UI.Color,Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Compares two Color structures for inequality.
member.returns: True if color1 and color2 have different values; false if color1 and color2 have the same values.
member.param: The first Color structure to compare.
The second Color structure to compare.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Color.R
member.summary: Gets or sets the sRGB red channel value of the color.
member.returns: The sRGB red channel value, as a value between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.ToString()
member.summary: Converts a Color to a String representation.
member.returns: A String representation of this Color.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Color.ToString(System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Creates a String representation of this Color.
member.returns: A string representation of the current Color that is determined by the specified format provider.
member.param: Culture-specific formatting information.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ColorHelper
member.summary: Provides static helper methods for processing Color values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use methods of Color instead.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ColorHelper.FromArgb(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Generates a Color structure, based on discrete Byte values for ARGB components. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Color.FromArgb instead.
member.returns: The generated Color value.
member.param: The A (transparency) component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The R component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The G component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The B component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings
member.summary: Provides classes that allow developers to define the app settings that appear in the settings pane of the Windows shell. The settings pane provides a consistent place for users to access app settings.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsCommand
member.summary: Creates a settings command object that represents a settings entry. This settings command can be appended to the ApplicationCommands vector.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsCommand.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,Windows.UI.Popups.UICommandInvokedHandler)
member.summary: Creates a new settings command.
member.param: The ID of the command.
The label for the command, which is displayed in the settings pane.
The event handler that is called when the user selects this command in the settings pane.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsCommand.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the command ID.
member.returns: The command ID.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsCommand.Invoked
member.summary: Gets or sets the handler for the event that is raised when the user selects the command.
member.returns: The event handler associated with the command.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsCommand.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the label for the command.
member.returns: The label for the command.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPane
member.summary: A static class that enables the app to control the Settings Charm pane. The app can add or remove commands, receive a notification when the user opens the pane, or open the pane programmatically.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPane.CommandsRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user opens the settings pane. Listening for this event lets the app initialize the setting commands and pause its UI until the user closes the pane.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPane.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Gets a SettingsPane object that is associated with the current app view.
member.returns: The settings pane.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPane.Show
member.summary: Displays the Settings Charm pane to the user.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPaneCommandsRequest
member.summary: Contains properties that are only available during the CommandsRequested event.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPaneCommandsRequest.ApplicationCommands
member.summary: A vector that is available during the CommandsRequested event. Append SettingsCommand objects to it to make them available to the SettingsPaneUI.
member.returns: The vector of SettingsCommand objects.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPaneCommandsRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains arguments that are available from the event object during the CommandsRequested event.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ApplicationSettings.SettingsPaneCommandsRequestedEventArgs.Request
member.summary: An instance of SettingsPaneCommandsRequest that is made available during the CommandsRequested event.
member.returns: The commands request object.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Core

member.summary: Gets the type of the accelerator key event that invoked the callback.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the accelerator key event was handled or not.

member.summary: Gets the status of the accelerator key for which the event was raised.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AcceleratorKeyEventArgs.VirtualKey
member.summary: Gets the virtual key code for the keypress in the accelerator key event.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the automation provider request event has been handled.

member.summary: Gets the status of the physical key press that raised the character-received event.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher
member.summary: Provides the Windows Runtime core event message dispatcher. Instances of this type are responsible for processing the window messages and dispatching the events to the client.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.AcceleratorKeyActivated
member.summary: Fired when an accelerator key is activated (pressed or held down).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.HasThreadAccess
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the event dispatcher provided by this instance of CoreWindow has access to the current thread or not.
member.returns: True if the event dispatcher has thread access; false it does not.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.ProcessEvents(Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption)
member.summary: Starts the dispatcher processing the input event queue for this instance of CoreWindow.
member.param: The options for processing window events.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.RunAsync(Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcherPriority,Windows.UI.Core.DispatchedHandler)
member.summary: Runs the event dispatcher and returns the results for dispatched events asynchronously.
member.returns: The object that provides handlers for the completed async event dispatch.
member.param: Specifies the priority for event dispatch.
The callback on which the dispatcher returns when the event is dispatched.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.RunIdleAsync(Windows.UI.Core.IdleDispatchedHandler)
member.summary: Runs the idle priority event dispatcher and returns the results for dispatched events asynchronously.
member.returns: Object that contains the results of the asynchronous action.
member.param: The callback on which the idle priority dispatcher returns when the event is dispatched.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.TouchHitTestingEventArgs.EvaluateProximity(Windows.Foundation.Point[])
member.summary: Returns the rank of a polygon as the probable touch target, compared to all other polygons that intersect the touch contact area, and an adjusted touch point within the polygon.
member.returns: The CoreProximityEvaluation structure that holds the rank and adjusted touch point data.
member.param: The array of x-y screen coordinates that define the shape of the element.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.TouchHitTestingEventArgs.EvaluateProximity(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary:
Returns a ranking for the rectangle as the probable touch target and an adjusted touch point within the rectangle.
The rank is determined through a comparison of targeting heuristics for all rectangles that intersect the touch contact area.
member.returns: The CoreProximityEvaluation structure that holds the rank and adjusted touch point data.
member.param: The Rect that defines the bounding box of the element.

member.returns: True if the event is handled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets the screen coordinates of the touch point reported by the touch digitizer.
member.returns: Screen position of the input pointer, in .

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.TouchHitTestingEventArgs.ProximityEvaluation
member.summary: Gets or sets the proximity evaluation score for an object relative to the touch contact area.
member.returns: Proximity evaluation of an object.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcherPriority
member.summary: Defines the priority for window event dispatches.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcherPriority.Low
member.summary: Low priority. Delegates are processed when the window's main thread is idle and there is no input pending in the queue.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcherPriority.Normal
member.summary: Normal priority. Delegates are processed in the order they are scheduled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcherPriority.High
member.summary: High priority. Delegates are invoked immediately for all synchronous requests. Asynchronous requests are queued and processed before any other request type.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption
member.summary: Specifies the set of exclusive event-processing options passed to ProcessEvents.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption.ProcessOneAndAllPending
member.summary: Dispatch all currently available events in the queue. If no events are pending, wait for the next new event.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption.ProcessOneIfPresent
member.summary: Dispatch one event if it is currently pending in the queue. If no events are pending, do not wait for a new event to be raised but instead return immediately.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption.ProcessUntilQuit
member.summary: Wait for new events and dispatch all available events. Continue this behavior until the window is closed or the application calls the Close method on the CoreWindow instance.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Core.CoreProcessEventsOption.ProcessAllIfPresent
member.summary: Dispatch all events currently pending in the queue. If no events are pending, do not wait for a new event to be raised but instead return immediately.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics
member.summary: The classes and their properties that are exposed through this namespace retrieve the raw scaling, translation, and opacity parameters used in Windows animations.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription
member.summary: Exposes a collection of individual animation effects that are performed on a specific target to make up a complete Windows opacity, scaling, or translation animation.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.#ctor(Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationEffect,Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationEffectTarget)
member.summary: Creates an AnimationDescription object with a specific animation and target.
member.param: The animation effect to apply to the target.
The target of the animation effect.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.Animations
member.summary: Gets the collection of animations that are associated with the AnimationDescription object.
member.returns: A collection of IPropertyAnimation instances, each of which represents an animation effect specified for this AnimationDescription object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.DelayLimit
member.summary: Gets the maximum cumulative delay time for the animation to be applied to the collection of objects in a target.
member.returns: The delay limit time, expressed in 100-nanosecond units.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.StaggerDelay
member.summary: Gets the amount of time between the application of the animation effect to each object in a target that contains multiple objects. The StaggerDelay, together with the StaggerDelayFactor and DelayLimit, is one of the three elements used to control the relative timing of the animation effects.
member.returns: The stagger delay time, expressed in 100-nanosecond units.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.StaggerDelayFactor
member.summary: Gets a multiplier that is applied to each occurrence of the stagger delay, increasing or decreasing the previous delay instance by that amount.
member.returns: The factor to apply to the stagger delay.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Core.AnimationMetrics.AnimationDescription.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets the z-order position of an AnimationDescription object relative to other AnimationDescription objects in the same animation effect.
member.returns: The z-order value.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer
member.summary: Provides gesture and manipulation recognition, event listeners, and settings.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.AutoProcessInertia
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether manipulations during inertia are generated automatically.
member.returns: True if manipulations are generated automatically; otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CanBeDoubleTap(Windows.UI.Input.PointerPoint)
member.summary: Identifies whether a tap can still be interpreted as the second tap of a double tap gesture.
member.returns: True if a element supports the double tap gesture and the time threshold to complete the gesture has not been crossed; otherwise false.
member.param: The last input pointer.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CompleteGesture
member.summary: Causes the gesture recognizer to finalize an interaction.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CrossSlideExact
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the exact distance from initial contact to end of the cross-slide interaction is reported.By default, a small distance threshold is subtracted from the first cross-slide delta reported by the system. This distance threshold is intended to account for slight movements of the contact when processing a tap gesture. If this flag is set, the distance threshold is not subtracted from the first delta.
member.returns: True if the distance threshold is subtracted; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CrossSlideHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the cross-slide axis is horizontal.
member.returns: True if the cross-slide axis is horizontal; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CrossSlideThresholds
member.summary: Gets or sets values that indicate the distance thresholds for a CrossSliding interaction.
member.returns: By default, every value in CrossSlideThresholds is set to 0.0.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.CrossSliding
member.summary: Occurs when a user performs a slide or swipe gesture (through a single touch contact) within a content area that supports panning along a single axis only. The gesture must occur in a direction that is perpendicular to this panning axis.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.Dragging
member.summary: Occurs when a user performs a slide or swipe gesture with a mouse or pen/stylus (single contact).

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a GestureRecognizer object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.GestureSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the gesture and manipulation settings supported by an application.
member.returns: The gesture settings supported by an application. The value of this property is a bitwise OR of members of GestureSettings enumeration.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.Holding
member.summary: Occurs when a user performs a point and hold gesture (with a single touch, mouse, or pen/stylus contact).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaExpansion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the relative change in size of an object from the start of inertia to the end of inertia (when resizing, or scaling, is complete).
member.returns: The relative change in size, in .

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaExpansionDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the rate of deceleration from the start of inertia to the end of inertia (when the resizing, or expansion, manipulation is complete).
member.returns: The rate of deceleration, in /ms2.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaRotationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the final angle of rotation of an object at the end of inertia (when the rotation manipulation is complete).
member.returns: The relative change in angle of rotation, in degrees.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaRotationDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the rate of deceleration from the start of inertia to the end of inertia (when the rotation manipulation is complete).
member.returns: The rate of deceleration, in degrees/ms2.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaTranslationDeceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the rate of deceleration from the start of inertia to the end of inertia (when the translation manipulation is complete).
member.returns: The rate of deceleration, in /ms2.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.InertiaTranslationDisplacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the relative change in the screen location of an object from the start of inertia to the end of inertia (when the translation manipulation is complete).
member.returns: The relative change in screen location, in .

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an interaction is being processed.
member.returns: True if the interaction (including inertia) is still being processed; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.IsInertial
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a manipulation is still being processed during inertia (no input points are active).
member.returns: True if the manipulation is still being processed during inertia; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.ManipulationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the input points are lifted and all subsequent motion (translation, expansion, or rotation) through inertia has ended.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.ManipulationExact
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the exact distance from initial contact to end of the interaction is reported.By default, a small distance threshold is subtracted from the first delta reported by the system. This distance threshold is intended to account for slight movements of the contact when processing a tap gesture. If this flag is set, the distance threshold is not subtracted from the first delta.
member.returns: True if the distance threshold is subtracted; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.ManipulationInertiaStarting
member.summary: Occurs when all contact points are lifted during a manipulation and the velocity of the manipulation is significant enough to initiate inertia behavior (translation, expansion, or rotation continue after the input pointers are lifted).

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.ManipulationStarted
member.summary: Occurs when one or more input points have been initiated and subsequent motion (translation, expansion, or rotation) has begun.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.ManipulationUpdated
member.summary: Occurs after one or more input points have been initiated and subsequent motion (translation, expansion, or rotation) is under way.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.GestureRecognizer.MouseWheelParameters

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.GetUsageValue(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the Human Interface Device (HID) usage value of the raw input.
member.returns: The extended usage of the raw input pointer.
member.param: The usage page of the pointer device. Usage pages specify the class of device. For example, touch digitizers (0x0D) and generic input (0x01).

Indicates a usage in a usage page.Usage specify a device or property in the usagePage. For example, for touch digitizers this includes tip switch (0x42) to indicate finger contact or tip pressure (0x30).

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.HasUsage(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input data from the pointer device contains the specified Human Interface Device (HID) usage information.
member.returns: True if the input data includes usage information; otherwise false.
member.param: The usage page of the pointer device. Usage pages specify the class of device. For example, touch digitizers (0x0D) and generic input (0x01).

Indicates a usage in a usage page.Usage specify a device or property in the usagePage. For example, for touch digitizers this includes tip switch (0x42) to indicate finger contact or tip pressure (0x30).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsBarrelButtonPressed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the barrel button of the pen/stylus device is pressed.
member.returns: True if the barrel button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input was canceled by the pointer device.
member.returns: True if the input was canceled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsEraser

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsHorizontalMouseWheel
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from a mouse tilt wheel.
member.returns: True if the input is from a mouse tilt wheel; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsInRange
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the physical entity (finger or pen) is in range of the digitizer.
member.returns: True if in range; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsInverted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the digitizer pen is inverted.
member.returns: True if inverted; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsLeftButtonPressed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from the left button of a mouse or other input method.
member.returns: True if the left button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsMiddleButtonPressed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from the middle button of a mouse or other input method.
member.returns: True if the middle button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsPrimary
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from the primary pointer when multiple pointers are registered.
member.returns: True if the input is from the pointer designated as primary; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsRightButtonPressed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the input is from the right button of a mouse or other input method.
member.returns: True if the right button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsXButton1Pressed
member.summary: Gets the pressed state of the first extended mouse button.
member.returns: True if the button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.IsXButton2Pressed
member.summary: Gets the pressed state of the second extended mouse button.
member.returns: True if the button is pressed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.MouseWheelDelta
member.summary: Gets a value (the raw value reported by the device) that indicates the change in wheel button input from the last pointer event.
member.returns: The number of notches or distance thresholds crossed since the last pointer event. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.Orientation
member.summary:
Gets the counter-clockwise angle of rotation around the major
axis of the pointer device (the z-axis, perpendicular to the surface of the digitizer).
member.returns: A value between 0.0 and 359.0 in degrees of rotation. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.PointerUpdateKind
member.summary: Gets the kind of pointer state change.
member.returns: One of the values from PointerUpdateKind.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.Pressure
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the force that the pointer device (typically a pen/stylus) exerts on the surface of the digitizer.
member.returns: A value from 0 to 1.0. The default value is 0.5.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.TouchConfidence
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pointer device rejected the touch contact.
member.returns: True if the touch contact was accepted; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.Twist
member.summary: Gets the clockwise rotation in degrees of a pen device around its own major axis (such as when the user spins the pen in their fingers).
member.returns: A value between 0.0 and 359.0 in degrees of rotation. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.XTilt
member.summary: Gets the plane angle between the Y-Z plane and the plane that contains the Y axis and the axis of the input device (typically a pen/stylus).
member.returns: The value is 0.0 when the finger or pen is perpendicular to the digitizer surface, between 0.0 and 179.0 when tilted to the right of perpendicular, and between 0.0 and -179.0 when tilted to the left of perpendicular. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.PointerPointProperties.YTilt
member.summary: Gets the plane angle between the X-Z plane and the plane that contains the X axis and the axis of the input device (typically a pen/stylus).
member.returns: The value is 0.0 when the finger or pen is perpendicular to the digitizer surface, between 0.0 and -179.0 when tilted towards the user, and between 0.0 and 179.0 when tilted away from the user. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlideThresholds
member.summary: Contains the distance thresholds for a CrossSliding interaction.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlideThresholds.SelectionStart
member.summary: The distance, in , from the initial point of contact until the selection action is initiated.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlideThresholds.RearrangeStart
member.summary: The distance, in , from the initial point of contact until the rearrange action is initiated.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlideThresholds.SpeedBumpEnd
member.summary: The distance, in , from the initial point of contact until the end of the speed bump.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlideThresholds.SpeedBumpStart
member.summary: The distance, in , from the initial point of contact until the speed bump is initiated.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationDelta
member.summary: Contains the accumulated transformations for the current manipulation.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationDelta.Translation
member.summary: The change in x-y screen coordinates, in .

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationDelta.Scale
member.summary: The change in distance between touch contacts, as a percentage. For example, if the distance between two contacts changes from 100 to 200 during a manipulation, the value of Scale would be 1.0.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationDelta.Expansion
member.summary: The change in distance between touch contacts, as . For example, if the distance between two contacts changes from 100 to 200 during a manipulation, the value of Expansion would be 100.0.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationDelta.Rotation
member.summary: The change in angle of rotation, in degrees.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationVelocities
member.summary: Contains the velocities of the accumulated transformations for the current interaction.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationVelocities.Linear
member.summary: The straight line velocity in per millisecond.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationVelocities.Angular
member.summary: The rotational velocity in degrees per millisecond.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.ManipulationVelocities.Expansion
member.summary: The expansion, or scaling, velocity in per millisecond.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState
member.summary: Specifies the possible states of the CrossSliding event.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.Started
member.summary: A CrossSliding interaction has been detected.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.Dragging
member.summary: A CrossSliding interaction has started but the swipe or slide gesture has not crossed the minimum distance threshold for a selection action. (See the Remarks section for a diagram showing the CrossSliding distance thresholds.)There is no correlation between Dragging in CrossSlidingState (touch) and DraggingState (mouse or pen/stylus).

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.Selecting
member.summary: The swipe or slide gesture has crossed the minimum distance threshold for a selection action but has not crossed the minimum distance threshold of the rearrange action. This state is valid only when SpeedBumpStart is disabled in a GestureRecognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.SelectSpeedBumping
member.summary: The swipe or slide gesture has crossed the minimum distance threshold for a selection action (and the selection speed bump) but has not crossed the maximum distance threshold of the selection speed bump. This state is valid only when both SpeedBumpStart and SelectionStart are enabled in a GestureRecognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.SpeedBumping
member.summary: The swipe or slide gesture has crossed the minimum distance threshold for a selection action (and the selection speed bump) but has not crossed the maximum distance threshold of the selection speed bump. This state is valid only when SpeedBumpStart is enabled and SelectionStart is disabled in a GestureRecognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.Rearranging
member.summary: The swipe or slide gesture has crossed the minimum distance threshold of the rearrange action. This state is valid only when RearrangeStart is enabled in a GestureRecognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.CrossSlidingState.Completed
member.summary: The swipe or slide gesture has stopped, the CrossSliding interaction has been completed, and the touch contact lifted.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.DraggingState
member.summary: Specifies the possible states of the Dragging event.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.DraggingState.Started
member.summary: A dragging interaction has been detected.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.DraggingState.Continuing
member.summary: The dragging interaction is in progress.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.DraggingState.Completed
member.summary: The mouse or pen/stylus contact is lifted and inertia has concluded.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.EdgeGestureKind
member.summary: Specifies the type of user input that triggered the edge gesture event.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.EdgeGestureKind.Touch
member.summary: The user made a swipe gesture on a touch-enabled screen.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.EdgeGestureKind.Keyboard
member.summary: The user entered the Win+Z key sequence on the keyboard.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.EdgeGestureKind.Mouse
member.summary: The user performed a right mouse click.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings
member.summary: Specifies the interactions that are supported by an application.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.None
member.summary: Disable support for gestures and manipulations.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.Tap
member.summary: Enable support for the tap gesture.Touch: tapMouse: left button clickPen/stylus: tap

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.DoubleTap
member.summary: Enable support for the double-tap gesture.Touch: double tapMouse: left button double clickPen/stylus: double tapThis gesture can be used to select a word or open a file or folder.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.Hold
member.summary: Enable support for the press and hold gesture (from a single touch or pen/stylus contact). The Holding event is raised if a time threshold is crossed before the contact is lifted, an additional contact is detected, or a gesture is started.Touch: press and holdPen/stylus: press and holdThis gesture can be used to display a context menu.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.HoldWithMouse
member.summary: Enable support for the press and hold gesture through the left button on a mouse. The Holding event is raised if a time threshold is crossed before the left button is released or a gesture is started.This gesture can be used to display a context menu.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.RightTap
member.summary: Enable support for a right-tap interaction. The RightTapped event is raised when the contact is lifted or the mouse button released.Touch: press and hold Mouse: press and hold, right button clickPen/stylus: press and hold, tap with barrel button pressedThis gesture can be used to display a context menu.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.Drag
member.summary: Enable support for the slide or swipe gesture with a mouse or pen/stylus (single contact). The Dragging event is raised when either gesture is detected.This gesture can be used for text selection, selecting or rearranging objects, or scrolling and panning.Mouse and pen/stylus input does not raise manipulation events (ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted) during the course of this interaction.Specifying support for Drag and one or more of the manipulation settings enables a single device to perform multiple actions. For example, the slide or swipe gesture can be performed with the left mouse button to select text while the wheel button can be rolled to scroll content.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationTranslateX
member.summary: Enable support for the slide gesture through pointer input, on the horizontal axis. The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.This gesture can be used for rearranging objects.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationTranslateY
member.summary: Enable support for the slide gesture through pointer input, on the vertical axis. The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.This gesture can be used for rearranging objects.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationTranslateRailsX
member.summary: Enable support for the slide gesture through pointer input, on the horizontal axis using rails (guides). The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.This gesture can be used for rearranging objects.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationTranslateRailsY
member.summary: Enable support for the slide gesture through pointer input, on the vertical axis using rails (guides). The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.This gesture can be used for rearranging objects.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationRotate
member.summary: Enable support for the rotation gesture through pointer input. The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationScale
member.summary: Enable support for the pinch or stretch gesture through pointer input. These gestures can be used for optical or semantic zoom and resizing an object. The ManipulationStarted, ManipulationUpdated, and ManipulationCompleted events are all raised during the course of this interaction.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationTranslateInertia
member.summary: Enable support for translation inertia after the slide gesture (through pointer input) is complete. The ManipulationInertiaStarting event is raised if inertia is enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationRotateInertia
member.summary: Enable support for rotation inertia after the rotate gesture (through pointer input) is complete. The ManipulationInertiaStarting event is raised if inertia is enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.ManipulationScaleInertia
member.summary: Enable support for scaling inertia after the pinch or stretch gesture (through pointer input) is complete. The ManipulationInertiaStarting event is raised if inertia is enabled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.GestureSettings.CrossSlide
member.summary: Enable support for the CrossSliding interaction when using the slide or swipe gesture through a single touch contact.This gesture can be used for selecting or rearranging objects.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.HoldingState
member.summary: Specifies the state of the Holding event.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.HoldingState.Started
member.summary: A single contact has been detected and a time threshold is crossed without the contact being lifted, another contact detected, or another gesture started.The press and hold time threshold can be set in the Hardware and Sound control panel.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.HoldingState.Completed
member.summary: The single contact is lifted.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.HoldingState.Canceled
member.summary: An additional contact is detected, a subsequent gesture (such as a slide) is detected, or the CompleteGesture method is called.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Input.Inking
member.summary: Provides support for the Windows 8 ink system.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes
member.summary: Provides properties associated with the drawing of an InkStroke.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the color of an InkStroke.
member.returns: The ink color. Default value is black.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.FitToCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether Bezier curves or straight line segments are used to draw an InkStroke.
member.returns: True if Bezier curves are used; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new InkDrawingAttributes object that is used to specify InkStroke attributes.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.IgnorePressure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the pressure of the pen tip on the digitizer surface is ignored when you draw an InkStroke.
member.returns: True if pressure is ignored; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.PenTip
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the shape of the pen tip when you draw an InkStroke.
member.returns: The shape of the pen/stylus tip.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkDrawingAttributes.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the dimensions of the pen tip when you draw an InkStroke.
member.returns: The width and height of the pen tip. The default value for each is 2.0. The value of width is applied to all strokes. PenTip is specified as a rectangle or a circle. The value of height is applied to all strokes, where PenTip is specified as a rectangle.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager
member.summary: Provides properties and methods to manage the input, manipulation, and processing (including handwriting recognition) of one or more InkStroke objects.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.AddStroke(Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkStroke)
member.summary: Adds one or more InkStroke objects to the collection managed by the InkManager.
member.param: The ink stroke to be added.stroke must be created by using the Clone method, or through a call to EndStroke or ProcessPointerUp. Empty or existing strokes are not valid.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.BoundingRect
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle of the InkStroke collection that is managed by the InkManager.
member.returns: The bounding rectangle of the InkStroke collection.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.CanPasteFromClipboard
member.summary: Identifies whether content on the clipboard can be added to the InkStroke collection that is managed by the InkManager.
member.returns: True if content can be pasted from the clipboard; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.CopySelectedToClipboard
member.summary: Copies the selected InkStroke objects (from the InkStroke collection managed by the InkManager) to the clipboard in Ink Serialized Format (ISF) format.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.DeleteSelected
member.summary: Deletes the selected InkStroke objects from the InkStroke collection managed by the InkManager.
member.returns: The bounding rectangle of the selected ink strokes, or the invalidated rectangle (0, 0, 0, 0) if no strokes were removed (no selected strokes).

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.GetRecognitionResults
member.summary: Gets a collection of potential matches for each word detected by an InkRecognizer during handwriting recognition.
member.returns: The recognition results.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.GetRecognizers
member.summary: Gets the collection of handwriting recognizers.
member.returns: The handwriting recognizers.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.GetStrokes
member.summary: Retrieves all InkStroke objects in the collection managed by the InkManager.
member.returns: The ink strokes.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new InkManager object that is used to manage InkStroke objects.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.LoadAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads all InkStroke objects from the specified stream to the InkStroke collection that is managed by the InkManager.
member.returns: The status of the asynchronous operation as the number of bytes fetched. For more information, see ReadAsync method.
member.param: The stream that contains the stroke collection. An IRandomAccessStream (requires IOutputStream) object can be specified instead.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the ink input mode.
member.returns: The mode.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.MoveSelected(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Moves the selected strokes. All affected strokes are re-rendered.
member.returns: The bounding rectangle of the selected ink strokes.
member.param: The destination screen coordinates for the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the selected strokes.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.PasteFromClipboard(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Adds the InkStroke content from the clipboard to the InkStroke collection that is managed by the InkManager and renders the new strokes..
member.returns: The invalidated bounding rectangle of the InkStroke collection.
member.param: The screen coordinates for the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the clipboard content.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.ProcessPointerDown(Windows.UI.Input.PointerPoint)
member.summary: Processes information about the position and features of the contact point, like pressure and tilt, on initial down contact.
member.param: Information about the position and features of the contact point.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.ProcessPointerUp(Windows.UI.Input.PointerPoint)
member.summary: Processes information about the position and features of the contact point, like pressure and tilt, on up contact.
member.returns: For Inking and Selecting modes, this is the bounding box for the stroke (invalidated rectangle). For Erasing mode, the invalidated rectangle is (0,0,0,0).
member.param: Information about the position and features of the contact point.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.ProcessPointerUpdate(Windows.UI.Input.PointerPoint)
member.summary: Processes position and state properties, such as pressure and tilt, for the specified pointer, from the last pointer event up to and including the current pointer event.
member.returns: When the current InkManipulationMode is Inking or Selecting, this method returns the Point (screen position in ink space) associated with the last ProcessPointerUpdate of pointerPoint.
member.param: The input pointer for which updates are to be processed.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.RecognizeAsync(Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget)
member.summary: Performs handwriting recognition on one or more InkStroke objects.
member.returns: The results of the recognition as a collection of InkRecognitionResult objects. Each item in the collection represents a written word. For example, the string "this is a test" contains four words that will be stored as a collection of four items.
member.param: One of the values from the InkRecognitionTarget enumeration.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.RecognizeAsync(Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkStrokeContainer,Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget)
member.summary: Performs handwriting recognition on one or more InkStroke objects.
member.returns: The results of the recognition as a collection of InkRecognitionResult objects.Each item in the collection represents a written word. For example, the string "this is a test" contains four words that will be stored as a collection of four items.
member.param: The set of strokes on which recognition is performed.
One of the values from the InkRecognitionTarget enumeration.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManager.SaveAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream)
member.summary: Asynchronously saves all InkStroke objects in the InkStroke collection that is managed by the InkManager to the specified stream.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManipulationMode
member.summary: Identifies the ink input mode.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManipulationMode.Inking
member.summary: All points are passed to the InkStrokeBuilder and an InkStroke is created. The stroke is appended to the stroke collection of the InkManager or InkStrokeContainer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManipulationMode.Erasing
member.summary: All strokes are hit tested against all strokes in the stroke collection. If there is an intersection, InkManager deletes the stroke automatically and returns an invalidated rectangle for processPointerUpdate calls.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkManipulationMode.Selecting
member.summary: All points are used to create a polyline. When you call processPointerUp, the polyline is hit tested against entire stroke collection and all strokes within the polyline are marked as selected.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget
member.summary: Indicates which strokes you want passed to the recognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget.All
member.summary: All strokes in the stroke collection are passed to the recognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget.Selected
member.summary: Selected (Selected) strokes are passed to the recognizer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.InkRecognitionTarget.Recent
member.summary: All strokes added after the last recognition pass (Recognized is false) are passed to the recognizer.This is useful in incremental recognition scenarios, such as direct tracking of ink input (no indirect controls are used to start recognition).

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.PenTipShape
member.summary: Identifies the shape of the pen tip.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.PenTipShape.Circle
member.summary: Circular pen tip. Only the width determines the size.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Input.Inking.PenTipShape.Rectangle
member.summary: Rectangular pen tip. Both the width and height determine the size.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Notifications
member.summary: Contains classes that encapsulate tile, toast, and badge notifications.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeNotification
member.summary: Defines the content, associated metadata, and expiration time of an update to a tile's badge overlay. A badge can display a number from 1 to 99 or a status glyph.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeNotification.#ctor(Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the BadgeNotification.
member.param: The XML content that defines the badge update.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeNotification.Content
member.summary: Gets the XML that defines the value or glyph used as the tile's badge.
member.returns: The object that contains the XML.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeNotification.ExpirationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that Windows will remove the badge from the tile.
member.returns: The date and time that the notification should be removed.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeTemplateType
member.summary: Specifies the template to use for a tile's badge overlay. Used by BadgeUpdateManager.getTemplateContent.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeTemplateType.BadgeGlyph
member.summary: A system-provided glyph image. For more information, see The badge image catalog.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeTemplateType.BadgeNumber
member.summary: A numerical value from 1 to 99. Values greater than 99 are accepted, but in those cases "99" is still displayed. In scenarios where your numbers are expected to be greater than 99, you should consider using a glyph instead.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdateManager
member.summary: Creates BadgeUpdater objects that you use to manipulate a tile's badge overlay. This class also provides access to the XML content of the system-provided badge templates so that you can customize that content for use in updating your badges.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdateManager.CreateBadgeUpdaterForApplication
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the BadgeUpdater, which lets you change the appearance or content of the badge on the calling app's tile.
member.returns: The object you will use to send changes to the app tile's badge.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdateManager.CreateBadgeUpdaterForApplication(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the BadgeUpdater for a specified app tile's badge, usually the tile of another app in the package. The BadgeUpdater lets you change the appearance or content of that badge.
member.returns: The object you will use to send changes to the application tile's badge.
member.param: The unique ID of the tile whose badge you want to update.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdateManager.CreateBadgeUpdaterForSecondaryTile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the BadgeUpdater, which enables you to change the appearance or content of a badge on a secondary tile. The tile can belong to the calling app or any other app in the same package.
member.returns: The object you will use to send badge updates to the tile identified by tileID.
member.param: The unique ID of the tile.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdateManager.GetTemplateContent(Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeTemplateType)
member.summary: Gets the XML content of one of the predefined badge templates so that you can customize it for a badge update.
member.returns: The object that contains the template .
member.param: The type of badge template, either a glyph or a number.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater
member.summary: Updates a badge overlay on the specific tile that the updater is bound to.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater.Clear
member.summary: Removes the badge from the tile that the updater is bound to.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater.StartPeriodicUpdate(Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.Foundation.DateTime,Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence)
member.summary: Begins a series of timed updates for the badge from a web resource that the updater is bound to. Updates begin at a specified time.
member.param: The from which the content of the badge update will be retrieved.
The time at which the should first be polled for new badge content.
The frequency with which the is polled for new badge content, following the initial update at startTime.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater.StartPeriodicUpdate(Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence)
member.summary: Begins a series of timed updates for the badge from a web resource that the updater is bound to, beginning immediately.
member.param: The from which the content of the badge update will be retrieved.
The frequency with which the is polled for new badge content.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater.StopPeriodicUpdate
member.summary: Cancels the current series of timed updates for the badge that the updater is bound to.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeUpdater.Update(Windows.UI.Notifications.BadgeNotification)
member.summary: Applies a change to the badge's glyph or number.
member.param: The object that supplies the new XML definition for the badge.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting
member.summary: Specifies the limitations on tile or toast notification display.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting.Enabled
member.summary: All notifications raised by this app can be displayed.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting.DisabledForApplication
member.summary: The user has disabled notifications for this app.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting.DisabledForUser
member.summary: The user or administrator has disabled all notifications for this user on this computer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting.DisabledByGroupPolicy
member.summary: An administrator has disabled all notifications on this computer through group policy. The group policy setting overrides the user's setting.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.NotificationSetting.DisabledByManifest
member.summary: This app has not declared itself toast capable in its package.appxmanifest file. This setting is found on the manifest's Application UI page, under the Notification section. For an app to send toast, the Toast Capable option must be set to "Yes".

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence
member.summary: Specifies the time period for subsequent polls of the tile or badge data source for new content.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence.HalfHour
member.summary: Poll every half an hour.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence.Hour
member.summary: Poll every hour.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence.SixHours
member.summary: Poll every 6 hours.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence.TwelveHours
member.summary: Poll every 12 hours.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence.Daily
member.summary: Poll once a day.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification
member.summary: Defines the visual content and timing for a single, non-recurring scheduled update to a tile.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification.Content
member.summary: Gets the XML description of the content of the scheduled tile update.
member.returns: The object that contains the notification content.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification.DeliveryTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the tile is scheduled to be updated.
member.returns: The date and time that the notification will be updated.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification.ExpirationTime

member.summary: Gets or sets the unique ID that is used to identify the scheduled tile in the schedule.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that Windows can use to prevent duplicate notification content from appearing in the queue.
member.returns: A string of 16 characters or less (plus a terminating null character) that identifies the notification in the stack. While there is no set form for the string content, we recommend that it should relate to the content of the notification.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileTemplateType.TileSquareImage

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileTemplateType.TileWideBlockAndText02

member.summary: Top: One large square image with four smaller square images to its right, no text. Bottom: One string of large text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.summary: Top: One large square image with four smaller square images to its right, no text. Bottom: One string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of five lines.

member.summary: Top: One wide image. Bottom: On the left, one small image; on the right, one string of large text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.summary: On the left, one small image; on the right, one string of large text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileTemplateType.TileWideSmallImageAndText02

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileTemplateType.TileWideText09
member.summary: One header string in larger text over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines.

member.summary: One header string in larger text over eight short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of four lines each. member.name: F:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileTemplateType.TileWideText11
member.summary: Ten short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of five lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText08, but the first column is narrower.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager
member.summary: Creates TileUpdater objects used to change and update Start menu tiles. This class also provides access to the XML content of the system-provided tile templates so that you can customize that content for use in updating your tiles.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager.CreateTileUpdaterForApplication
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the TileUpdater, which lets you change the appearance of the calling app's tile.
member.returns: The object you will use to send changes to the app's tile.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager.CreateTileUpdaterForApplication(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new instance of the TileUpdater for a tile that belongs to another app in the same package as the calling app. The TileUpdater lets a developer change the appearance of that tile.
member.returns: The object you will use to send changes to the tile identified by applicationId.
member.param: The unique ID of the tile.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager.CreateTileUpdaterForSecondaryTile(System.String)

member.returns: The object you will use to send updates to the tile identified by tileID.
member.param: The unique ID of the tile.

member.param: The name of the template.

member.summary: Begins a series of timed updates for the tile that the updater is bound to. Update content is retrieved from a specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). Updates begin at a specified time.
member.param: The from which the content of the tile update will be retrieved.
The time at which the should first be polled for new tile content.
The frequency with which the is polled for new tile content, following the initial update at startTime.

member.summary: Begins a series of timed content changes for the tile that the updater is bound to, beginning immediately.
member.param: The from which the content of the tile update will be retrieved.
The frequency with which the is polled for new tile content, following the initial update at startTime.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdater.StartPeriodicUpdateBatch(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IIterable`1,Windows.UI.Notifications.PeriodicUpdateRecurrence)
member.summary: Begins a series of timed updates that cycle on the tile that the updater is bound to. Update content is retrieved from an array of specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), the first update happening immediately and subsequent updates occurring at the periodic interval thereafter.
member.param: An array of up to five from which the content of the cycling tile updates will be retrieved. If the array contains more than five , the method will fail.
The frequency with which the is polled for new tile content, following the initial update at startTime.

member.summary: Begins a series of timed updates that cycle on the tile that the updater is bound to. Update content is retrieved from an array of specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) with updates beginning at a specified time and subsequent updates occurring at the periodic interval thereafter.
member.param: An array of up to five from which the content of the cycling tile updates will be retrieved. If the array contains more than five , the method will fail.
The time at which the initial should first be polled for new content.
The frequency with which the is polled for new tile content, following the initial update at startTime.
