member.summary: Creates a new instance of the PopupMenu class.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Popups.PopupMenu.ShowAsync(Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Shows the context menu at the specified client coordinates.
member.returns: A IUICommand object that represents the command that was invoked by the user, after the ShowAsync call completes.If no command is invoked, ShowAsync returns null.
member.param: The coordinates (in DIPs), relative to the window, of the user's finger or mouse pointer when the oncontextmenu event fired. The menu is placed above and centered on this point. For VB, C#, and C++, this window is the CoreWindow associated with the thread that is calling the .

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Popups.PopupMenu.ShowForSelectionAsync(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Shows the context menu above the specified selection.
member.returns: A IUICommand object that represents the command invoked by the user, after the ShowForSelectionAsync call completes.If no command is invoked, ShowForSelectionAsync returns null.
member.param: The coordinates (in DIPs) of the selected rectangle, relative to the window. The is placed directly above and centered on this rectangle such that selection is not covered.For VB, C#, and C++, this window is the CoreWindow associated with the thread that is calling the .

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Popups.PopupMenu.ShowForSelectionAsync(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Windows.UI.Popups.Placement)
member.summary: Shows the context menu in the preferred placement relative to the specified selection.
member.returns: A IUICommand object that represents the command invoked by the user, after the ShowForSelectionAsync call completes.If no command is invoked, ShowForSelectionAsync returns null.
member.param: The coordinates (in DIPs) of the selected rectangle, relative to the window. For VB, C#, and C++, this window is the CoreWindow associated with the thread that is calling the .

The preferred placement of the relative to the selection rectangle.The is positioned in the preferredPlacement if the menu fits in the window and does not cover the selection. If the does not fit in the preferred placement, another placement that does not cover the selection is used. If the does not fit anywhere else, a placement that partially or wholly covers the selection is used.

member.summary: Collapses the text range into a degenerate point at either the beginning or end of the range.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.Delete(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes text from the text range.
member.returns: The number of units deleted. Deleting the text in a nondegenerate text range counts as one unit.
member.param: The unit of text to delete.
The number of units to delete. See Remarks.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.EndOf(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or extends the text range to the end of the nearest specified text unit. The text range is moved or extended forward in the document.
member.returns: The number of character positions that the range was moved or extended, plus 1 if the text range collapsed to the start of the range. If the text range includes the final carriage return (CR) at the end of the story, and extend is false, the return value is set to –1 to indicate that the collapse occurred before the end of the range. This is because an insertion point cannot exist beyond the final CR.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range.

True extends the text range by moving just the end position of the range to the end of the specified unit. False moves both ends of the text range to the end of the specified unit. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.EndPosition

member.summary: Sets the start and end positions of this range to match the active selection.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.Move(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point forward or backward by the specified number of units. If the text range is nondegenerate, it is collapsed to an insertion point at the start or end position of the text range, depending on count, and then is moved.
member.returns: The actual number of units the insertion point moves. For more information, see the Remarks section.
member.param: The units to move the insertion point. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the insertion point. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the insertion point moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the insertion point moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the range is unchanged.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.MoveEnd(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the end position of the text range.
member.returns: The actual number of units that the end position of the text range moved.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the end position of the text range. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the end position moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the end position move backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the end position does not move.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.MoveStart(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the start position of a text range.
member.returns: The actual number of units that the start position moved. The pointer can be NULL.
member.param: The unit by which to move the start position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the start position of the text range. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the start position of the text range moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the start position of the text range moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the start position doesn't move.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph formatting attributes of the text range.
member.returns: The paragraph formatting attributes.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.Paste(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pastes text from the Clipboard into the text range.
member.param: The clipboard format to use in the paste operation. Zero represents the best format, which usually is , but CF_UNICODETEXT and other formats are also possible. The default value is zero.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.ScrollIntoView(Windows.UI.Text.PointOptions)
member.summary: Scrolls this text range into view.
member.param: The end of the text range to scroll into view. This function uses only the Start, NoHorizontalScroll, and NoVerticalScroll values of the PointOptions enumeration.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetIndex(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the text range to the specified unit of the story.
member.param: The unit used to move the text range.

The index of the specified unit. The text range is relocated to the unit that has this index. If unit is positive, the numbering of units begins at the start of the story and proceeds forward. If negative, the numbering begins at the end of the story and proceeds backward. The start of the story corresponds to index = 1 for all existing units, and the last unit in the story corresponds to index = 1.

Indicates how to change the text range. True extends the text range to include the unit by moving only the end position of the text range. False collapses the text range to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetPoint(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.UI.Text.PointOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the text range based on the specified point.
member.param: An ordered pair of floating-point x- and y-coordinates that defines a point in a two-dimensional plane.
The alignment type of the specified point.

Indicates how to set the endpoints of the text range. If extend is 0, the text range is an insertion point located at the specified point, or at the nearest point with selectable text. If extend is 1, the endpoint specified by options is moved to the point and the other endpoint is left alone. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the endpoints of the text range to the specified values.
member.param: The character position for the start of the text range. This parameter must be less than endPosition.
The character position for the end of the text range.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetText(Windows.UI.Text.TextSetOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the text in the text range.
member.param: The conversion flags that control how the text is inserted in the text range.
The new text.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetTextViaStream(Windows.UI.Text.TextSetOptions,Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream)
member.summary: Sets the text in the text range based on the contents of a random access stream.
member.param: The text options.
The random access stream.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.StartOf(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or extends the text range to the start of the nearest specified text unit. The text range is moved or extended backward in the document.
member.returns: The number of characters the insertion point or start position is moved. Note that this value is always less than or equal to zero, since the motion is always toward the beginning of the story.
member.param: The unit by which to move the start position of the text range. The default value is Word.

True extends the text range by moving just the start position of the range to the start of the specified unit. False moves both ends of the text range to the start of the specified unit. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.StartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the start position of the text range.
member.returns: The character position to set as the start position of the text range.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.StoryLength
member.summary: Gets the count of characters in the story of the text range.
member.returns: The count of characters in the story.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextRange.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the plain text of the text range.
member.returns: The plain text.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection
member.summary: Represents the currently selected text of a document.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.EndKey(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection to the end of the specified unit, mimicking the functionality of the End key.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or the active end is moved.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.HomeKey(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection to the home position, mimicking the functionality of the Home key.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or the active end is moved.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveDown(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection down, mimicking the functionality of the Down Arrow or Page Down key.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved down. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaningLineDown ArrowMoves down one line. This is the default.ParagraphCtrl+Down ArrowMoves down one paragraph.ScreenPage DownMoves down one screen.WindowCtrl+Page DownMoves to the last character in the window.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveLeft(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection to the left, mimicking the functionality of the Left Arrow key.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid. ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaningCharacterLeft ArrowMove one character position to the left. This is the default.WordCtrl+Left ArrowMove one word to the left.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1. If count is less than zero, movement is to the right.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveRight(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection to the right, mimicking the functionality of the Right Arrow key.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid. ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaningCharacterRight ArrowMove one character position to the right. This is the default.WordCtrl+Right ArrowMove one word to the right.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1. If count is less than zero, movement is to the left.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveUp(Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection up, mimicking the functionality of the Up Arrow or Page Up keys.
member.returns: The number of units the insertion point or active end is moved down. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.
member.param: The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaningLineUp ArrowMoves up one line. This is the default.ParagraphCtrl+Up ArrowMoves up one paragraph.ScreenPage UpMoves up one screen.WindowCtrl+Page UpMoves to the first character in the window.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Text.ITextSelection.Options
member.summary: Gets and sets text selection options.
member.returns: The text selection options. Each option is binary, so if a particular option is not set, the text selection has the opposite option. For example, if the Overtype option is not set, the text selection is set to insert mode.

member.returns: The selection type.

member.param: The text string to type into this selection.

member.summary: The start position of the selection is the active end; that is, the end that is changed by pressing Shift+Right Arrow and Shift+Left Arrow.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.SelectionOptions.AtEndOfLine
member.summary: For a degenerate selection (insertion point), the character position at the beginning of a line is the same as the character position at the end of the preceding line. As such, the character position is ambiguous. If this flag is 1, display the caret at the end of the preceding line; otherwise, display it at the beginning of the line.

member.summary: Allow retrieving the final end-of-paragraph (EOP) if it’s included in the range. This EOP exists in all rich-text controls and cannot be deleted. It does not exist in plain-text controls.

member.summary: Don't include hidden text.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.IncludeNumbering
member.summary: Include list numbers.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.FormatRtf
member.summary: Retrieve instead of plain text. is a BYTE (8-bit) format, but because ITextRange.GetText returns a string, the is returned as WCHARs (16-bit or UTF-16), not bytes, when you call ITextRange.GetText with the FormatRtf value. When you call ITextRange.SetText with FormatRtf, the method accepts an string containing either bytes or WCHARs, but other readers only understand bytes.

member.summary: A span of alphanumeric characters, an end of paragraph, or punctuation that includes any blanks that follow.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Sentence
member.summary: A string of text that meets the following criteria:Ends with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark.Is followed by one or more white space characters (9 through 0xd and 0x20), or the paragraph separator (0x2029). The trailing white space is part of the sentence.The last sentence in a story does not need to have a period, question mark, or exclamation mark.Other sentences must follow a sentence end and cannot begin with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark. The start of a story qualifies as the start of a Sentence, even if the string there doesn't qualify as a sentence grammatically.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Paragraph
member.summary: A string of text terminated by an end-of-paragraph mark, such as , carriage return (CR), vertical tab(VT), line feed (LF), form feed (FF), or the paragraph separator (0x2029).

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Line
member.summary: A single line of text on a display, provided that the display is associated with the range. If no display is associated with a range, Line is treated as Paragraph. A selection automatically has a display.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Story
member.summary: A story, which is a contiguous range of text in a document. For example, a story can contain one of the various parts of a document, such as the main text of a document, headers and footers, footnotes, or annotations. In a rich edit control, there is only one story per document, although a client can use multiple documents to represent multiple stories.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Screen
member.summary: The contents of a screen. Typically, a screen is the amount of content associated with the Page Up or Page Down key.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Section
member.summary: A section.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Window
member.summary: The characters between the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.CharacterFormat
member.summary: A text run of characters that all have identical character formatting properties.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: A text run of characters that all have identical paragraph formatting properties.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Object
member.summary: An embedded object.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.HardParagraph
member.summary: A paragraph that is ended by a carriage return (CR) or .

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Cluster
member.summary: A complex-script cluster (occurs, for example, in Indic scripts).

member.name: N:Windows.UI.ViewManagement
member.summary: Provides classes and enumerations used for managing the settings for an app's view.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.AccessibilitySettings
member.summary: Provides access to the high contrast accessibility settings.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.AccessibilitySettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new AccessibilitySettings object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.AccessibilitySettings.HighContrast
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the system high contrast feature is on or off.
member.returns: True if the high contrast feature is on; otherwise false.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.AccessibilitySettings.HighContrastChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the system high contrast feature turns on or off.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.AccessibilitySettings.HighContrastScheme
member.summary: Gets the name of the default high contrast color scheme.
member.returns: The name of the default high contrast color scheme.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationView
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods that allows an app to obtain its current view state, and to register for view state change events.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationView.TryUnsnap
member.summary: Attempts to unsnap a previously snapped app.
member.returns: true if the app has been successfully unsnapped; false if the unsnap attempt failed.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationView.Value
member.summary: Gets the state of the current app view.
member.returns: The current state of the running app's view. This state indicates the orientation (landscape or portrait) and whether or not the app is snapped.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationViewState
member.summary: Specifies the set of app view state changes that can be handled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationViewState.FullScreenLandscape
member.summary: The current app's view is in full-screen (has no snapped app adjacent to it), and has changed to landscape orientation.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationViewState.Filled
member.summary: The current app's view has been reduced to a partial screen view as the result of another app snapping.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationViewState.Snapped
member.summary: The current app's view has been snapped.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.ApplicationViewState.FullScreenPortrait
member.summary: The current app's view is in full-screen (has no snapped app adjacent to it), and has changed to portrait orientation.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.HandPreference
member.summary: Defines the set of directional preferences for the user interface presented by the app view.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.HandPreference.LeftHanded
member.summary: The preferred layout is for left-directional users.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.HandPreference.RightHanded
member.summary: The preferred layout is for right-directional users.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPane
member.summary: Enables an application to register to receive notifications when the input pane is about to be displayed or hidden, and to determine which portion of the application's window is being obscured by the input pane.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPane.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Gets the InputPane object associated with the application window that is currently visible.
member.returns: The input pane.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPane.Hiding
member.summary: Occurs when the input pane is about to be hidden by sliding out of view.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPane.OccludedRect
member.summary: Gets the region of the application’s window that the input pane is covering.
member.returns: The window region that the input pane is covering, in client coordinates specified in device independent pixels (DIPs).

member.name: E:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPane.Showing
member.summary: Occurs when the input pane is about to be displayed by sliding into view.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPaneVisibilityEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the input pane Hiding and Showing events.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPaneVisibilityEventArgs.EnsuredFocusedElementInView
member.summary: Identifies whether the application has taken steps to ensure that the input pane doesn't cover the UI element that has focus.
member.returns: True if the application has ensured that the input pane isn't covering the element that has focus; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.ViewManagement.InputPaneVisibilityEventArgs.OccludedRect
member.summary: Gets the region of the application's window that the input pane is covering.
member.returns: The window region that the input pane is covering, in client coordinates specified in device independent pixels (DIPs).

member.summary: Represents an instance of a background task that has been triggered to run.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstance.Current
member.summary: Gets the current background task.
member.returns: The current background task. This property can only be accessed in the context of a background task. This property is null in an app.

member.summary: Provides access to an instance of a background task.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstanceRuntimeClass.Canceled
member.summary: Attaches a cancellation event handler to the background task instance.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstanceRuntimeClass.GetDeferral
member.summary: Informs the system that the background task might continue to perform work after the IBackgroundTask.Run method returns.
member.returns: A background task deferral.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstanceRuntimeClass.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the instance ID of the background task instance.
member.returns: A unique identifier for the background task instance. This identifier is generated by the system when the instance is created.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstanceRuntimeClass.Progress
member.summary: Gets or sets progress status for a background task instance.
member.returns: A value defined by the application to indicate the task's progress.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.WebUI.WebUIBackgroundTaskInstanceRuntimeClass.Succeeded
member.summary: Gets or sets the success value for the background task.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Titling
member.summary: Glyph forms are substituted with a typographic form specifically designed for titles.

member.summary: Old style numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with a figure style that matches lowercase letters in height and color.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants
member.summary: Describes a font variant value for the Typography.Variants attached property.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Normal
member.summary: Default font behavior. Font scaling and positioning is normal.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Superscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a superscript glyph. Superscript is commonly used for footnotes.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Subscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a subscript glyph.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ordinal
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an ordinal glyph, or it may combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Ordinal forms are normally associated with numeric notation of an ordinal word, such as 1st for first.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Inferior
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an inferior glyph, or it may combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Inferior forms are typically used in chemical formulas or mathematical notation.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ruby
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a smaller Japanese Kana glyph. This is used to clarify the meaning of Kanji, which may be unfamiliar to the reader.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement
member.summary: Provides a framework of common APIs for objects that participate in UI and programmatic layout. FrameworkElement also defines APIs related to data binding, object tree, and object lifetime feature areas.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for FrameworkElement-derived classes.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight
member.summary: Gets the rendered height of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The height, in pixels, of the object. The default is 0. The default might be encountered if the object has not been loaded and undergone a layout pass.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth
member.summary: Gets the rendered width of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The width, in pixels, of the object. The default is 0. The default might be encountered if the object has not been loaded and undergone a layout pass.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.BaseUri
member.summary: Gets a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that represents the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for an XAML-constructed object at XAML load time. This property is useful for Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resolution at run time.
member.returns: The base for an object at XAML load time.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the data context for a FrameworkElement when it participates in data binding.
member.returns: The object to use as data context.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.FlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which text and other UI elements flow within any parent element that controls their layout.
member.returns: The direction that text and other elements flow within their parent element, as a value of the enumeration. The default value is LeftToRight.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested height of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The height, in pixels, of the object. The default is NaN. Except for the special NaN value, this value must be equal to or greater than 0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment characteristics that are applied to a FrameworkElement when it is composed in a layout parent, such as a panel or items control.
member.returns: A horizontal alignment setting, as a value of the enumeration. The default is Stretch.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets localization/globalization language information that applies to a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: A string specifying language and culture that follows the RFC 3066 / ISO 639-1 standards. For example, U.S. English is "en-US".

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer margin of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: Provides margin values for the object. The default value is a default Thickness with all properties (dimensions) equal to 0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MaxHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height constraint of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The maximum height of the object, in pixels. The default value is PositiveInfinity. This value can be any value equal to or greater than 0. PositiveInfinity is also valid.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width constraint of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The maximum width of the object, in pixels. The default is PositiveInfinity. This value can be any value equal to or greater than 0. PositiveInfinity is also valid.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MinHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum height constraint of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The minimum height of the object, in pixels. The default is 0. This value can be any value equal to or greater than 0. However, PositiveInfinity is not valid.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width constraint of a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The minimum width of the object, in pixels. The default is 0. This value can be any value equal to or greater than 0. However, PositiveInfinity is not valid.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifying name of the object. When a XAML processor creates the object tree from XAML markup, run-time code can refer to the XAML-declared object by this name.
member.returns: The name of the object, which must be a string that is valid in the XamlName Grammar. The default is an empty string.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object of this FrameworkElement in the object tree.
member.returns: The parent object of this object in the object tree.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Resources
member.summary: Gets the locally defined resource dictionary. In XAML, you can establish resource items as child object elements of a frameworkElement.Resources property element, through XAML implicit collection syntax.
member.returns: The current locally defined dictionary of resources, where each resource can be accessed by its key.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance Style that is applied for this object during rendering.
member.returns: The applied style for the object, if present; otherwise, null. The default for a default-constructed FrameworkElement is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary object value that can be used to store custom information about this object.
member.returns: The intended value. This property has no default value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Triggers
member.summary: Gets the collection of triggers for animations that are defined for a FrameworkElement.
member.returns: The collection of triggers for animations that are defined for this object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment characteristics that are applied to a FrameworkElement when it is composed in a parent object such as a panel or items control.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Width

member.summary: Provides the behavior for the Measure pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own Measure pass behavior.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement
member.summary: UIElement is a base class for most of the objects that have visual appearance and can process basic input in a user interface.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AllowDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether this UIElement can be a drop target for purposes of drag-and-drop operations.
member.returns: Ttrue if this UIElement can be a drop target for purposes of drag-and-drop operations; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CacheMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that rendered content should be cached when possible.
member.returns: A value that indicates that rendered content should be cached when possible. If you specify a value of CacheMode, rendering operations from RenderTransform and Opacity execute on the graphics processing unit (GPU), if available. The default is null, which does not enable a cached composition mode.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Clip
member.summary: Gets or sets the RectangleGeometry used to define the outline of the contents of a UIElement.
member.returns: The rectangle geometry to be used for clipping area sizing. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DesiredSize
member.summary: Gets the size that this UIElement computed during the measure pass of the layout process.
member.returns: The size that this UIElement computed during the measure pass of the layout process.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.IsDoubleTapEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the DoubleTapped event can originate from that element.
member.returns: True if DoubleTapped event can originate from that element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.IsHitTestVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the contained area of this UIElement can return true values for hit testing.
member.returns: True if the contained area of this UIElement can be used for hit testing; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.IsHoldingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Holding event can originate from that element.
member.returns: True if Holding event can originate from that element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.IsRightTapEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the RightTapped event can originate from that element.
member.returns: True if RightTapped event can originate from that element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.IsTapEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Tapped event can originate from that element.
member.returns: True if Tapped event can originate from that element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the ManipulationModes value used for UIElement behavior and interaction with gestures.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree of the object's opacity.
member.returns: A value between 0 and 1.0 that declares the opacity factor, with 1.0 meaning full opacity and 0 meaning transparent. The default value is 1.0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerCaptures
member.summary: Gets the set of all captured pointers, represented as Pointer values.
member.returns: The collection of captured pointers, each represented as a Pointer object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Projection
member.summary: Gets or sets the perspective projection (3-D effect) to apply when rendering this element.
member.returns: A projection effect applied to the element.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RenderSize
member.summary: Gets the final render size of a UIElement.
member.returns: The rendered size for this object. There is no default value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RenderTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets transform information that affects the rendering position of a UIElement.
member.returns: Describes the specifics of the desired render transform. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RenderTransformOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin point of any possible render transform declared by RenderTransform, relative to the bounds of the UIElement.
member.returns: The origin point of the render transform. The default value is a Point with value 0,0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Transitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of Transition style elements that apply to a UIElement.
member.returns: The strongly typed collection of Transition style elements that apply to a UIElement.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.UseLayoutRounding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether rendering for the object and its visual subtree should use rounding behavior that aligns rendering to whole pixels.
member.returns: True if rendering and layout should use layout rounding to whole pixels; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Visibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of a UIElement. A UIElement that is not visible is not rendered and does not communicate its desired size to layout.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration. The default value is Visible.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AddHandler(Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element. Specify handledEventsToo as true to have the provided handler be invoked for a routed event case that had already been marked as handled by another element along the event route.
member.param: An identifier for the routed event to be handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.

True to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data. False to register the handler with the default condition that it will not be invoked if the routed event is already marked handled. The default is false. Do not routinely ask to rehandle a routed event. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Arrange(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Positions child objects and determines a size for a UIElement. Parent objects that implement custom layout for their child elements should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The final size that the parent computes for the child in layout, provided as a Rect value.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CapturePointer(Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.Pointer)
member.summary: Sets pointer capture to a UIElement.
member.returns: True if the object has pointer capture; otherwise, false.
member.param: The pointer object reference.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.FindSubElementsForTouchTargeting(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Enables a UIElement subclass to expose child elements that assist with resolving touch targeting.
member.returns: A set of point sets. These represent the vertices of sub elements that are intersected by the given touch point (plus tolerance).
member.param: The point being touched.
The bounds used for touch tolerance.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for a UIElement. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which will occur asynchronously.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for a UIElement.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Measure(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Updates the DesiredSize of a UIElement. Typically, objects that implement custom layout for their layout children call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The available space that a parent can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, returns class-specific AutomationPeer implementations for the UI Automation infrastructure.
member.returns: The class-specific AutomationPeer subclass to return.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.OnDisconnectVisualChildren
member.summary: Override this method to implement how layout and logic should behave when items are removed from a class-specific content or children property.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ReleasePointerCapture(Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.Pointer)
member.summary: Releases pointer captures for capture of one specific pointer by this UIElement.
member.param: The pointer reference. Use either saved references from previous captures, or pointer event data, to obtain this reference.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ReleasePointerCaptures
member.summary: Releases all pointer captures held by this element.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RemoveHandler(Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object)

The specific handler implementation to remove from the event handler collection on this UIElement.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement.TransformToVisual(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)

member.returns: The transform information as an object. Call methods on this object to get a practical transform.
member.param: The object to compare to the current object for purposes of obtaining the transform.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount
member.summary: Contains values that are used by the IScrollProvider pattern to indicate the direction and distance to scroll.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large decrements, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE UP key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE UP key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible window.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small decrements, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.NoAmount
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling should not be performed.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large increments, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE DOWN key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE DOWN key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible region.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small increments, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.summary: Describes the notification characteristics of a particular live region in an app UI.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Off
member.summary: The element does not send notifications if the content of the live region has changed.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Polite
member.summary: The element sends non-interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, clients and are expected to not interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Assertive
member.summary: The element sends interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, clients and are expected to interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.Background

member.returns: The brush that provides the background of the control. The default is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.BorderBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets a brush that describes the border background of a control.
member.returns: The brush that is used to fill the control's border; the default is null.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.BorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the border thickness of a control.
member.returns: The border thickness of a control, as a Thickness value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em.
member.returns: The uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em. The default is 0. Positive values increase tracking and loosen character spacing. Negative values decrease tracking and tighten the character spacing.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.DefaultStyleKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the key that references the default style for the control.
member.returns: The key that references the default style for the control. To work correctly as part of theme style lookup, this value is expected to be the System.Type (TypeName in C++) of the control being styled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FocusState
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether this control has focus, and the mode by which focus was obtained.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration. A value of Unfocused indicates that the control does not have focus.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used to display text in the control.
member.returns: The font used to display text in the control.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the text in this control.
member.returns: The size of the text in the Control.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FontStretch

member.returns: One of the values that specifies the degree to which a font is condensed or expanded on the screen. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style in which the text is rendered.
member.returns: One of the values that specifies the style in which the text is rendered. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the specified font.
member.returns: One of the values that specifies the thickness of the specified font. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets a brush that describes the foreground color.
member.returns: The brush that paints the foreground of the control. The default value is a SolidColorBrush with color of Black.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.HorizontalContentAlignment

member.returns: One of the HorizontalAlignment values. The default is Center.

member.returns: True if the user can interact with the control; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.IsTabStop

member.returns: True if the control is included in tab navigation; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.Padding

member.returns: The amount of space between the content of a Control and its Margin or Border. The default is a Thickness with values of 0 on all four sides.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.TabIndex

member.returns: A value that determines the order of logical navigation for a device. The default value is MaxValue.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.TabNavigation

member.returns: A value of the enumeration. The default is Local.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em.
member.returns: The uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em. The default is 0. Positive values increase tracking and loosen character spacing. Negative values decrease tracking and tighten the character spacing.

member.summary: Gets a TextPointer that indicates the end of content in the RichTextBlock.
member.returns: A TextPointer that indicates the end of content in the RichTextBlock.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.ContentStart

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred top-level font family for the text content in this element.
member.returns: A FontFamily object that specifies the preferred font family, or a primary preferred font family with one or more fallback font families. For information about defaults, see the FontFamily class topic.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the text content in this element.
member.returns: A non-negative value that specifies the font size, measured in pixels. The default is 11.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.FontStretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the font stretch for the text content in this element.
member.returns: The requested font stretch, as a FontStretch constant. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the font style for the content in this element.
member.returns: The requested font style, which is a FontStyle enumeration named constant. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the top-level font weight for the RichTextBlock.
member.returns: The requested font weight, which is a FontWeight that is obtained from one of the FontWeights property values. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush to apply to the text contents of the RichTextBlock.
member.returns: The brush used to apply to the text contents. The default is a SolidColorBrush with a Color value of Black.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.HasOverflowContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the RichTextBlock has content that extends into an existing OverflowContentTarget element.
member.returns: True if the RichTextBlock has content that extends into an existing OverflowContentTarget element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.IsTextSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether text content of the RichTextBlock can be selected for clipboard or drag purposes, or for UI styling changes that indicate selected text.
member.returns: True if text content of the RichTextBlock can be selected for clipboard or drag purposes. False if text cannot be selected. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.LineHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of each line of content.
member.returns: The height of each line in pixels. A value of 0 indicates that the line height is determined automatically from the current font characteristics. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock.LineStackingStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how a line box is determined for each line of text in the RichTextBlock.
member.returns: A value that indicates how a line box is determined for each line of text in the RichTextBlock. The default is MaxHeight.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to a RichTextBlockOverflow that is the linked target for any text overflow from this RichTextBlock.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of a scrollbar within a ScrollViewer control.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Disabled
member.summary: A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the ScrollViewer parent. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary: A ScrollBar appears and the dimension of the ScrollViewer is applied to the content when the viewport cannot display all of the content. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. The dimension of the ScrollViewer is not applied to the content.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary: A ScrollBar always appears. The dimension of the ScrollViewer is applied to the content. For a horizontal ScrollBar, the width of the content is set to the ViewportWidth of the ScrollViewer. For a vertical ScrollBar, the height of the content is set to the ViewportHeight of the ScrollViewer.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsDeferredScrollingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the deferred scrolling behavior for a ScrollViewer.
member.returns: True if deferred scrolling should occur; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsHorizontalRailEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the scroll rail is enabled for the horizontal axis.
member.returns: True to enable the horizontal scroll rail; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsHorizontalScrollChainingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scroll chaining is enabled from this child to its parent, for the horizontal axis.
member.returns: True to enable horizontal scroll chaining from child to parent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsScrollInertiaEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scroll actions should include inertia in their behavior and value.
member.returns: True if scroll actions should include inertia in their behavior and value; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsVerticalRailEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the scroll rail is enabled for the vertical axis.
member.returns: True to enable the vertical scroll rail; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsVerticalScrollChainingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scroll chaining is enabled from this child to its parent, for the vertical axis.
member.returns: True to enable vertical scroll chaining from child to parent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsZoomChainingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether zoom chaining is enabled from this child to its parent.
member.returns: True to enable zoom chaining from child to parent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.IsZoomInertiaEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether zoom actions should include inertia in their behavior and value.
member.returns: True if zoom actions should include inertia in their behavior and value; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum permitted run-time value of ZoomFactor.
member.returns: The maximum permitted run-time value of ZoomFactor. The default is 10.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MinZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the minimum permitted run-time value of ZoomFactor.
member.returns: The minimum permitted run-time value of ZoomFactor. The default is 0.1.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableHeight
member.summary: Gets a value that represents the vertical size of the area that can be scrolled; the difference between the width of the extent and the width of the viewport.
member.returns: The vertical size of the area that can be scrolled. This property has no default value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableWidth
member.summary: Gets a value that represents the horizontal size of the area that can be scrolled; the difference between the width of the extent and the width of the viewport.
member.returns: The horizontal size of the area that can be scrolled. This property has no default value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the vertical offset of the scrolled content.
member.returns: The vertical offset of the scrolled content.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a vertical ScrollBar should be displayed.
member.returns: A ScrollBarVisibility value that indicates whether a vertical ScrollBar should be displayed. The default value is Visible.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how manipulation input influences scrolling behavior on the vertical axis.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration. The typical default (as set through the default template, not class initialization) is Rails.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalSnapPointsAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how the existing snap points are vertically aligned versus the initial viewport.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalSnapPointsType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that declares how manipulation behavior reacts to the snap points along the vertical axis.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight
member.summary: Gets a value that contains the vertical size of the viewable content.
member.returns: The vertical size of the viewable content. This property has no default value.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth
member.summary: Gets a value that contains the horizontal size of the viewable content.
member.returns: The horizontal size of the viewable content. The default value is 0.0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the current zoom factor engaged for content scaling.
member.returns: The current zoom factor engaged for content scaling. The default is 1.0, where 1.0 indicates no additional scaling.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ZoomMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether zoom behavior in the ScrollViewer content is enabled.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ZoomSnapPoints
member.summary: Gets the observable collection of zoom snap point factors that are held by the ScrollViewer.
member.returns: A collection of Single values that represent zoom factors as snap points.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ZoomSnapPointsType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how zoom snap points are processed for interaction input.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom
member.summary: Represents a scrollable control that incorporates two views that have a semantic relationship. For example, the ZoomedOutView might be an index of titles, and the ZoomedInView might include details and summaries for each of the title entries. Views can be changed using zoom or other interactions.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SemanticZoom class.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.CanChangeViews
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that declares whether the SemanticZoom can change display views.
member.returns: True if views can be changed; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.IsZoomedInViewActive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the ZoomedInView is the active view.
member.returns: True if the ZoomedInView is the active view. False if the ZoomedOutView is the active view.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedInView
member.summary: Gets or sets the semantically more complete zoomed-in view of the SemanticZoom.
member.returns: An object that implements ISemanticZoomInfo. Typically this is a practical ListViewBase implementation such as GridView.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedOutView
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoomed-out view of the SemanticZoom.
member.returns: An object that implements ISemanticZoomInfo. Typically this is a practical ListViewBase implementation such as GridView.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ToggleActiveView
member.summary: Changes from the current active view to the other possible view. For example, if IsZoomedInViewActive is true, calling this method changes to zoomed-out view.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ViewChangeCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a view change is complete and the view is displayed.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ViewChangeStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a view change is requested.

member.returns: The identifier for the CanChangeViews dependency property.

member.summary: Describes the direction that content is scaled.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.StretchDirection.UpOnly
member.summary: The content scales upward only when it is smaller than the parent. If the content is larger, no scaling downward is performed.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.StretchDirection.DownOnly
member.summary: The content scales downward only when it is larger than the parent. If the content is smaller, no scaling upward is performed.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.StretchDirection.Both
member.summary: The content stretches to fit the parent according to the Stretch property.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBlock.BaselineOffset
member.summary: Returns a value by which each line of text is offset from a baseline.
member.returns: The amount by which each line of text is offset from the baseline, in device independent pixels. System.Double.NaN indicates that an optimal baseline offset is automatically calculated from the current font characteristics. The default is System.Double.NaN.

member.summary: Gets or sets the uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em.
member.returns: The uniform spacing between characters, in units of 1/1000 of an em. The default is 0. Positive values increase tracking and loosen character spacing. Negative values decrease tracking and tighten the character spacing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the text content in this element.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that the Thumb moved a specified distance, as determined by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.Last

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.EndScroll

member.returns: The UI element that "owns" this TextPointer.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer.GetCharacterRect(Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.LogicalDirection)
member.summary: Returns a bounding box for content that borders the current TextPointer in the specified logical direction.
member.returns: A Rect for content that borders the current TextPointer in the specified direction, or a Rect that evaluates as Empty if current and valid layout information is unavailable.
member.param: One of the LogicalDirection values that specifies the logical direction in which to find a content bounding box.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer.GetPositionAtOffset(System.Int32,Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.LogicalDirection)
member.summary: Returns a TextPointer to the position indicated by the specified offset, in symbols, from the beginning of the current TextPointer and in the specified direction.
member.returns: A TextPointer to the position indicated by the specified offset and in the direction specified by the direction parameter, or null if the offset extends past the end of the content.
member.param: An offset, in symbols, for which to calculate and return the position. If the offset is negative, the returned TextPointer precedes the current TextPointer; otherwise, it follows.
One of the LogicalDirection values that specifies the logical direction of the returned TextPointer.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography
member.summary: Provides access to a set of Microsoft OpenType typography properties. These properties are implemented as XAML attached properties such that they can be set from text object model properties as well as from specific text controls.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.AnnotationAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the index of an alternate annotation form.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.Capitals
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontCapitals value that indicates the capital form of the selected font.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.CapitalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether inter-glyph spacing for all-capital text is globally adjusted to improve readability.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.CaseSensitiveForms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether glyphs adjust their vertical position to better align with uppercase glyphs.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.ContextualAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether custom glyph forms can be used based upon the context of the text being rendered.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.ContextualLigatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether contextual ligatures are enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.ContextualSwashes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the index of a contextual swashes form.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.DiscretionaryLigatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether discretionary ligatures are enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.EastAsianExpertForms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the standard Japanese font forms have been replaced with the corresponding preferred typographic forms.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.EastAsianLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontEastAsianLanguage value that indicates glyphs used for a specific writing system or language.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.EastAsianWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontEastAsianWidths value that indicates the proportional width for Latin characters in an East Asian font.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.Fraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontFraction value that indicates the fraction style.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.HistoricalForms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether historical forms are enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.HistoricalLigatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether historical ligatures are enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.Kerning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether kerning is enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.MathematicalGreek
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether standard typographic font forms of Greek glyphs have been replaced with corresponding font forms commonly used in mathematical notation.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.NumeralAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontNumeralAlignment value that indicates the alignment of widths for numerals.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.NumeralStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a FontNumeralStyle value that determines the set of glyphs that are used to render numeric alternate font forms.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.SlashedZero
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a nominal zero font form should be replaced with a slashed zero.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.StandardLigatures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether standard ligatures are enabled.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.StandardSwashes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the index of a standard swashes form.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents.Typography.StylisticAlternates

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting
member.summary: Provides services that are relevant for XAML design surfaces that are hosted in a larger application.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.IXamlUIPresenterHost
member.summary: Represents a service that resolves resources from an application. This interface is used for design tool hosting scenarios and is not intended for general use.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.IXamlUIPresenterHost.ResolveFileResource(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a resource that is specified by a path and returns a string filename.
member.returns: The resolved file name.
member.param: The local path to resolve.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter
member.summary: Enables presenting a visual tree on a Microsoft Direct3D surface.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.CompleteTimelinesAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the host wants timelines to always run to end.
member.returns: True to always run timelines to end. Otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.RootElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the root visual element to draw to the surface.
member.returns: The element to draw.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.ThemeKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the string key that identifies the theme set to use from ThemeResourcesXaml.
member.returns: A string key.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.ThemeResourcesXaml
member.summary: Gets or sets the XAML that specifies a resource dictionary. The resource dictionary contains themes that the host should resolve and that should be applied to the content.
member.returns: A XAML resource dictionary specified in string form.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.NotifyWindowSizeChanged
member.summary: Invokes the SizeChanged event on Window.Current. Used by hosts to propagate size changes from host settings to user code, so that a design mode interaction can be differentiated from a run time interaction.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.Present
member.summary: Presents the surface, as a synchronous call for the host.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.Render
member.summary: Renders the surface. Intended for asynchronous calls via a timer.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.SetHost(Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.IXamlUIPresenterHost)
member.summary: Specifies the IXamlUIPresenterHost service implementation to use for application resource resolution.
member.param: A service implementation.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlUIPresenter.SetSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the width and height of the surface.
member.param: A width in pixels.
A height in pixels.

member.name: N:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input
member.summary: Defines the input and input event infrastructure for apps and UI elements.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the DoubleTapped event.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides event data for the DoubleTapped event.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: True to mark the routed event handled. False to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs.PointerDeviceType
member.summary: Gets the PointerDeviceType for the pointer device that initiated the associated input event.
member.returns: The PointerDeviceType for this event occurrence.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.DoubleTappedRoutedEventArgs.GetPosition(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.returns: A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If null was passed as relativeTo, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a non-null relativeTo was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager
member.summary: A helper class that enables determining which element of a UI has the current focus. The class has a single method, GetFocusedElement.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GetFocusedElement
member.summary: Queries the focus system to determine which object in the UI has focus.
member.returns: The object that currently has focus. Typically, this is a Control class.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.HoldingEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the Holding event.

member.summary: Provides event data for the Holding event.
