member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: True to mark the routed event handled. False to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.HoldingRoutedEventArgs.HoldingState
member.summary: Gets the underlying HoldingState for the interaction
member.returns: A value of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.HoldingRoutedEventArgs.PointerDeviceType

member.returns: True if this command can be executed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Occurs when changes occur that affect whether the command should execute.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the pointer position for this event occurrence, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.returns: A PointerPoint value that represents the pointer point associated with this event. If null was passed as relativeTo, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a non-null relativeTo was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetIntermediatePoints(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the historical pointer positions for this event occurrence, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.returns: A list of PointerPoint values that represent the intermediate, historical pointer points associated with this event. If null was passed as relativeTo, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a non-null relativeTo was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.
member.param: Any UIElement-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox
member.summary: The coordinate system is relative to a bounding box: 0 indicates 0 percent of the bounding box, and 1 indicates 100 percent of the bounding box. For example, (0.5, 0.5) describes a point in the middle of the bounding box, and (1, 1) describes a point at the lower right of the bounding box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. A skew transform can be useful for creating the illusion of three-dimensional depth in a two-dimensional object.
member.returns: The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. The default is 0.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.CompositeTransform.SkewY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. A skew transform can be useful for creating the illusion of three-dimensional depth in a two-dimensional object.
member.returns: The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. The default is 0.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of PathFigure objects contained in a Geometry are combined to form the area of the Geometry.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinearGradientBrush class that has the specified GradientStopCollection and angle.
member.param: The GradientStops to set on this brush.

A System.Double that represents the angle, in degrees, of the gradient. A value of 0 creates a horizontal gradient, and a value of 90 creates a vertical gradient. Negative values are permitted, as are values over 360 (which are treated as mod 360).

member.summary: Describes the likelihood that the media engine can play a media source based on its file type and characteristics.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaCanPlayResponse.NotSupported
member.summary: Media engine cannot support the media source.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaCanPlayResponse.Maybe
member.summary: Media engine might support the media source.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaCanPlayResponse.Probably
member.summary: Media engine can probably support the media source.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState
member.summary: Defines the potential states of a MediaElement object.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Closed
member.summary: The MediaElement contains no media. The MediaElement displays a transparent frame.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Opening
member.summary: The MediaElement is validating and attempting to open the specified by its Source property. While in this state, the MediaElement queues any Play, Pause, or Stop commands that it receives and processes them if the media is successfully opened.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Buffering
member.summary: The MediaElement is loading the media for playback. Its Position does not advance during this state. If the MediaElement was already playing video, it continues to display the last displayed frame.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Playing
member.summary: The MediaElement is playing the media specified by its source property. Its Position advances forward.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Paused
member.summary: The MediaElement does not advance its Position. If the MediaElement was playing video, it continues to display the current frame.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Stopped
member.summary: The MediaElement contains media but is not playing or paused. Its Position is 0 and does not advance. If the loaded media is video, the MediaElement displays the first frame.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap
member.summary: Describes the shape at the end of a line or segment.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Flat
member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line. Comparable to no line cap.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Square
member.summary: A rectangle that has a height equal to the line thickness and a length equal to half the line thickness.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose base length is equal to the thickness of the line.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin
member.summary: Describes the shape that joins two lines or segments.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Line joins use beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Line joins use rounded vertices.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection
member.summary: Represents a perspective transform (a 3-D-like effect) on an object.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PlaneProjection class.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. The default is 0. Values greater than 0 correspond to coordinates in front of the plane of the object, and negative values correspond to coordinates behind the plane of the object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.GlobalOffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that the object is translated along the x-axis of the screen.
member.returns: The distance that the object is translated along the x-axis of the screen.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.GlobalOffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that the object is translated along the y-axis of the screen.
member.returns: The distance that the object is translated along the y-axis of the screen.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.GlobalOffsetZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that the object is translated along the z-axis of the screen.
member.returns: The distance that the object is translated along the z-axis of the screen.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.LocalOffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that the object is translated along the x-axis of the plane of the object.
member.returns: The distance that the object is translated along the x-axis of the plane of the object.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.LocalOffsetY

member.summary: Initiates the set of animations associated with the storyboard.

member.summary: Gets the clock state of the Storyboard.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values. Can be: Active, Filling, or Stopped.

member.summary: Gets the current animation clock time of the Storyboard.
member.returns: The current animation time of the Storyboard per the running animation clock, or null if the animation clock is Stopped.

member.summary: Gets the value of the Storyboard.TargetName XAML attached property from a target element.
member.returns: The Storyboard.TargetName value of the target element.
member.param: The target element from which to get the value.

member.summary: Gets the value of the Storyboard.TargetProperty XAML attached property from a target element.
member.returns: The Storyboard.TargetProperty value of the target element.
member.param: The target element from which to get the value.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the animation clock associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the animation clock, or run-time state, associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Seek(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position. The storyboard performs the requested seek when the next clock tick occurs.
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SeekAlignedToLastTick(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position immediately (synchronously).
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTarget(Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Causes the specified Timeline to target the specified object.
member.param: The timeline that targets the specified dependency object.
The actual instance of the object to target.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTargetName(Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the Storyboard.TargetName XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element to set the value for.
The Storyboard.TargetName value of the target element to set. This should correspond to an existing Name or x:Name value on the element that the animation targets.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTargetProperty(Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the Storyboard.TargetProperty XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element for which to set the value.

The Storyboard.TargetProperty value of the target element to set. This specifies a qualification path that is used by an internal type conversion in order to target the dependency property where the animation applies. See Remarks.

member.summary: Advances the current time of the storyboard's clock to the end of its active period.

member.name: T:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline
member.summary: Defines a segment of time.

member.name: M:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for Timeline-derived classes.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AllowDependentAnimations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the timeline should be permitted to run on properties where the animation is considered a dependent animation.
member.returns: True if the timeline can and should run when used for dependent animation property cases. Otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the timeline plays in reverse after it completes a forward iteration.
member.returns: True if the timeline plays in reverse at the end of each iteration; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which this Timeline should begin.
member.returns: The start time of the time line. The default value is zero. If you are programming using C# or Visual Basic, the parameter type of this parameter is projected as System.TimeSpan? (a nullable System.TimeSpan).

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time for which this timeline plays, not counting repetitions.
member.returns: The timeline's simple duration: the amount of time this timeline takes to complete a single forward iteration. The default value is a Duration that evaluates as Automatic.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the animation behaves after it reaches the end of its active period.
member.returns: A value that specifies how the timeline behaves after it reaches the end of its active period but its parent is inside its active or fill period. The default value is HoldEnd.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the repeating behavior of this timeline.
member.returns: An iteration Count that specifies the number of times the timeline should play, a TimeSpan value that specifies the total length of this timeline's active period, or the special value Forever, which specifies that the timeline should repeat indefinitely. The default value is a RepeatBehavior with a Count value of 1, which indicates that the timeline plays once.

member.name: P:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate, relative to its parent, at which time progresses for this Timeline.
member.returns: A finite value greater than 0 that specifies the rate at which time progresses for this timeline, relative to the speed of the timeline's parent. If this timeline is a root timeline, specifies the default timeline speed. The value is expressed as a factor where 1 represents normal speed, 2 is double speed, 0.5 is half speed, and so on. The default value is 1.

member.name: E:Windows.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Completed
member.summary: Occurs when the Storyboard object has completed playing.

member.summary: Specifies caching characteristics for a page involved in a navigation.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Disabled
member.summary: The page is never cached and a new instance of the page is created on each visit.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Required
member.summary: The page is cached and the cached instance is reused for every visit regardless of the cache size for the frame.

member.name: F:Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Enabled
member.summary: The page is cached, but the cached instance is discarded when the size of the cache for the frame is exceeded.

member.summary: An unexpected client-side error has occurred.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.UnexpectedServerError
member.summary: An unexpected server-side error has occurred.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.MultipleChoices
member.summary: The requested URL represents a high level grouping of which lower level selections need to be made.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.MovedPermanently
member.summary: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.Found
member.summary: The resource was found but is available in a location different from the one included in the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.SeeOther
member.summary: The response to the request can be found under another URI using a GET method.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.NotModified
member.summary: Indicates the resource has not been modified since last requested.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.UseProxy
member.summary: The requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: The requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.BadRequest
member.summary: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.Unauthorized
member.summary: Authentication has failed or credentials have not yet been provided.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.Forbidden
member.summary: The server has refused the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.NotFound
member.summary: The requested resource could not be found but may be available again in the future.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.NotAcceptable
member.summary: The requested resource is only capable of generating content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.RequestTimeout
member.summary: The server timed out waiting for the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.Conflict
member.summary: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.Gone
member.summary: Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.LengthRequired
member.summary: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Provided URI length exceeds the maximum length the server can process.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: The client has asked for a portion of the file, but the server cannot supply that portion.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.InternalServerError
member.summary: A generic error message, given when no more specific message is suitable.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.NotImplemented
member.summary: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.BadGateway
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server is currently unavailable.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:Windows.Web.WebErrorStatus.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request.

member.name: N:Windows.Web.AtomPub
member.summary: Enables HTTP CRUD access to Web resources using the AtomPub protocol. The AtomPub sample demonstrates this implementation.

member.name: T:Windows.Web.AtomPub.AtomPubClient
member.summary: Encapsulates the methods needed to implement the AtomPub protocol which enables HTTP CRUD access to Web resources using the Atom 1.0 wire format.
member.capability: Required to access the Internet.
Required to access home and work networks (Intranet).

The value of the header.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.AtomPub.AtomPubClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait for any of the asynchronous operations to complete. If the operation is not complete within this amount of time, it will fail with a status code indicating that it timed out.
member.returns: Default value is 30000 (30 seconds). A value of UInt32.MaxValue indicates that the syndication client will wait indefinitely for a response.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.FirstUri
member.summary: Gets the first Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) in a sequence. This property represents the atom:link element with attribute rel=”first”.
member.returns: The atom:link element with attribute rel="first". This property is the absolute resolved against the xml:base attribute, if it is present. If the href attribute is a relative string and there is no xml:base attribute, this property will be null because the relative is not supported by the runtime class.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Generator

member.param: The format of the data.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.IconUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the image for the feed. This property represents the atom:icon element.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.LastUri
member.summary: Gets the last Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) in the sequence. This property represents the atom:link element with attribute rel=”last”.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Links

member.summary: Creates a SyndicationPerson object.

member.name: M:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationPerson.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a SyndicationPerson object with the specified Name, Email, and Uri property values.
member.param: The name of the SyndicationPerson. This parameter represents the atom:name element.
Gets or sets the email address of the person. This property represents the atom:email element.

Gets or sets the of the person. This property represents the atom:uri element. It is the absolute URI resolved against the xml:base attribute, if it is present. If the href attribute is a relative URI string and there is no xml:base attribute, this property is NULL because relative URI is not supported by the runtime URI class.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.SyndicationPerson.Uri
member.summary: Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the person. This property represents the atom:uri element. It is the absolute Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resolved against the xml:base attribute, if it is present. If the href attribute is a relative Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) string and there is no xml:base attribute, this property is NULL because the relative Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is not supported by the runtime Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) class.
member.returns: The of the person.

member.name: T:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient
member.summary: Encapsulates the data and methods needed to retrieve feeds from a URI asynchronously. It supports authentication.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.BypassCacheOnRetrieve
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that indicates whether cache will be bypassed when retrieving the feed.
member.returns: TRUE if the cache should be bypassed; otherwise FALSE.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.MaxResponseBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes to buffer when receiving a response from a server.
member.returns: Maximum size and default is UInt32.MaxValue.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.ProxyCredential
member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials to use when making requests using a proxy.
member.returns: Initially, this value is a username/password tuple. For domain credentials, the username is in domain\user form.

member.name: M:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.RetrieveFeedAsync(Windows.Foundation.Uri)
member.summary: Initiates an asynchronous operation to download the syndication feed from the given URI. This method instantiates a SyndicationFeed object from the feed string, which can be in one of the formats specified in SyndicationFormat.
member.returns: Contains the results of the operation.
member.param: The URI from which the feed is downloaded.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.ServerCredential
member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials to use when making requests to the server.
member.returns: Initally, this value is a username/password tuple. For domain credentials, the username is in domain\user form.

member.name: M:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.SetRequestHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets an HTTP header for the request. This method can be called multiple times to set multiple headers. When the same header is set multiple times, the values will be concatenated and separated by ,.
member.param: The name of the header.
The value of the header.

member.name: P:Windows.Web.Syndication.ISyndicationClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait for any of the asynchronous operations to complete. If the operation is not complete within this amount of time, it will fail with a status code indicating that it timed out.
member.returns: Default value is 30000 (30 seconds). A value of UInt32.MaxValue indicates that the syndication client will wait indefinitely for a response.
